story:
We are raising funds to launch a nomadic artist run centre exclusively for young and emerging artists living in Toronto. Younger Than BeyoncéGallery will program monthly pop-up shows in spaces throughout Toronto, including short art exhibitions, artist talks, and a performance art night celebrating emergent and experimental practices.

In 2009 the New Museum in New York held its first triennial of emerging artists called "Younger Than Jesus,”showcasing work by artists younger then 33. The show was controversial because it focused on a generation that has been defined by their habits of consumption rather than production. Five years later, Younger Than Beyoncéis being born, a nomadic, D.I.Y.  response to this landmark exhibition.

We are starting a temporary project gallery for artists at the beginning stages of their career in order to foster a community and to support artists at the same stage we are. We hope to not only showcase work by artists at the early stages of their careers but to adopt programming in response to the situations affecting younger artists in Toronto.

Younger Than Beyonce is a gallery for emergent and experimental art practices. We are creating a discursive space for critical conversations and risk-taking through new configurations of audience, artists, and community.

As young artists in Toronto we are searching for a place in our cultural landscape. Toronto has a thriving arts scene for established and mid-career artists but it is a difficult place for young artists to get recognized. In the past, young artists would have held their first shows in artist run centres and other grassroots arts organizations, but as these institutions have become more established they have become more focused on programming big names in Canadian art.  Few galleries are looking towards the next generation with curiosity and anticipation. Younger Than Beyoncé explores what our generation is making by giving young artists space in which to experiment, take risks, and build a professional practice. We need your support to give these artists a platform to be seen, discussed, and celebrated. Co-directors Marjan Verstappen and Humboldt Magnussen are looking for emerging experimental art practices in all mediums that are representative of must-see work by younger artists.

We are without grants or institutional or corporate sponsorship because we are still getting ourselves off the ground. The rent for the space and for the show will be largely made up of contributions to this Indiegogo campaign, and our fundraising events. By contributing to this campaign you will help create a professional space dedicated to young artists and curators.

Make it happen:

  • Give $10, $25 or even more to our campaign!

  • Share this campaign link on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram using #ytbgallery

  • Ask at least one person in your circle to donate $25!

If 120 people give $25, we can fund our campaign


What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $3,000 which is enough for us to pay rent, buy lightblubs, promotional materials (posters), snacks, paint and building supplies, and pay our artists. By supporting our campaign you make it possible for a empty unused space to become a lab for creation and experimentation. The money goes towards programming and making sure the artist exhibiting in our galley get a professional looking show.
We have amazing perks for donors, including personalized mugs and tote bags, pizza parties, and original artwork. 

The Impact

As a teenager in art school, I once asked a visiting artist what you had to do to make it in the art world.  He said "with that I can't really advise you, the art world changes so much between generations, the best people to ask are your peers." 

For me, it was a revelation.  As young artists, we don't have to "make it" in the art world so much as we have to create our own.  We don't have to fit in to anything, we need to create our own institutions that support our artistic goals and interests. That's why Toronto needs Younger Than Beyoncé Gallery.

After basic training, young artists have to support their own art career for about ten years before they become recognized "emerged" artists.  During this time, most artists have to support themselves through alternative jobs and make art in their spare time (and mostly in their bedrooms.)  As recent MFA graduates, we spend our days out hustling and we are in a privileged position to create a new arts community in Toronto.  Most young artists stop creating artwork because they become disillusioned with the art world and feel they will never be acknowledged for their hard work.  At present, in Toronto, there are many, many talented young artists who are not being represented by the mature gallery scene.  Younger than Beyoncé provides a much-needed platform for artists starting out in Toronto.

Risks & Challenges

Our greatest risk is that we will burn out financially and physically. We don't expect to make any profit from this, but if this campaign is successful we will be able to pay our artists and ourselves.

Other Ways You Can Help

Make some noise and spread the world. If you want to see more space for emerging artists. By sharing this campaign you will greatly help us by not only letting your friends know of this gallery but also by getting the conversation on how to give emerging artist practices greater attention. Use the indiegogo share tool, Facebook, Instagram and Twitter.  Most importantly tell your friends.

story:
ENGLISH

SoapUp® is the new soap holder. It is designed to hold the soap above the sink. A new concept for all places and for all people: able bodied, children or disabled.

An Italian patented product, 100% Made in Italy.

ITALIAN

SoapUp® è il nuovo portasapone che sospende la saponetta sul lavandino, un nuovo concetto pensato per tutti i luoghi e per tutte le persone: normodotati, bambini, diversamente abili.

Un brevetto d'invenzione registrato. 100% Made in Italy.

 

HOW IS IT MADE ?

SoapUp® is simple but brilliant!

SoapUp® consists of three parts:

  • a stainless steel wire, ending with a slot that makes SoapUp® adjustable to various kind of tap;

  • a colored no-slip gripper, to decorate and to prevent SoapUp® slipping away;

  • a stainless steel pin, designed specifically for SoapUp® that makes SoapUp® easily rechargeable.

DI COSA SI COMPONE ?

SoapUp® è un'idea semplice, ma geniale!

Si compone di pochi elementi:

  • un cavetto in acciaio inox che rende SoapUp® adattabile al vostro rubinetto semplicemente allargando o stringendo l'asola con cui termina;
  • un tubicino colorato di rivestimento, che oltre a darvi la possibilità di scegliere il colore più adatto al vostro ambiente, assicura SoapUp® al rubinetto, impedendogli di scivolare;
  • un perno, sempre in acciaio inox, progettato appositamente per SoapUp® e che lo rende facilmente ricaricabile.

                              

 READY TO USE

SoapUp® is provided with a first white musk soap bar, and It is ready to use: just open the packaging, hang SoapUp® to the tap and start washing your hands!

SoapUp® holds the soap above the sink, so it is always available.

SoapUp® keeps the soap dry giving to it a long life. Dirt and waste are eliminated!

PRONTO ALL'USO 

SoapUp®, fornito con una prima saponetta al muschio bianco, è subito pronto all'uso: vi basterà aprire la confezione in cartone riciclato ed applicarlo al vostro rubinetto.

Lontano dall'acqua il vostro sapone avrà una lunga vita! Non si deteriora, non crea sporcizia ed è sempre a portata di mano.

ACCESSORIES

SoapUp® can be used with specific tubular bracket in polished stainless steel.

The bracket is equipped with 3M double-sided adhesive. It is easy to apply and there is no need to make any hole in the wall.

Three differents brackets:

  • wall bracket;

  • counter top bracket;

  • shower bracket.

Available with round or square base. You can adapt it to every environment: ideal for the bathroom, shower and kitchen.

ACCESSORI 

Se il rubinetto non è adatto, SoapUp® può essere utilizzato con le specifiche staffe in acciaio inox. Si apllicano sul piano o a parete senza forare, grazie al biadesivo 3M in dotazione.

Tre staffe differenti:

  • staffa da parete;

  • staffa top;

  • staffa doccia.

Realizzate ad hoc per la parete o per il piano di bagno e cucina o per l'uso in doccia. Disponibili nella versione a base quadrata o rotonda.

Appendere il vostro SoapUp® sarà semplicissimo!

COLORS

SoapUp® is available in 8 colors. Choose the one that best suits in your environment!

COLORI

Avete la possibilità di scegliere SoapUp® in uno degli 8 colori da noi selezionati, quello che maggiormente preferite o che meglio si integra al vostro ambiente!

WHY SoapUp® ?

SoapUp® improves the daily act of washing hands. It's a whole new way to think about soap.

The benefits of use are obvious

  •  the soap stays always clean and dry and it is no longer in contact with any surface;
  • no more problem of dirt and waste;
  • the soap is always ready to use;

SoapUp® returns the pleasure to wash hands with solid soap.

PERCHE' SoapUp® ?

Un oggetto che migliora il gesto quotidiano di lavarsi le mani, un nuovo concetto pensato per tutti.

I vantaggi del suo utilizzo sono evidenti:

  • il sapone rimane sempre asciutto e pulito e non viene più appoggiato su una superficie;
  • SoapUp® risolve i problemi di sporco e riduce gli sprechi: la vostra saponetta durerà molto più a lungo;
  • la saponetta è sempre pronta all’uso;
  • si propone un accessorio di design, innovativo ed in linea con la filosofia dell’ecosostenibilità.

MADE IN ITALY

SoapUp® is an Italian idea. We provide only selected quality soap, organic, 100% made in Italy which do not include palm or coconut oil.

Our first fragrance is "white musk", but we are working to offer you more.

Discover Italy with us, through its artisan handmade soaps!

MADE IN ITALY

SoapUp® è un' idea italiana ed è nostra volontà associare saponi italiani prodotti da eccellenze artigiane locali, per promuovere il made in Italy e garantirvi una saponetta di altissima qualità.

Abbiamo cominciato con una prima fragranza, il muschio bianco, ma stiamo già lavorando per offrirvi tante novità.

Scopri con noi l’Italia attraverso i suoi saponi artigianali!


ECO - FRIENDLY

SoapUp® respects the environment and hates the waste!

The packaging is reduced to a minimun and made from 100% recycled materials.

SoapUp® can replace the liquid soap in favor of solid one and it will reduce drastically the consumption of plastic dispenser.

ECO - FRIENDLY

SoapUp® rispetta l’ambiente ed odia gli sprechi!

Il packaging è ridotto al minimo e realizzato in materiali riciclati. SoapUp® può sostituire l'utilizzo del sapone liquido e ridurre il consumo dei dosatori in plastica.

THE INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN

SoapUp® is an Italian designed object, born 2 years ago and developed in Novara.

The team is composed of 4 people with complementary backgrounds and educations.

Marisa Zenone, the SoapUp® creator. She is a designer, artisan and artist who’s always been fascinated by experimentation usage of different materials. Gisella Facta with a long experience in sales and commercial activity, and the two youngest Elena Gallarate, graduate student in economics with her distinctive blue hair, and the sporty Luca Barbero, with a degree in architecture.

LA CAMPAGNA SU INDIEGOGO

SoapUp® è un progetto completamente italiano, nato e sviluppato nella provincia di Novara e che ha visto muovere i suoi primi passi 2 anni fa.

Il team di SoapUp è composto da 4 persone con conoscenze ed esperienze complementari.

Marisa Zenone è la designer ideatrice di SoapUp®, da sempre legata alla sperimentazione di nuovi materiali. Gisella Facta con una lunga esperienza in ambito commerciale, ed i giovani Elena Gallarate laureata in economia dall'inconfondibile chioma blu e lo sportivo Luca Barbero laureato in architettura.

GOALS

Our mission is bringing SoapUp® all around the world!

We want to introduce and expand a new easy concept: a daily activity can be done saving resources and promoting quality products, all through the Made in Italy.

SoapUp®…a revolutionary way to wash up!

We self-financed the first production, but that’s not enough.

We are raising funds for a bigger production, to cover the material costs and start product promotion.

These are our goals:

15.000 €

Coverage of the whole production SoapUp® costs for the pioneering IndieGoGo contributors.

50.000 €

Research and development of SoapUp®, improve the production, implement an e-commerce and develop an initial marketing campaign.

100.000 €

International patent application. 

Expand the range of products, develop marketing and communication campaign all around the world.

OBIETTIVI

Abbiamo bisogno di voi per divulgare attraverso SoapUp® un modo migliore di compiere un gesto quotidiano, quale lavarsi le mani, per contribuire alla salvaguardia dell'ambiente e promuovere il made in Italy nel mondo.

SoapUp®…il gesto rivoluzionario di lavarsi le mani!

SoapUp® è stato oggetto di una prima piccola produzione autofinanziata.

Se credete quanto noi in questo oggettto, aiutateci ad ottenere fondi per una più importante produzione, attività di ricerca e sviluppo per continuare a migliorarci, coprire i costi dei materiali e promuovere il nostro oggetto con un'attività marketing adeguata.

Questi sono gli obiettivi della campagna:

15.000 €

Copertura dei costi di produzione dei SoapUp® destinati ai sostenitori di Indiegogo.

50.000 €

Sviluppare e migliorare il prodotto SoapUp®. Realizzazione di un e-commerce con cui raggiugere tutto il mondo e di una prima campagna di marketing a livello europeo.

100.000 €

Estensione della copertura del brevetto d'invenzione a livello internazionale.

Il team di SoapUp® si strutturerà per attività di marketing e comunicazione a livello mondiale ed ampliare la gamma prodotti.

SoapUp® SPECIAL EDITION

Just for the IndieGoGo campaign you can have the SoapUp® special edition: a green fluorescent SoapUp®.

Solo tu, che ci sostieni in questa campagna hai la possibilità di avere SoapUp® special edition verde Fluo, un colore che non troverai da nessun'altra parte.Here a summary of the perks:

Ecco i premi per i nostri sostenitori:

3€ - Thanks!

Thank you for your appreciation! You will receive a special web card to share with all your friends!

Grazie per il tuo sostegno! Riceverai una web card per condividere la tua partecipazione al nostro progetto con i tuoi amici!

5€ - Handmade Thanks!

Your special help need a special thank! A "SoapUp®' s Family" postcard with handmade greetings + web card.

Il tuo sostegno richiede una stretta di mano...siamo lontani quindi ti mandiamo la nostra cartolina "SoapUp®' s Family" con il nostro apprezzamento autografato da tutti i componenti + web card.

15€ - SoapUp® Bag

The unique "SoapUp®' s Family" Bag + postcard with handmade greetings + web card.

Una utilissima shopper "SoapUp®' s Family" + cartolina autografata + web card.

20€ - SoapUp® Basic

Choose the color you prefer among the 8 in our catalog and you will receive a SoapUp® ready to use + 1 refill soap bar "white musk" fragrance + postcard with handmade greetings + web card.

Scegli il colore che preferisci tra gli 8 disponibili nel nostro catalogo e riceverai il tuo primo SoapUp® pronto all'uso + 1 saponetta al muschio bianco di ricarica + cartolina autografata + web card.

30€ - SoapUp® Special Edition

Only for our IndieGoGo campaign, the very special Fluo Green SoapUp® ready to use + 1 refill soap bar "white musk" fragrance + postcard with handmade greetings + web card. You will not find this special color anywhere else!

Solo per questa campagna IndieGoGo riceverai il tuo primo SoapUp® pronto all'uso nella versione esclusiva Verde Fluo + 1 saponetta al muschio bianco di ricarica + cartolina autografata + web card.

40€ - SoapUp® Everywhere

A SoapUp® ready to use in the color you prefer among the 8 in our catolog + a bracket to use SoapUp® where you want + 1 refill soap bar "white musk" fragrance + postcard with handmade greetings + web card.

Scegli il colore che preferisci tra gli 8 disponibili nel nostro catalogo e riceverai il tuo primo SoapUp® pronto all'uso + 1 saponetta al muschio bianco di ricarica + 1 staffa in acciaio inox a tua scelta +  cartolina autografata + web card.

45€ - Super SoapUp® Special Edition

The special Fluo Green SoapUp® ready to use (available only for this IndieGoGo campaign) + a bracket to use SoapUp® where you want + 1 refill soap bar "white musk" fragrance + postcard with handmade greetings + web card.

Solo per questa campagna IndieGoGo riceverai il tuo primo SoapUp® pronto all'uso nella versione esclusiva Verde Fluo + 1 saponetta al muschio bianco di ricarica + 1 staffa in acciaio inox a tua scelta +  cartolina autografata + web card.

50€ - All in one pack

A SoapUp® ready to use in the color you prefer between the 8 in our catolog + a bracket to use SoapUp® where you want + 1 refill soap bar "white musk" fragrance + "SoapUp®' s Family" bag + postcard with handmade greetings + web card

Scegli il colore che preferisci tra gli 8 disponibili nel nostro catalogo e riceverai il tuo primo SoapUp® pronto all'uso + 1 saponetta al muschio bianco di ricarica + 1 staffa in acciaio inox a tua scelta + borsa shopper "SoapUp®' s Family"+  cartolina autografata + web card.

55€ - Special edition Pack

The special Fluo Green SoapUp® ready to use (available only for this IndieGoGo campaign) + a bracket to use SoapUp® where you want + 1 refill soap bar "white musk" fragrance + "SoapUp®' s Family" bag + postcard with handmade greetings + web card.

Solo per questa campagna IndieGoGo riceverai il tuo primo SoapUp® pronto all'uso nella versione esclusiva Verde Fluo + 1 saponetta al muschio bianco di ricarica + 1 staffa in acciaio inox a tua scelta + borsa shopper "SoapUp®' s Family" + cartolina autografata + web card.

250€ - Gold Box

This incredible pack includes 8 SoapUp® ready to use, in all the colors available in our catalog + the exclusive Green Fluo SoapUp® ready to use IndieGoGo Edition + 3 brackets + 9 "white musk" fragrance refill bar soaps + "SoapUp®' s Family" bag + postcard with handmade greetings + web card.

Questo incredibile pacchetto include 8 SoapUp® pronti all'uso, in tutti i colori presenti nel nostro catalogo + 1 SoapUp® nella versione esclusiva Verde Fluo + 9 saponette al muschio bianco di ricarica + 3 staffe in acciaio inox a tua scelta + borsa shopper "SoapUp®' s Family" + cartolina autografata + web card.

2.500€ - Platinum Box

For the best only the best! This box includes the Gold Box + if you are going to come to Italy for a business trip or a vacation, we will plan a dinner with you (2 people) and the SoapUp® crew. We would love to make you taste great italian food and wine and to visit a "Langhe" cantine (1 night for 2 people included). If you can't join us in Italy we will send you a special selection of 6 precious and selected wines from "Langhe" area (one of the very best in Italy).

Sei un grande sostenitore...abbiamo pensato ad un ringraziamento speciale!

Questo pacchetto include la "Gold Box"...ma non solo:

se hai modo per lavoro o per vacanza di viaggiare, ti aspettiamo nelle Langhe in Piemonte per cenare con tutti noi dello staff di SoapUp®. Organizziamo per te ed una seconda persona una cena  in un ristorante della tradizione langarola, il pernottamento di una notte, e una visita guidata in cantina con degustazione.

Non puoi spostarti? Non preoccuparti, con la Gold Box" ti spediremo una confezione contenente 6 vini pregiati, selezionati apposta per noi da un sommelier,tra le eccellenze delle langhe.


SHIPPING COSTS

Shipping costs for the perks from "SoapUp® Basic" to the "Special Edition Pack" are 6€. You can add the shipping cost to the perk's contribution.

COSTI DI SPEDIZIONE

I costi di spedizione per i perks da "SoapUp® Basic" al "Special Edition Pack" sono di 6€. Devi aggiungere tale importo al perk da te scelto.


THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT !

GRAZIE PER IL TUO SUPPORTO!

                                                                                          Luca, Marisa, Gisella, Elena

 the
soap stays always clean and dry and it is no longer in contact with any
surface;
no
more problem of dirt and waste;

the
soap is always ready to use;
SoapUp®
returns the pleasure to wash hands with solid soap.

PERCHE' SoapUp® ?
Un oggetto che migliora il gesto quotidiano di lavarsi le mani, un nuovo concetto pensato per tutti.

I vantaggi del suo utilizzo sono evidenti:

il sapone rimane sempre asciutto e pulito e non viene più appoggiato su una superficie;
SoapUp® risolve i problemi di sporco e riduce gli sprechi: la vostra saponetta durerà molto più a lungo;
la saponetta è sempre pronta all’uso;
si propone un accessorio di design, innovativo ed in linea con la filosofia dell’ecosostenibilità.


MADE
IN ITALY
SoapUp®
is an Italian idea. We provide only selected quality soap,
organic, 100% made in Italy which do not include palm or
coconut oil.

Our
first fragrance is "white musk", but we are working to offer you more.
Discover
Italy with us, through its artisan handmade soaps!
MADE IN ITALY

SoapUp® è un' idea italiana ed è nostra volontà associare saponi italiani prodotti da eccellenze artigiane locali, per promuovere il made in Italy e garantirvi una saponetta di altissima qualità. 


Abbiamo cominciato con una prima fragranza, il muschio bianco, ma stiamo già lavorando per offrirvi tante novità.

Scopri con noi l’Italia attraverso i suoi saponi artigianali!






ECO - FRIENDLY
SoapUp®
respects the environment and hates the waste!
The
packaging is reduced to a minimun and made from 100% recycled materials. 

SoapUp®
can replace the liquid soap in favor of solid one and it will reduce
drastically the consumption of plastic dispenser.

ECO - FRIENDLY
SoapUp® rispetta l’ambiente ed odia gli sprechi!

Il packaging è ridotto al minimo e realizzato in materiali riciclati. SoapUp® può sostituire l'utilizzo del sapone liquido e ridurre il consumo dei dosatori in plastica.



THE
INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN
SoapUp®
is an Italian designed object, born 2 years ago and developed in Novara.
The
team is composed of 4 people with complementary backgrounds and
educations.
Marisa
Zenone, the SoapUp®
creator. She is a designer, artisan and artist who’s always been
fascinated by experimentation usage of different materials. Gisella
Facta with a long experience in sales and commercial activity, and the two youngest
Elena Gallarate, graduate student in economics with her distinctive
blue hair, and the sporty Luca Barbero, with a degree in
architecture.
LA CAMPAGNA SU INDIEGOGO
SoapUp® è un progetto completamente italiano, nato e sviluppato nella provincia di Novara e che ha visto muovere i suoi primi passi 2 anni fa.
Il team di SoapUp è composto da 4 persone con conoscenze ed esperienze complementari.
Marisa Zenone è la designer ideatrice di SoapUp®, da sempre legata alla sperimentazione di nuovi materiali. Gisella Facta con una lunga esperienza in ambito commerciale, ed i giovani Elena Gallarate laureata in economia dall'inconfondibile chioma blu e lo sportivo Luca Barbero laureato in architettura. 



GOALS
Our
mission is bringing SoapUp®
all around the world!
We want to introduce and expand a new easy
concept: a daily activity can be done saving resources and promoting
quality products, all through the Made in Italy.
SoapUp®…a
revolutionary way to wash up!

We
self-financed the first production, but that’s not enough. 
We
are raising funds for a bigger production, to cover the material
costs and start product promotion.These
are our goals:


15.000
€ 

Coverage of the whole production SoapUp® costs for the pioneering IndieGoGo contributors.


50.000 € 

Research and development of SoapUp®, improve the production, implement an e-commerce and develop an initial marketing campaign.


100.000 € 

International patent application. 
Expand the range of products, develop marketing and
communication campaign all around the world.

OBIETTIVI

Abbiamo bisogno di voi per divulgare attraverso SoapUp® un modo migliore di compiere un gesto quotidiano, quale lavarsi le mani, per contribuire alla salvaguardia dell'ambiente e promuovere il made in Italy nel mondo.

SoapUp®…il gesto rivoluzionario di lavarsi le mani!

SoapUp® è stato oggetto di una prima piccola produzione autofinanziata.

Se credete quanto noi in questo oggettto, aiutateci ad ottenere fondi per una più importante produzione, attività di ricerca e sviluppo per continuare a migliorarci, coprire i costi dei materiali e promuovere il nostro oggetto con un'attività marketing adeguata.

Questi sono gli obiettivi della campagna:

15.000 €

Copertura dei costi di produzione dei SoapUp® destinati ai sostenitori di Indiegogo.

50.000 €

Sviluppare e migliorare il prodotto SoapUp®. Realizzazione di un e-commerce con cui raggiugere tutto il mondo e di una prima campagna di marketing a livello europeo. 

100.000 €

Estensione della copertura del brevetto d'invenzione a livello internazionale. 

Il team di SoapUp® si strutturerà per attività di marketing e comunicazione a livello mondiale ed ampliare la gamma prodotti.
SoapUp® SPECIAL EDITION
Just
for the IndieGoGo campaign you can have the SoapUp®
special edition: a green fluorescent SoapUp®.
Solo tu, che ci sostieni in questa campagna hai la possibilità di avere SoapUp® special edition verde Fluo, un colore che non troverai da nessun'altra parte.Here
a summary of the perks:
Ecco i premi per i nostri sostenitori:
3€ - Thanks!
Thank you for your appreciation! You
will receive a special web card to share with all your friends!
Grazie per il tuo sostegno! Riceverai una web card per condividere la tua partecipazione al nostro progetto con i tuoi amici!
5€ -
Handmade Thanks!
Your special help need a special thank!
A "SoapUp®' s Family" postcard with handmade greetings + web
card.
Il tuo sostegno richiede una stretta di mano...siamo lontani quindi ti mandiamo la nostra cartolina "SoapUp®' s Family" con il nostro apprezzamento autografato da tutti i componenti + web card.
15€ - SoapUp® Bag
The unique "SoapUp®' s Family"
Bag + postcard with handmade greetings + web card.
Una utilissima shopper "SoapUp®' s Family" + cartolina autografata + web card.
20€ - SoapUp® Basic
Choose the color you prefer among the
8 in our catalog and you will receive a SoapUp® ready to use + 1 refill soap bar "white musk"
fragrance + postcard with handmade greetings + web card.
Scegli il colore che preferisci tra gli 8 disponibili nel nostro catalogo e riceverai il tuo primo SoapUp® pronto all'uso + 1 saponetta al muschio bianco di ricarica + cartolina autografata + web card.
30€ - SoapUp® Special Edition
Only for our IndieGoGo campaign, the
very special Fluo Green SoapUp® ready to use + 1 refill soap bar "white musk" fragrance +
postcard with handmade greetings + web card. You will not find this
special color anywhere else!
Solo per questa campagna IndieGoGo riceverai il tuo primo SoapUp® pronto all'uso nella versione esclusiva Verde Fluo + 1 saponetta al muschio bianco di ricarica + cartolina autografata + web card.
40€ - SoapUp® Everywhere
A SoapUp® ready to use in the color you prefer among the 8 in our catolog + a bracket to use SoapUp® where you
want + 1 refill soap bar "white musk" fragrance + postcard with handmade greetings
+ web card.
Scegli il colore che preferisci tra gli 8 disponibili nel nostro catalogo e riceverai il tuo primo SoapUp® pronto all'uso + 1 saponetta al muschio bianco di ricarica + 1 staffa in acciaio inox a tua scelta +  cartolina autografata + web card.
45€ - Super
SoapUp® Special Edition
The special Fluo Green SoapUp®
ready to use (available only for this IndieGoGo campaign) + a bracket to use SoapUp® where you want + 1 refill soap bar "white musk" fragrance + postcard with
handmade greetings + web card.
Solo per questa campagna IndieGoGo riceverai il tuo primo SoapUp® pronto all'uso nella versione esclusiva Verde Fluo + 1 saponetta al muschio bianco di ricarica + 1 staffa in acciaio inox a tua scelta +  cartolina autografata + web card.
50€ - All in
one pack
A SoapUp® ready to use in the color you prefer
between the 8 in our catolog + a bracket to use SoapUp® where you
want + 1 refill soap bar "white musk" fragrance + "SoapUp®' s Family" bag +
postcard with handmade greetings + web card
Scegli il colore che preferisci tra gli 8 disponibili nel nostro catalogo e riceverai il tuo primo SoapUp® pronto all'uso + 1 saponetta al muschio bianco di ricarica + 1 staffa in acciaio inox a tua scelta + borsa shopper "SoapUp®' s Family"+  cartolina autografata + web card.
55€ -
Special edition PackThe special Fluo Green SoapUp® ready to use
(available only for this IndieGoGo campaign) + a bracket to use SoapUp® where you want + 1 refill soap bar "white musk" fragrance + "SoapUp®' s
Family" bag + postcard with handmade greetings + web card.Solo per questa campagna IndieGoGo riceverai il tuo primo SoapUp® pronto all'uso nella versione esclusiva Verde Fluo + 1 saponetta al muschio bianco di ricarica + 1 staffa in acciaio inox a tua scelta + borsa shopper "SoapUp®' s Family" + cartolina autografata + web card.250€ - Gold
Box
This incredible pack includes 8 SoapUp®
ready to use, in all the colors available in our catalog + the exclusive Green Fluo
SoapUp® ready to use IndieGoGo Edition + 3 brackets + 9 "white musk" fragrance refill bar soaps
+ "SoapUp®' s Family" bag + postcard with handmade greetings +
web card.
Questo incredibile pacchetto include 8 SoapUp® pronti all'uso, in tutti i colori presenti nel nostro catalogo + 1 SoapUp® nella versione esclusiva Verde Fluo + 9 saponette al muschio bianco di ricarica + 3 staffe in acciaio inox a tua scelta + borsa shopper "SoapUp®' s Family" + cartolina autografata + web card.
2.500€ -
Platinum Box
For the best only the best! This box
includes the Gold Box + if you are going to come to Italy for a business trip or a vacation, we will plan a dinner with you (2 people) and the SoapUp® crew. We would love to make you taste great italian food and wine and to visit a "Langhe" cantine (1 night for 2 people included). If you can't join us in Italy we will send you a special selection of 6 precious and selected wines from "Langhe" area (one of the very best in Italy).
Sei un grande sostenitore...abbiamo pensato ad un ringraziamento speciale!
Questo pacchetto include la "Gold Box"...ma non solo:
se hai modo per lavoro o per vacanza di viaggiare, ti aspettiamo nelle Langhe in Piemonte per cenare con tutti noi dello staff di SoapUp®. Organizziamo per te ed una seconda persona una cena  in un ristorante della tradizione langarola, il pernottamento di una notte, e una visita guidata in cantina con degustazione.
Non puoi spostarti? Non preoccuparti, con la Gold Box" ti spediremo una confezione contenente 6 vini pregiati, selezionati apposta per noi da un sommelier,tra le eccellenze delle langhe.

SHIPPING COSTS
Shipping costs for the perks from "SoapUp® Basic" to the "Special Edition Pack" are 6€. You can add the shipping cost to the perk's contribution.
COSTI DI SPEDIZIONE
I costi di spedizione per i perks da "SoapUp® Basic" al "Special Edition Pack" sono di 6€. Devi aggiungere tale importo al perk da te scelto.

THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT !
GRAZIE PER IL TUO SUPPORTO!


                                                                                          Luca, Marisa, Gisella, Elena

story:
Short Summary

AXIS Dance Company is one of the world’s most accomplished and innovative ensembles of dancers with and without physical disabilities. Based in Oakland, CA, and founded in 1987, we have performed nationwide and internationally as far away as Siberia.

Our company’s unique performances and education programs reach over 25,000 people each year, changing the way people think about dance and the possibilities of the human body. All of this with 6 dancers and a small staff of 5!

AXIS is a cultural jewel of the Bay Area. 

Yet our current office is a bit of a… rough stone.

With boxes as side tables and folding tables as desks our office space is not reflecting the exciting, dynamic company that we are. To be honest… it’s a little... sad. 

So, it’s time for a change! Time for a makeover!


What We Need & What You Get

Gensler, a world-renowned architecture and design firm, has generously assembled a topnotch pro bono team to design a functional, accessible and inspiring work environment for AXIS.  

The designs are ready, and Human Scale has generously donated office chairs and offered a huge discount on desks. All we need now is your help to make the rest a reality. Are you in?

Your donation will help fund:

  • 5 ergonomic desks chosen with complete accessibility in mind
  • a meeting table
  • a variety of storage solutions
  • bamboo flooring
  • ceiling tiles
  • paint & painting supplies
  • an exciting wall graphic

As a thank you for your generous contribution you will receive perks such as our everlasting gratitude, life time membership to the AXIS community, tickets to our show in April, VIP access to an open rehearsal, or - our favorite - the office named after you!  And AXIS is a 510(c)3 which means that all your donations are tax deductible.

If we don't reach our goal of raising $15,000 we will still use the funding towards our office makeover and make adjustments accordingly. If we exceed our goal we will invest the funds in more durable storage solutions, light fixtures, and better flooring.

The Impact

A well-designed space = happy AXIS staff = higher productivity = more awesome AXIS programming!

We operate on a tight budget, leaving no funds for projects such as these. Your participation in this campaign is an opportunity to demonstrate your belief in AXIS and the work we are doing. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Every contribution no matter how small helps, but we know that making a contribution is not possible for everyone. That doesn’t mean you can’t help. Please get the word out and tell your friends and family near and far about AXIS Dance Company and this project.

story:
In honor of Nelson Mandela Day, the youth at MADaboutART share their hopes and dreams for the future. Despite living in a township with a high poverty and HIV prevalence rate, the young people use art to educate and offer support to those living with the virus.

Join their efforts by donating money that will help them to continue using art to “MAD”- Make A Difference!

WE ARE TRYING TO RAISE $500 BY NELSON MANDELA DAY, SUNDAY JULY 18.

story:
This campaign

The team at the Arteles Creative Centre in Finland has invited me to take part in their artist-in-residence program. 

Taking part in an artist residency plays an important part in any emerging artist's career: not only will it provide me with time for research and developing new work, but it will also give me invaluable opportunities to network and collaborate with other international artists. 

It does, however, come with one down side: one month residency = one month of unpaid work. 

I have created this campaign to crowdfund my way to Arteles. In return for your support I offer some quirky and interesting artworks. 

About me

My name is Pierre le Riche and I am a South African visual artist living in Cape Town. I work mainly in sculpture and installation, the latter being a relatively new and unexplored form of art in South Africa. During my career I have mainly studied issues of identity, specifically that of homosexuality, masculinity and of the Afrikaner. Since I am a white, Afrikaans male I am particularly interested in the identity of the Afrikaner male in post-apartheid South Africa. My interest in identity has manifested in a new-found curiosity towards cultural identity which I plan to explore at Arteles.

For more information on my work please have a look at this article on DesignBoom, or visit my website.

Residency at Arteles Creative Centre

The largest artist residency program in Scandinavia: this creative centre is run by Arteles, a non-profit organisation set on supporting the arts. Whether a visual artist, architect, writer or musician, Arteles welcomes around 90 creatives per year to their artist-in-residence program. 

I will be spending a month at Arteles. During this time I want to research and develop a body of new artworks based on the different identities I encounter along the way. I am also in the process of developing a new version of my previous installation, The Rainbow Room, which I would like to refine during the residency. I am planning to exhibit this installation in South Africa and internationally in the near future.

For this campaign I am aiming to raise $2000.

- $1300 will cover half of the accommodation at Arteles (the other half is kindly funded by them!)
- the remaining $700 will be allocated to travel expenses, as well as the purchase of materials.

In exchange for your support

This is the fun part: what's in it for you?

Perks #1 and #2

These are aimed at individuals who would like to make small financial contributions. These leave you feeling all warm and fuzzy.

Perks #3 and #4

For $25 you can own your very own pink or rainbow yarn-bombed rugby ball. Knitted by me and plucked straight from the Rainbow Room's ceiling! If you reside outside South Africa please add $10 for shipping.

Perk #5

$30 buys you a signed limited edition catalogue of my Broederbond exhibition. If you reside outside South Africa please add $10 for shipping.

Perk #6

For $40 you get one of only four Rainbow Room relics. These relics are 15 x 15cm acrylic boxes displaying original yarn of the walls of the Rainbow Room.  If you reside outside South Africa please add $20 for shipping.

Perk #7

This bold print is sure to add colour to your art collection. The paper used is museum quality 310gsm Hahnemühle paper and the size is 600 x 300 which includes a white border. The print is in an edition of 10 and is priced at $50 each. Don't forget to add $10 for shipping if you live outside South Africa.


Perk #8
This is one of my favourites: a small resin and yarn sculpture entitled 'Rainbow Loom' that was exhibited with Broederbond back in 2012. I think on many levels the work speaks for itself. You can be the owner of this special artwork for $150. Please remember to add $20 for shipping if you live outside South Africa.

If you would like to support this campaign, but are unable to make a financial contribution or buy a perk, don't sweat! Simply share this page with your friends and loved ones. 

Please be sure to follow me on twitter and facebook for more information on my work as well as updates straight from Arteles. I will also be documenting my time abroad on my website's Travel Journal.


Thank you!

Pierre

(Please note that all perks bought after 21 April 2014 can only be fulfilled during June 2014 as I will be abroad.

story:
The Universal Embrace; Considering Phi, Spirit, and Society, a Creative Project via a Masters of Education.

In brief I am studying a Masters of Education by creative project at Victoria University in Melbourne. I am crowdfunding on indiegogo.com to allow me the financial support to continue my studies and take it to PhD level hopefully in 2014.

Please read on to see all the amazing gifts books, CD's, art, and experiences you can receive for your generous support, and indulge in how unique and exciting this project is!

 

 Above: A traditionally drawn embrace considering love energy

 

Introduction to the Creative Project - 'The Universal Embrace': What is it?

My project that needs supporting, is titled 'The Universal Embrace'. It is a web based interactive design of two men embracing, quite politically fitting in these times of marriage equality debates. 

What’s so intriguingly controversial yet banal about two men in love hugging? It has never been done before in a contemporary interactive medium! This is a technological current statement about love between men. Historically many embraces are hetero-central. My creativity over my life has been a narrative, and this is its more self actualised continuation!

The essence is of human touch as a necessity for the human experience, based on love. This project is born of that emotion. It aims to create an online interactive journal of narrative discovery. It takes apart the moment of the embrace, and explores it in an interactive way physically, emotionally, and spiritually, all the while politicising it through an antipodean context in a constructed location, for a worldwide web audience.

I want you to be a part of it!

Why this crowdfunfing?

This funding is needed to allow me a living wage whilst I study and create. Hopefully, when 2014 comes, it will be accepted as a PhD study , that’s the aim! I need support for rent, living expenses, software, helthcare and studio hire. I'm not afraid to work fo this or offer some worthwhile perks for being a part of this! (See right).

 

Above: A template of 'The Universal Embrace' which cosiders divine proportion 

A little bit about me;

I have spoken on mental health advocacy across many radio stations, television, community groups, and non-for profits Australian parliament, even to Montreal in Canada at McGill University. I have a life journey that has to manage schizophrenia. 

Artistically, I have been exhibiting for the last ten years around the traps and am a former illustrator and news graphics artist for both 'The Herald Sun' and 'The Age' newspapers here in Melbourne.I have been an extremely passionate person in my life, written books, created books, and made incredible amounts of art and writing which I am now using as leverage to hopefully garner support to fulfil my further study aspirations.

My books have won numerous awards, and my work is collected by artistic institutions, and collected by public institutions as well. 

For more about me, please see: www.creativemusings.com.au The first 6 images on the front page are for sale here: PLEASE email me with your preference before you financially commit, so I can make sure it has not been sold! richard@creativemusings.com.au

 

Whats in it for you?

You are invited to share the ride and get stuff! Art! Books! EBooks! Audio CD's, be a part of this journey and be shown a whole lot of gratitude!

You can also enrol in facilitated art classes with me here at my studio. Again please email me before you commit to the classes so I can re-assure you of your placement.

 

 

Above: Front cover of 'Ego and Soul'     

Above: Front cover of 'Recovered, not cured'  

 

 

Your belief in me propels my enthusiasm and makes me strive to make this an amazing contribution to cultural life!

 

My passed candidature proposal, (which took a whole year), is very long and wordy – to read about the aims, statements of significance and its contribution to knowledge, (necessary to take it to PhD), Please CLICK THESE WORDS to take you to ‘The Universal Embrace' website for a full academic description where you can join in the conversation on my blog.

 

This is about celebrating love in essence! A hug or embrace is one of the most profound human experiences we hopefully all share.

 

 Above: 'Still' image illustrating how images will be turned "on" and "off" in the final online design.

 

To have a look at the ongoing web development of 'The Universal Embrace', please CLICK THIS LINK!

 

Please SHARE this campaign with your friends, it's much appreciated! Also share it with people whom may benefit from these resources.

 

"Good on you Rich!"

Because a lot of people will know me personally from the work I have done, I encourage you to introduce this campaign to your Facebook friends and twitter followers, and say 'Remember Rich McLean?, look what he's doing, you should check it out!'

All of your support is so gratefully appreciated, will greatly help me support myself while I study.  ...and I have faith you will appreciate your gifts of art and books and meetings/classes from me, and being a part of the journey!

Thanks so much for reading all this, your generosity won't be forgotten, everyone whom contributes will be entioned on the final 'The Universal Embrace' website.

All this will add to the cultural richness in art online and in the physical landscape and hopefully propel me into my PhD and future employment and further contribution in society!

We all need some help sometimes to live to our highest good and greatest happiness-your support WILL facilitate and contribute to this!

 

Thankfully, Richard.

 Remember to keep updated on my Facebook Fine Art profile and also my twitter by following www.twitter.com/RichMcLean

Last of all check out 'The Universal Embrace' online interactive blog and BE A PART OF IT! 

Below: As you can see, a persons face appears in the bottom left to contextualise the embrace. This person could be YOU!

 

Remember to have a look at www.creativemusings.com.au - The six images on the front of that page are for sale, (right).  Which is your favourite? ;-)

 

Please email me on richard@creativemusings.com.au before you commit to a piece-I want to make sure that your selection is still available. Thanks. :-) The images are all about 70cm x 120 - 90 x 125 cm cm under glass and are on the image page of this website too! Which one do you like!?
story_txt:
The Universal Embrace; Considering Phi, Spirit, and Society, a Creative Project via a Masters of Education.
In brief I am studying a Masters of Education by creative project at Victoria University in Melbourne. I am crowdfunding on indiegogo.com to allow me the financial support to continue my studies and take it to PhD level hopefully in 2014.
Please read on to see all the amazing gifts books, CD's, art, and experiences you can receive for your generous support, and indulge in how unique and exciting this project is!
 

 Above: A traditionally drawn embrace considering love energy
 
Introduction to the Creative Project - 'The Universal Embrace': What is it?
My project that needs supporting, is titled 'The Universal Embrace'. It is a web based interactive design of two men embracing, quite politically fitting in these times of marriage equality debates. 
What’s so intriguingly controversial yet banal about two men in love hugging? It has never been done before in a contemporary interactive medium! This is a technological current statement about love between men. Historically many embraces are hetero-central. My creativity over my life has been a narrative, and this is its more self actualised continuation!
The essence is of human touch as a necessity for the human experience, based on love. This project is born of that emotion. It aims to create an online interactive journal of narrative discovery. It takes apart the moment of the embrace, and explores it in an interactive way physically, emotionally, and spiritually, all the while politicising it through an antipodean context in a constructed location, for a worldwide web audience.
I want you to be a part of it!
Why this crowdfunfing?
This funding is needed to allow me a living wage whilst I study and create. Hopefully, when 2014 comes, it will be accepted as a PhD study , that’s the aim! I need support for rent, living expenses, software, helthcare and studio hire. I'm not afraid to work fo this or offer some worthwhile perks for being a part of this! (See right).
 

Above: A template of 'The Universal Embrace' which cosiders divine proportion 
A little bit about me;
I have spoken on mental health advocacy across many radio stations, television, community groups, and non-for profits Australian parliament, even to Montreal in Canada at McGill University. I have a life journey that has to manage schizophrenia. 
Artistically, I have been exhibiting for the last ten years around the traps and am a former illustrator and news graphics artist for both 'The Herald Sun' and 'The Age' newspapers here in Melbourne.I have been an extremely passionate person in my life, written books, created books, and made incredible amounts of art and writing which I am now using as leverage to hopefully garner support to fulfil my further study aspirations.
My books have won numerous awards, and my work is collected by artistic institutions, and collected by public institutions as well. 
For more about me, please see: www.creativemusings.com.au The first 6 images on the front page are for sale here: PLEASE email me with your preference before you financially commit, so I can make sure it has not been sold! richard@creativemusings.com.au
 
Whats in it for you?
You are invited to share the ride and get stuff! Art! Books! EBooks! Audio CD's, be a part of this journey and be shown a whole lot of gratitude!
You can also enrol in facilitated art classes with me here at my studio. Again please email me before you commit to the classes so I can re-assure you of your placement.
 
 
Above: Front cover of 'Ego and Soul'     

Above: Front cover of 'Recovered, not cured'  
 
 
Your belief in me propels my enthusiasm and makes me strive to make this an amazing contribution to cultural life!

story:
Short Summary

The Education Project is giving a voice to those who are involved in our educational system. The audience will be thrown for a loop by interview, dialogue, monologue, and personal experience coming from the students, parents, and teachers that witness the day-to-day battles. This is not a project that will simply bring more faults in our education to the surface, but instead it will shed a light on the answers we have found to the ultimate question, "What is 'getting an education?' "

What We Need & What You Get

  • Make a choice. 
  • Help us out through your bank account.
  • Show up. 
  • Ask questions.
  • Answer questions.
  • Give us some more money..
  • Tell people about what we're doing. 
  • Start a conversation.
  • ...Keep giving us money.

story:
(R)EVOLUCIONA EL ESPACIO

El Hueco, Espacio Latidos y el colectivo Todo Por La Praxis van a construir La Burbuja, laboratorio de experimentación creativa a pie de calle. La Burbuja es la (r)evolución del espacio público, un escenario innovador que puede albergar todo tipo de eventos.

ÚNETE A LA (R)EVOLUCIÓN

Queremos ofrecerte la oportunidad de participar en esta (r)evolución, de que pongas tu nombre en La Burbuja. Y para ello hemos abierto una pequeña campaña de crowfunding. Con una pequeña aportación, tú puedes formar parte de este momento tan especial.

¿QUÉ ES LA BURBUJA?

La Burbuja es… una burbuja, un gran contenedor inflable de plástico transparente, de unos ocho metros de longitud y cuatro metros de altura. Una especie de gran y acogedora placenta cuyo interior puede contener desde una exposición, hasta una conferencia, pasando por casi cualquier actividad cultural o artística que pase por la imaginación.

¿QUIÉNES SON TODO POR LA PRAXIS?

Son los creadores de La Burbuja, que ahora llega a Soria. Todo por la Praxis viene desarrollando su actividad desde 1999, pero es a partir de 2007 cuando se constituye como colectivo y se autodefine de manera más consolidada. Formado por un equipo de carácter multidisciplinar con miembros procedentes de disciplinas como arquitectura, creación artística, derecho, informática y antropología. Todo por la praxis se define como un laboratorio de proyectos estéticos de resistencia cultural, y un laboratorio que desarrolla herramientas para la intervención sobre el espacio público. Con objeto de generar un catálogo de herramientas de acción directa, socialmente efectivas, orientadas a la consecución del derecho a la vivienda y el derecho a la ciudad.


MÁS INFORMACIÓN

www.laburbuja.net

story:
"The Shadow" te necesita para hacerse realidad.

The Shadow o La Sombra es un proyecto artístico, diseñado y gestado por el artista Abel Azcona durante el invierno de 2014 en la ciudad de Pamplona, al norte de España. Investigación del artista en torno al abuso infantil en la cuna de la Iglesia Católica y en la rama ultra conservadora del Opus Dei. Posteriormente desarrollada y performatizada por el propio Azcona durante los años 2015 y 2016 en veinticuatro ciudades de los seis países europeos Portugal, Italia, Inglaterra, Irlanda, Francia y España, donde en 1946 comenzó la labor del Opus Dei.

Un proyecto artístico multidisciplinar, fotografía documental y de denuncia, instalación artística y performance art del artista Abel Azcona.


En 2002, la Organización Mundial de la Salud estimó que 150 millones de niñas y 73 millones de niños menores de 18 años experimentaron relaciones sexuales forzadas u otras formas de violencia sexual con contacto físico. En el año 2012 diversos medios de comunicación españoles relataron con informes especializados, que uno de cada cinco menores ha sufrido o sufre abusos sexuales, aunque solo se conozcan y se denuncien el 2% de los casos. Según diferentes estudios más de el 30 % de los abusos están relacionados directamente con la Iglesia Católica.

El artista haciendo un recorrido por distintos parques de su ciudad natal Pamplona, acompañado por veintinueve adultos vinculados a historias de abusos a menores, insta en esta nueva pieza a la reflexión de lo que ya es conocido como la sombra de la pederastia. Metáfora que tanto la Iglesia Católica como diferentes gobiernos emplean al hablar de esta grave problemática internacional. Las treintas historias, incluida la del propio Abel Azcona construyen una pieza biográfica y crítica, empleando la fotografía, la instalación y el performance como herramienta catártica colectiva. 


El artista Abel Azcona durante uno de los encuentros en un parque en Pamplona.

The Shadow es un proyecto expositivo compuesto por fotografía, instalación y performance art. En la muestra, además de las treinta fotografías, una asociada a cada experiencia personal, podemos encontrar una instalación de reproducción real de uno de los parques infantiles dentro del espacio galerístico. Donde el artista Abel Azcona permanece sentado en un columpio de forma permanente invitando al espectador a ocupar el otro asiento. Azcona les cuenta en primera persona cada uno de los relatos de los treinta protagonistas del proyecto, así como el suyo propio. Del mismo modo que ellos relataron la difícil experiencia al artista en su día, en frente del parque infantil real en su ciudad natal Pamplona. Treinta parques con sus correspondientes historias, que fueron fotografiados durante los meses de noviembre y diciembre en la fría y lluviosa Pamplona.

Abel Azcona fue abandonado al nacer por su madre la cual ejercía la prostitución, ningún hombre reclamó su paternidad por lo que fue puesto a disposición de instituciones adoptivas. Su infancia estuvo marcada por la ausencia de estabilidad y por el cambio constante de centros y familias de acogida. Durante este periplo de falsas familias y sustituciones emocionales Azcona también tuvo que enfrentarse a varios episodios de abusos y maltratos, los cuales han marcado su obra de una forma definitiva. Herida que junto a los veintinueve participantes del proyecto, explora y muestra de forma directa y sin filtros en el proyecto artístico "The Shadow".

Con The Shadow se busca dar voz a aquellas víctimas hoy adultas, las cuales han sufrido abusos en su infancia. Azcona rodeado de fotografías de espacios vinculados al entorno infantil de cada una de las protagonistas relatará sus historias, recuerdos y sentimientos. Testimonios de personas que han confiado a Azcona sus experiencias, en todos los casos con un fuerte vínculo con la Iglesia y más concretamente con el Opus Dei. También conocido por sus discípulos como La Obra es una organización de gran importancia en la ultra conservadora Pamplona. Ciudad que homenajea en sus calles a su fundador Escrivá de Balaguer, hijo adoptivo de la misma todavía a día de hoy. Muchos de los casos no son denunciados en gran parte por miedo a ser estigmatizados, a las represalias o a no ser creídos. La falta de confianza en las autoridades, en muchos casos militantes de La Obra, también dificulta la visibilación de esta problemática. La falta de conciencia social también ha contribuido a que muchos casos no se denuncien. 


El artista Abel Azcona durante uno de los encuentros en un parque en Pamplona.

Durante los años 2015 y 2016 el proyecto es expuesto y performatizado en veinticuatro galerías, museos y espacios artísticos internacionales de ciudades, especialmente escogidas a nivel internacional, como Oporto, Trento, Salerno, Avignon, Bordeaux, Limerick, Bradford, Birmingham, Valladolid, Vitoria, Segovia o Soria. Una denuncia internacional contra situación ocultada por la propia Iglesia Católico y conservadurismo navarro, exponiendo el secreto y el miedo de centenares de personas que viven con la herida incurable del abuso. De nuevo, el artista nos habla de el arte de explorar fantasmas, de mirar atrás y ser capaces de conocer y asumir nuestra propia sombra. Un arte con sentido crítico y resiliente. "The Shadow" no debe ser únicamente un proyecto artístico, sino debe ser un detonante de resistencia, denuncia y visibilización. 


La sombra de Carlota

"Un día, él me dijo que lo que me hacía era como jugar, desde ese día no quise jugar nunca más. Cada vez que tenía un juguete en la mano tenía miedo que viniera y me tocara, tenía miedo a reír, miedo a ser feliz". En el mes de Diciembre, Carlota viajó a Pamplona para participar en el proyecto. Junto a Abel Azcona visitó los emplazamientos de la infancia de ella, mientras narraba su historia personal al artista. Los dos terminaron sentados en los columpios del parque infantil donde durante años Carlota había vivido.

"Él era mi sombra. Tenía únicamente nueve años y él, hermano de mi padre, me besaba con un aliento terrible, mi espalda y mi cuerpo de niña. Me penetro varias veces, yo no sabía si el dolor era normal. O si eran unas cosquillas muy fuertes". Carlota nació en Pamplona hace más de treinta años. Es hija de una familia de nueve hermanos. Siete hombres y dos mujeres. Cuando era una niña asistía a un colegio de niñas. El hermano de su padre, un religioso perteneciente al Opus Dei en Navarra, abuso de ella en más de veinte ocasiones. Al igual que de su otra hermana. Carlota cuando cumplió la mayoría de edad denunció, pero a la semana retiró la demanda por presión de su entorno. 

"Recuerdo que cuando venía a casa nos decía a mis hermanos y a mi que rezáramos mucho y que Dios nos quería, gracias a él aprendí a odiar a Dios." En la actualidad Carlota solo siente como familia a su hermana, con la que comparte la experiencia de abuso, el resto de la familia le ha dado la espalda. Hace años que no vive en Pamplona, por lo complicado de la situación tuvo que abandonar la ciudad. Llora cada vez que vuelve a pisar la que para ella es una ciudad gris y llena de secretos.


La sombra de Carlota.Parque vinculado a la infancia de Carlota en Pamplona.

La sombra de Tomás

"Aquel hombre malo siempre me esperaba detrás de la puerta de las habitaciones, veía por el pasillo su sombra y temblaba. Me decía que lo que me hacía era normal, que estaba bien, pero que si lo contaba no tendría amigos nunca más." En el mes de Diciembre, Tomás acompañado por Abel Azcona, visitó los emplazamientos vinculados a su infancia. Tomás y Abel se contaron mutuamente sus experiencias personales y los dos terminaron su encuentro sentados en los columpios donde el propio Tomás había jugado en diversas ocasiones durante toda su infancia.

"Lo denuncié, no me creyeron, pero me cambiaron de internado. Ya no volví a verlo, pero siempre recordaré sus manos en mi cuerpo y su mirada de deseo. Yo miraba la puerta de mi habitación creyendo que aparecería en cualquier momento." Procedente de una familia de seis hermanos, junto a su hermano mayor fue a un internado católico debido a su conducta, según su padres, no adecuada. Durante los tres años que formaba parte del alumnado del centro, fue abusado por un miembro del equipo docente. Finalmente lo denunció en su casa, pero únicamente fue cambiado de centro y curso el bachillerato en un colegio masculino de Pamplona vinculado al Opus Dei.

"Yo sabía que estaba mal, pero muchas veces lo olvidaba. Para mi, por mi educación católica era pecado, era una secreto inconfesable. Una vergüenza. Cuando mi familia lo supo, me cambiaron de centro y no se volvió a hablar nunca más. " Tomás tiene 18 años. En este momento ha empezado un grado en la Universidad de Navarra vinculada al Opus Dei. Él afirma que intenta vivir como si no hubiera pasado, pero le sigue afectando en su vida diaria. Una herida que siempre estará en su piel.


La sombra de Tomás.Parque vinculado a la infancia de Tomás en Pamplona.

La sombra de Ernesto

"Sólo fue una vez, cinco minutos tan rápido que a veces pensaba que lo había soñado. Nunca lo conté, sólo lo escribí. Leia mi cuaderno para no olvidarlo, porque olvidarlo hubiera sido mentirme a mi mismo. En el colegio no podía contarlo, él era el ejemplo a seguir. Nadie me creería, además él me dijo que lo que me hacía estaba bien. Era amor, y Dios quería que los hombres se dieran amor. Ahora lo recuerdo y siento repulsión. Aquello no era amor y mis miedos no me dejaban asumirlo. Pero siempre me ha perseguido y me persigue como una sombra. Ya no soy capaz de amar a otras personas sin sentirlo antinatural, sin sentirme sucio."

Ernesto ya es adulto, pero hace tan sólo diez años cuando asistía un colegio masculino navarro vinculado al Opus Dei tuvo una experiencia de abuso por el sacerdote del centro. Al ser únicamente una vez, se sintió culpable y lo ocultó. Hoy en día todavía no lo ha denunciado. Pero siente que le ha marcado de por vida en todos los aspectos de su vida.


La sombra de Ernesto.Parque vinculado a la infancia de Ernesto en Pamplona.

Según diferentes estudios más de el 30 % de los abusos están relacionados directamente con la Iglesia Católica.El artista haciendo un recorrido por distintos parques de su ciudad natal Pamplona, acompañado por veintinueve adultos vinculados a historias de abusos a menores, insta en esta nueva pieza a la reflexión de lo que ya es conocido como la sombra de la pederastia. Metáfora que tanto la Iglesia Católica como diferentes gobiernos emplean al hablar de esta grave problemática internacional. Las treintas historias, incluida la del propio Abel Azcona construyen una pieza biográfica y crítica, empleando la fotografía, la instalación y el performance como herramienta catártica colectiva. El artista Abel Azcona durante uno de los encuentros en un parque en Pamplona.The Shadow es un proyecto expositivo compuesto por fotografía, instalación y performance art. En la muestra, además de las treinta fotografías, una asociada a cada experiencia personal, podemos encontrar una instalación de reproducción real de uno de los parques infantiles dentro del espacio galerístico. Donde el artista Abel Azcona permanece sentado en un columpio de forma permanente invitando al espectador a ocupar el otro asiento. Azcona les cuenta en primera persona cada uno de los relatos de los treinta protagonistas del proyecto, así como el suyo propio. Del mismo modo que ellos relataron la difícil experiencia al artista en su día, en frente del parque infantil real en su ciudad natal Pamplona. Treinta parques con sus correspondientes historias, que fueron fotografiados durante los meses de noviembre y diciembre en la fría y lluviosa Pamplona.Abel Azcona fue abandonado al nacer por su madre la cual ejercía la prostitución, ningún hombre reclamó su paternidad por lo que fue puesto a disposición de instituciones adoptivas. Su infancia estuvo marcada por la ausencia de estabilidad y por el cambio constante de centros y familias de acogida. Durante este periplo de falsas familias y sustituciones emocionales Azcona también tuvo que enfrentarse a varios episodios de abusos y maltratos, los cuales han marcado su obra de una forma definitiva. Herida que junto a los veintinueve participantes del proyecto, explora y muestra de forma directa y sin filtros en el proyecto artístico "The Shadow".Con The Shadow se busca dar voz a aquellas víctimas hoy adultas, las cuales han sufrido abusos en su infancia. Azcona rodeado de fotografías de espacios vinculados al entorno infantil de cada una de las protagonistas relatará sus historias, recuerdos y sentimientos. Testimonios de personas que han confiado a Azcona sus experiencias, en todos los casos con un fuerte vínculo con la Iglesia y más concretamente con el Opus Dei. También conocido por sus discípulos como La Obra es una organización de gran importancia en la ultra conservadora Pamplona. Ciudad que homenajea en sus calles a su fundador Escrivá de Balaguer, hijo adoptivo de la misma todavía a día de hoy. Muchos de los casos no son denunciados en gran parte por miedo a ser estigmatizados, a las represalias o a no ser creídos. La falta de confianza en las autoridades, en muchos casos militantes de La Obra, también dificulta la visibilación de esta problemática. La falta de conciencia social también ha contribuido a que muchos casos no se denuncien. El artista Abel Azcona durante uno de los encuentros en un parque en Pamplona.Durante los años 2015 y 2016 el proyecto es expuesto y performatizado en veinticuatro galerías, museos y espacios artísticos internacionales de ciudades, especialmente escogidas a nivel internacional, como Oporto, Trento, Salerno, Avignon, Bordeaux, Limerick, Bradford, Birmingham, Valladolid, Vitoria, Segovia o Soria. Una denuncia internacional contra situación ocultada por la propia Iglesia Católico y conservadurismo navarro, exponiendo el secreto y el miedo de centenares de personas que viven con la herida incurable del abuso. De nuevo, el artista nos habla de el arte de explorar fantasmas, de mirar atrás y ser capaces de conocer y asumir nuestra propia sombra. Un arte con sentido crítico y resiliente. "The Shadow" no debe ser únicamente un proyecto artístico, sino debe ser un detonante de resistencia, denuncia y visibilización. La sombra de Carlota"Un día, él me dijo que lo que me hacía era como jugar, desde ese día no quise jugar nunca más. Cada vez que tenía un juguete en la mano tenía miedo que viniera y me tocara, tenía miedo a reír, miedo a ser feliz". En el mes de Diciembre, Carlota viajó a Pamplona para participar en el proyecto. Junto a Abel Azcona visitó los emplazamientos de la infancia de ella, mientras narraba su historia personal al artista. Los dos terminaron sentados en los columpios del parque infantil donde durante años Carlota había vivido."Él era mi sombra. Tenía únicamente nueve años y él, hermano de mi padre, me besaba con un aliento terrible, mi espalda y mi cuerpo de niña. Me penetro varias veces, yo no sabía si el dolor era normal. O si eran unas cosquillas muy fuertes". Carlota nació en Pamplona hace más de treinta años. Es hija de una familia de nueve hermanos. Siete hombres y dos mujeres. Cuando era una niña asistía a un colegio de niñas. El hermano de su padre, un religioso perteneciente al Opus Dei en Navarra, abuso de ella en más de veinte ocasiones. Al igual que de su otra hermana. Carlota cuando cumplió la mayoría de edad denunció, pero a la semana retiró la demanda por presión de su entorno. "Recuerdo que cuando venía a casa nos decía a mis hermanos y a mi que rezáramos mucho y que Dios nos quería, gracias a él aprendí a odiar a Dios." En la actualidad Carlota solo siente como familia a su hermana, con la que comparte la experiencia de abuso, el resto de la familia le ha dado la espalda. Hace años que no vive en Pamplona, por lo complicado de la situación tuvo que abandonar la ciudad. Llora cada vez que vuelve a pisar la que para ella es una ciudad gris y llena de secretos.La sombra de Carlota.Parque vinculado a la infancia de Carlota en Pamplona.La sombra de Tomás"Aquel hombre malo siempre me esperaba detrás de la puerta de las habitaciones, veía por el pasillo su sombra y temblaba. Me decía que lo que me hacía era normal, que estaba bien, pero que si lo contaba no tendría amigos nunca más." En el mes de Diciembre, Tomás acompañado por Abel Azcona, visitó los emplazamientos vinculados a su infancia. Tomás y Abel se contaron mutuamente sus experiencias personales y los dos terminaron su encuentro sentados en los columpios donde el propio Tomás había jugado en diversas ocasiones durante toda su infancia."Lo denuncié, no me creyeron, pero me cambiaron de internado. Ya no volví a verlo, pero siempre recordaré sus manos en mi cuerpo y su mirada de deseo. Yo miraba la puerta de mi habitación creyendo que aparecería en cualquier momento." Procedente de una familia de seis hermanos, junto a su hermano mayor fue a un internado católico debido a su conducta, según su padres, no adecuada. Durante los tres años que formaba parte del alumnado del centro, fue abusado por un miembro del equipo docente. Finalmente lo denunció en su casa, pero únicamente fue cambiado de centro y curso el bachillerato en un colegio masculino de Pamplona vinculado al Opus Dei."Yo sabía que estaba mal, pero muchas veces lo olvidaba. Para mi, por mi educación católica era pecado, era una secreto inconfesable. Una vergüenza. Cuando mi familia lo supo, me cambiaron de centro y no se volvió a hablar nunca más. " Tomás tiene 18 años. En este momento ha empezado un grado en la Universidad de Navarra vinculada al Opus Dei. Él afirma que intenta vivir como si no hubiera pasado, pero le sigue afectando en su vida diaria. Una herida que siempre estará en su piel.La sombra de Tomás.Parque vinculado a la infancia de Tomás en Pamplona.La sombra de Ernesto"Sólo fue una vez, cinco minutos tan rápido que a veces pensaba que lo había soñado. Nunca lo conté, sólo lo escribí. Leia mi cuaderno para no olvidarlo, porque olvidarlo hubiera sido mentirme a mi mismo. En el colegio no podía contarlo, él era el ejemplo a seguir. Nadie me creería, además él me dijo que lo que me hacía estaba bien. Era amor, y Dios quería que los hombres se dieran amor. Ahora lo recuerdo y siento repulsión. Aquello no era amor y mis miedos no me dejaban asumirlo. Pero siempre me ha perseguido y me persigue como una sombra. Ya no soy capaz de amar a otras personas sin sentirlo antinatural, sin sentirme sucio."Ernesto ya es adulto, pero hace tan sólo diez años cuando asistía un colegio masculino navarro vinculado al Opus Dei tuvo una experiencia de abuso por el sacerdote del centro. Al ser únicamente una vez, se sintió culpable y lo ocultó. Hoy en día todavía no lo ha denunciado. Pero siente que le ha marcado de por vida en todos los aspectos de su vida.La sombra de Ernesto.Parque vinculado a la infancia de Ernesto en Pamplona.La sombra de AlbertoLa sombra de Alberto. Parque vinculado a la infancia de Alberto en Pamplona.La sombra de NicolásLa sombra de Nicolás. Parque vinculado a la infancia de Nicolás en Pamplona.La sombra de AbelLa sombra de Abel.Parque vinculado a la infancia de Abel en Pamplona.La sombra de SantiLa sombra de Santi.Parque vinculado a la infancia de Santi en Pamplona.La sombra de VirginiaLa sombra de Virginia.Parque vinculado a la infancia de story:
Buskers 's Bunkhouse A Haven for Artists , Performers And Musicians

Bywater Neighborhood of New Orleans, Louisiana

WHO WE ARE

Buskers Bunkhouse, is a haven for, musicians, artists, and buskers. Ms Pearl, a resident of the Bywater neighborhood of New Orleans, began the Kamp naming it Kamp Katrina after the storm as a tent city in her backyard, housing those displaced by the storm. Buskers Bunkhouse has evolved into an art colony and refuge for buskers, independent filmmakers, and performers. The Kamp Katrina project film and book was a collaboration between Buskers Bunkhouse residents, a California filmmaker, a college writing teacher, a high school writing teacher, and an associate dean.

The project began during a professional conference in New Orleans where the film Kamp Katrina was screened. Ms Pearl invited the audience to her home to see the real story behind the film, as she believed that the film didn't “tell the real story.” Currently, the project includes this book as well as a forthcoming film Kamp Katrina: A Love Letter to New Orleans, and a website that continues the Kamp Katrina story online.

Buskers Bunkhouse helps Local and international artists aid in the recovery, restoration, and rebirth of their city's unique cultural practices thru hosting artists and bands from all over the world, participating and grand marshaling parades and second lines for non profit 's such as the Goodchildren's Carnival Club. Participating in grass rots political efforts to maintain the Bywater, Buskers Bunkhouse has put together a non profit brass band with the help of Miguel Alvarado and Clifford MC Peak, two Long time musicians. We do jazz Funerals and play music for the community: St Margres Nursing Home is a recent example.

The Project documents a publicizes the socio-political struggles of post-Katrina Bywater by helping independent filmmakers as well as cataloging Buskers Bunkhouse visitors the areas parades , people ,and events.

Kamp Katrina/Buskers Bunkhouse has experienced the highs of being part of the historical remaking of the unique New Orleans culture. As well as the lows of a neighborhood struggling with the new gentrification and trying not to become another sterile bedroom community.

The Bunkhouse has housed many local and international artists preserving old forms of music and performing arts while birthing new ones . Ms. Pearl who keeps a large garden for the residents, says, “I can't create a rosebush, or an artist, but I can put them both in good fertile soil and watch them grow.” She considers herself a folk historian and a patron of the local arts. Through her inspiration, Kamp Katrina and its residents have been the subject of blogs, books, films, and magazine articles. Ms. Pearl was honored as a local hero in Gambit' Magazine and named the Grand Marshall of the 2009 and 2013 New Orleans Fringe Festival.

However, Ms. Pearl and the rest of the residents have endured dark times as well. Many of the residents suffer from post-traumatic stress syndrome as a result of Hurricane Katrina and the trauma of recovery however they have continued to serve the community lobbing for protection and permits and recondition.

Thankfully the police are on our side, and Kristen Palmer, our representative sent her staff to meet with Buskers Bunkhouse At Flora's, A local hang out frequented by many locals and Europeans as well. Communication has resulted in some good things. The 8 pm curfew on buskers isn't being enforced, and new places for buskers to work have appeared in the French market and other areas. Street performing has evolved into street theater, but artists must have a place to live and practice that's close to the French Quarter. A Plethora of well meaning new residents drawn by the areas popularity and the fact that it didn't flood during the storms are arriving in large numbers. They, like my new neighbor across the street, has complained about the people on either side of him and to bunkhouse about hearing people talk. Bands and dance troupes, such as The Gris Gris Strut, practice here, and we always stop before 9pm. Still, he complains, wearing a Bywater T shirt as If It were a police uniform.. The majority of the neighborhood has no problem with music and people talking, even after 9 pm.

We need a neighborhood that reflects the majorities desires. Recently there has been a war on our culture. Old laws have appeared that haven't been enforced for years. Live music venues such as the St Roch Tavern and others have been fined and restricted to a point articles have been written pointing at the abuse of power we all witnessed during the St Roch trial, Mimi's is now at risk along with other live music and parade venues.

We can and we will rise up. This takes funding. Buskers Bunkhouse has always existed on tips alone. Its no longer a efficient way to maintain Buskers Bunkhouse.  Your donations will go to help with construction repairs so that we can continue to help house busker's from all over the world who come to our beautiful city to make their way in the world.  We have been ordered to make some repairs and due to our growing popularity our needs have outgrown our tips.

Recently we hosted Kiriaka, A Swedish drum troupe of over 30 that travels the world. While Kiriaka was hosted by Buskers Bunkhouse they participated in at least 5 non profit venues in the New Orleans area. We now have a new band practice space and can host full bands of 20 people.

We are in the process of securing a non profit status, so that helping us helps you as well. Your contributions will be tax deductible.
