story:
Wilkins Block Party is a free community fundraising music and arts festival, taking place annually in April at the heart of Schenley Park in Pittsburgh, PA. This year we are teaming up with a local organization, 1Hood Media, to raise funds for their mission to educate youth and promote a unified community through art and activism.

THIS YEARS LINE UP: Jasiri X + Soul Man Idasa Tariq | Beauty Slap | SPISH | Memphis Hill | Jack Stauber | Benji | Starship Mantis + 1Hood's (Live from the City & LUC) | Blak Rapp Madusa | Cousin Boneless | Bat Zuppel | Zaneta Grant | Pinstripe Sunny | 

Conceptualized by Jon Mark and Nick Zukoski, and pioneered by an underground community known as The South, the Wilkins Block Party has evolved from a bangin' party for students during Carnival weekend to a full blown music and arts festival for the community to bond. Pittsburgh rock n roll group Memphis Hill has been hosting the annual event at their former HQ in Squirrel Hill since 2013.

The festival has seen rapid expansion each year. This year will be bigger and better than ever, with an added stage, live visual art, vendors, and new sponsors and partners. Our mission is simple: we provide a showcase for local musicians, show the public a great time, AND facilitate funding for important non-profit organizations in our community.

Redfishbowl is a grassroots artist collective that has become a huge player in developing the Wilkins Block Party. Based out of Pittsburgh, PA. Their objective is to make our city a more culturally diverse place, by unifying the creative community through the common thread of art, and music. Through curating events in different boroughs of our city, we create a platform for any artist of any medium to gain exposure, opportunity, and connect with the artistic community.

A word from founder, Jon Mark: "The Wilkins Block Party started as an idea I had after reflecting on the difference between CMU's carnival weekend and the spring weekends I experienced when visiting high school friends at other schools. There seemed to be something missing in my spring weekend that I had experienced elsewhere and I was determined to fill that void in a way that would both improve the student life experience and bring together the student community. What started as an attempt to throw a cool party quickly grew into an event focused on music, art, community, and proof that college kids were capable of orchestrating and managing a large scale event that was both safe and fun. Since its first year, the event has evolved into a tradition and I could not be more proud of everyone who has contributed to making that a reality. On a personal note, the thing I am most grateful for is how planning this event made me closer to a group of people that continue to be incredibly important in my life and it makes me really happy to see how the event builds relationships among those who are still active in producing it today in a positive way."

The Wilkins Block Party isn't just about supporting local music and bringing the neighborhood together. It's also about giving back to the Pittsburgh community. By contributing to our crowd funding campaign, you are also donating to 1HOOD MEDIA!

About 1Hood Media

 1Hood Media is a collective of socially conscious artists and activists who utilize art as a means of raising awareness about social justice matters affecting people around the world. This is reflected by their Artivist Academy that proceeds from the Block Party are supporting:

1Hood Artivist Academy develops the next contingency of artists and activists who stand as the first response to matters negatively impacting social justice using art and modern activist methodologies to confront injustices and amplify the messages of the disenfranchised, while being mindful of the psychological and physical impact of this work on self and family. We take a holistic approach to cultivating both the artist and the activist, individually, to fulfill the duties assigned by, not only by the urgency of the time, but as required by artists and activist upon whose shoulders we stand, “It is an artist's duty to reflect the times” and Paul Robeson told us, “The answer to injustice is not to silence the critic, but to end the injustice.” Our mission is to prepare the artist and activist of today to successfully receive the baton and continue to build upon the foundation that was lain so many years ago.

Support the cause! Help us reach our goal! 

We want YOU to be a part of the experience. This year is going to be a huge undertaking that our coordinators won't soon forget. Any contribution helps in allowing this tradition to continue to grow and leave a positive impact the minds, bodies, and spirits of its patrons.

With your support, we will be able to: 

Stages and sound for the festival!

Receive permits to  run the event!

Tents and outdoor Shelter !

Rent a Community Hydrating station !

Provide insurance for the event!

Obtain portable restrooms!

Provide Safety and Security !

Nine hours of live music from many of Pittsburgh's finest bands and knowing that you've contributed to a great cause... Well how much is that worth to you?

(Wilkins Wrist Bands are not required proof of admission to the festival. They are an token of your donation to the 1HOOD)

story:
We Are Team Philippines

My name is Juan C and with my team mates from the University of the Philippines Pep Squad, we will be representing our school and our country  as Team Philippines in this year's Cheerleading World Championships.

We have earned our eligibility to compete again this year, as we have successfully done in past championships; we have been training for many months, and we are very eager to face this competition with utmost pride and passion. In addition to training and leveling -up our skills, we have another challenge:

We Need to Reach in Berlin.

The 8th CWC, happens every two years, hosted and organized by the International Federation of Cheerleading, and will take place at the Max-Schmeling Halle in Berlin, Germany,

This campaign aims to raise funds to be able to afford the trip that will help us defend our country's place as top contenders.  In the past years, Team Philippines has surprised the world by winning the bronze medal in the Mixed Team Cheer division, on its first time to qualify for the World Championships in Hong Kong. This award was successfully reclaimed during the last CWC in Bangkok, Thailand, and in addition, another bronze medal for the Mixed Group Stunt Category. The highest our country has gone in the World Championships.

Along with 47 delegates from our university, including me as one of the coaches and over 40 full-time student-athletes, we are on a mission to prove that despite challenges in school, in finances, and in athletic advantages, the PHILIPPINES CAN PRODUCE STUDENT-ATHLETES worthy of the world's attention and respect.


For The Love Of...

At their finest, athletes are backed up by huge sponsorships, training facilities and the luxury of training time.

Our team, however, makes use of our committed training time after school hours - everyday, we work within our university's budget, we reach out to supportive alumni for necessary equipment, and we survive with our eagerness and enthusiasm from our students and coaches, helping us maintain our place as the only goverment-funded students contending against privately-sponsored teams.

Our team is composed of regular full-time students in our university who train to learn and re-learn skills at par with professional cheerleaders. Our coaching staff is composed of medical doctors, teachers, associate professors, and instructors who take time as volunteer coaches in stunting, gymnastics, and dance with their years of experience as former team mates and proud alumni of our university.

Of course, this has its perks as it has its downside. And personally raising the money to participate in this event is one of the latter.


The Fine Print

Truthfully, this attempt to crowd fund is both a plan B and a last resort. I am building this campaign to fund a portion of what one delegate is required to pay in time for our departure on November 16, 2015.  This is also only a part of our other initiatives to raise funds through other sources, including personal crowdfunding for individual members of the team.

To participate, each delegate will shoulder the airfare to and from Berlin, airport transfers, meals, suits, visa processing, and lodging organized by the local organizing committee in Germany.

We have been finding ways for over a year, and we are still trying to get the remaining weight of these fees off our shoulders. But we are certain that we will find generous support, we are simply proactively finding ways to clear our minds of our finances, in order to completely focus on our training, skills and our routines.

Its going to be difficult, the pressure is going to be high, and it will be expensive. But 'expensive' is atleast something we can ask our supporters for help.


Other Ways You Can Boost

If you have read this far, then I am very grateful that you have took the time to do so, and more grateful that your interest in our sport, or maybe your interest to help has led you here.

For your contributions whether through funding or networking or sharing, please accept my personal appreciation and also of my entire team.

We continue to ask for your support as our event comes closer.

Thank you for your kindness and positivity!

story:
Spread over three weekends from March through May 2011, To Art & Profit is an interdisciplinary performance festival augmented with arts-focused dialogues and Carnival-inspired street theatre spectacle throughout the city of Chicago. The festival pairs Chicago-based artists across discipline and genre, asking them to create performances concerned with the value and purpose of creative labor.


Each performance weekend of To Art and Profit is linked to different Chicago neighborhoods (Logan Square, Pilsen, Bronzeville). Finding various ways to invite community participation, this series explores how art can be profitable, accountable and accessible. In addition to the Links performances, there will be street theater spectacles and public discussions on the following themes:


March 18-20: What Is It Good For? Defining Art's Purpose Now

April 15-17: Quit Bullshittin': Recognizing Division and Building Solidarity in the Arts

May 20-22: Come As You Are: Re-Imagining Art with a Conscience

For more information, visit LinksHall.org

Tickets: http://toartanprofitweek3lh-eorg.eventbrite.com/

For your Donation:

Your contribution will go towards artist's fees, rehearsal space, marketing and festival documentation costs.


Spread the word! Share our campaign and support your local arts economy!

Join the conversation on http://toartandprofit.wordpress.com

ART in the Open - Art a Ciel Ouvert 2012

(En Franciase ici: http://wp.me/pP9NA-uV )

The City of Charlottetown, this town is small, the Confederation Centre Art Gallery, the Island Media Arts Co-op and the Prince Edward Island Council of the Arts have come together to present the 2012 edition of Art in the Open / Art a Ciel Ouvert!

 

Last year:

 

- Over 3000 people attended Art in the Open / Art a Ciel Ouvert!

 

- 36 contemporary Visual Art projects were presented with 80 Artists  participating from PEI, the Atlantic Region and across Canada!

 

- Attracted over 13,500 hits to the Art in the Open Website!

 

- Public Green spaces and downtown pedestrian spaces were celebrated with activities and entertainment for people of all ages!

---

In 2011, the City of Charlottetown, through its Cultural Capital of Canada designation, in partnership with this town is small and the Confederation Centre Art Gallery, presented ‘Art in the Open’ in downtown Charlottetown on Saturday, August 27 2011, 4:00pm to 12 midnight. This one-day visual arts festival presented 36 contemporary visual art and performance installations. 80 artists from PEI, the Atlantic Region and across Canada participated.

Works were presented at Victoria Park, Connaught Square, Rochford Square, Victoria Row, and The Guild. Various downtown galleries/museums included on-site demonstrations throughout the day.

Organizers are thrilled with the response to the festival and estimate that 3,000 people participated in the event.

Many people (artists and audience)have asked organizers if this initiative will continue.

One person stated in an unsolicited email, “it was magic” while another noted, “Gerald's tree gave me goose bumps” and “At 11pm my dog and I claimed a campfire and I chanted”.

 

Official 2011 web page: http://thistownissmall.wordpress.com/project-ar...

 

Photos from 2011: https://www.facebook.com/aitocharlottetown

---

In order to pay artists professionally and to showcase the incredible diversity of creative expression on PEI, Art in the Open requires more funding!

Due to the 2011 Cultural Capital Designation in no longer available the festival is seeking assistance from the community and private business.

By supporting Art in the Open - Art a Ciel Ouvert 2012 you will be:

 

1) Supporting the sustainability of local culture and expression!

2) Directly supporting Artists from Prince Edward Island to create and showcase some incredible Artwork - this opportunity allows artists to reach a large audience and engage directly with their local community.

 

3) Be officially a part of Charlottetown's One Night Visual Arts Festival - even if you haven' t touched a crayon since kindergarten!

 

4) Recognized as a patron of Arts and Culture - in various ways:

 

POP ART PATRON! less than 100 dollars

 

Recognition as a Pop Art Patron on the Art in the Open thank you page! High fives, and sincere gratitude from all partnering organizations.

 

 

IMPRESSIONIST PATRON! 100 to 499 dollars

 

Your name will be recognized during the festival - Spoken by one of the official Art in the Open Town Criers!

Recognition as an Impressionist Patron on the Art in the Open thank you page!

High fives, and sincere gratitude from all partnering organizations.

 

MODERN PATRON! 500 to 999 dollars

 

Your logo or name will be included as an official Modern Patron on the Art in the Open main website page (minimum of 8 weeks! - reaching an international audience! – OVER 7000 HITS ON THE WEBSITE LAST YEAR!)

 

Receive TWO Exclusive Art in the Open Patron T-Shirts! Featuring you name or logo.

 

Your name will be recognized during the festival - Spoken by one of the official Art in the Open Town Criers!

 

Recognition on the Art in the Open thank you page!

High fives, and sincere gratitude from all partnering organizations.

 

 

AVANT GARDE PATRON - Official Exhibit Sponsor! - 1000  to 4999 dollars

 

Avant Garde Patrons will be official sponsors of individual art exhibits. The money will go directly to local artists - ensuring local Island artist are paid professional fees and receive material support for their creations! Your company logo or name will be printed as an official sponsor in the Festival catalogue (distributed before and during the Festival) as well as on posters that showcase your sponsored artist!

 

You and a guest will be invited to an exclusive Art in the Open Festival kick off Party! (the week before the Festival)

 

Receive TWO Exclusive Art in the Open Patron T-Shirts! Featuring you name or logo.

 

Recognition on the Art in the Open thank you page! And high fives from all partnering organizations, and participating artists!

 

Your name will be recognized during the festival - Spoken by one of the official Art in the Open Town Criers!

 

Your logo or name will be included as an official sponsors on the Art in the Open main website (minimum of 8 weeks! - reaching an international audience!)

 

RENAISSANCE PATRON - OFFICIAL PARTNER! more than 5000 dollars

 

Renaissance Patrons join the list of OFFICIAL PARTNERS of Art in the Open 2012 - joining the current list of partners: The city of Charlottetown, this town is small, the Confederation Centre Art Gallery, the Island Media Art Co-op, and the PEI Council of the Arts!

 

Your logo or name will be included as an Official Festival Partner on the Art in the Open main website and the Confederation Centre Art Gallery web site (minimum of 8 weeks)

 

Your company, logo or name will be recognized as an Official Partner on all festival publications, banners and media promotion.

 

Your name will be recognized during the festival - Spoken by one of the official Art in the Open Town Criers!

 

5 tickets to the exclusive Art in the Open Festival kick off Party! (The week before the Festival)

 

Receive 5 Exclusive Art in the Open Patron T-Shirts! Featuring you name or logo.

 

Recognition on the Art in the Open thank you page! And high fives from all partnering organizations, and participating artists!

 

* If the festival is unable to acquire significant funding for the 2012 event all money will be returned to all levels of patronage.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Spread the word by sharing this Campaign with your friends and colleagues!

 

Volunteer! Sign up to be a volunteer at Art in the Open by emailing

this.town.is.small@gmail.com

 

Support your local arts scene and come out and enjoy the night August 25 2012!

story:
Short Summary

 

So, many of you know me, Dean Montalbano.... and those who do know that

  • I have an artists soul
  • I have been smothering in my "day Job" for the last 10 years and...
  • it is killing me!

I have a chance, almost too good to be true, to open a gallery space showcasing my Face and body art, sculpture, masks, puppets, costumes and more- all in ONE space and in a busy arts community smack in the middle of the International Drive tourist area of Orlando Florida. 

What We Need & What You Get

 

In order to open this space, I need more capital than I have.  The last few years have been very difficult on every level- personally, professionally emotionally and spiritually- and now is a time of healing.  But I am still in a defecit so I need a little hand up.

Between now and the October opening I need to obtain licenses,  displays, create inventory, prepare our full color book/ catalog, make tons of stock, prepare flyers, business cards, and more.

I am planning a line of paper mache and leather art masks, that can also double as steam punk costume pieces.  Small hand made gothic utility kilts, gauntlets and sculpted pieces along with molded leather puppets of all kinds will make this a visually amazing store. But this needs materials.

In addition, the offering of live canvas art, body paints, rhinestone body art, and more- done both as performance pieces and custom work on live models, will make it an attraction.  But- for that we have to have plenty of makeup and materials on hand.

To fill the store with hand-made artisan soap, I need to spend MOST of September making the stuff,  which means buying gallons of oils, butters, micas and more to make sure the store smells and looks AMAZING!

We need to get large format prints made of my work and more!  The grand opening of this space is October 16th, and we only get once chance to make a grand impression.  This means the world to me.

The Impact

Ok so, on an artistic level, I really think that putting body painting into a mainstream environment will offer a new visual and creative experience to millions of people.  With Orlando being a crossroad for the whole world, people from all over will have an opportunity to see, buy and EXPERIENCE live face and body art that goes BEYOND the theme park bunny rabbit.

On a personal note-  this really is the reset I have needed.  I don't want to offer a sob story, but for the first time in years, I am looking forward to tomorrow.  I see a place about to form that both welcomes and values the creative content I have and can allow me to share that creativity with others, make a living, and leave behind an environment that has been stifling and limiting.

It also will offer me a way back to fulfill obligations to authors and people from the magic world who did a lot to help me long ago.

In short- It's a way back to life.

    Risks & Challenges

    To make this work, it has to be full time all or nothing.  I have to not only stay unique and interesting, I have to keep the space filled with things for people to see, buy and enjoy!

    I will be leaving my safety net, my full time job of 22 years and jumping on a leap of faith.

    • I've done it before and made it work
    • I share this dream with many other artists and vendors who will be participating in this space with their own visions.
    • We are backed by one of the largest developers, and biggest re-developed mall properties in the Orlando area and they WANT us to succeed ad well.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • If that's you-  THANKS for at least reading this far.  Any encouragement or positive energy you can spare to send my way will be appreciated!
    • If you know anyone else who is in a position to help, and who you think could see the value in this- Please drop them a quick note saying "I think you could help make this dream come true" and send them a link to this page.   I've only got about 4 weeks to make or break it!
    • If you think you can help in any other ways....  Please drop me a note. and THANKS AGAIN for  reading this far. 

    Have a blessed day!

story:
ANOTHER UPDATE!!

I would like to start by thanking all of you that contributed to or helped promote this fundraiser!!! It was a major success! THANK YOOOOOOU!!

However, the funds from IndieGoGo just hit my bank TODAY. Soooo... I just ordered the Cintiqu and all of the shipping products to ship all of your stuff. Unfortunately. that means the highly optimistic delivery time of September will probably not happen for some people. Please expect to get your stuff between mid-September and early October.
Also, for anyone that wasn't able to order something, I now have a store up! WEEE!
http://ashleywitter.storenvy.com/
Thank you again!!
-Ashley!

Update: 

OMGSH!!! HOLY WOW!!! Less than 24 hours and we already passed our goal!!

Thank you all soooo much!

Even though the goal is met, I am (of course) going to keep the fundraiser going. I have an endless need for more art supplies. And every penny will go to that. I need a scanner, paints, canvas, easels, paper, cables, brushes,... so many things.

So if you still want to get some neat stuff, you have plenty of time!!
I REALLY hope someone gets the "You're in the comic" perk... HINT HINT!
(>.<)

 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

Ashley Witter: The Epic Funding Campaign of Destiny!

Who am I? 

Hi! I'm Ashley! I am a semi-professional artist looking to make a drastic upgrade to my studio: a touch-screen, digital art tablet.

I am a graduate of Madison Area Technical College with a degree in animation and conceptual development.
Currently, I live in the Chicagoland area and am a freelance artist specializing in comic books and concept art.

My notable projects so far:

Anne Rice's Interview with the Vampire: Claudia's Story.
Artist and writer.

 

Bloodthirsty: One Nation Under Water
Artist

 

Twilight: The Graphic Novels Vol II and Vol III
Inker

 

Squarriors
Artist

 

Why do I need a tablet?

Every day I get closer to achieving my dream of being a full-time, professional artist.
I spend hours and hours during those days drawing and painting, working to become the best artist I can be. With more and more work coming in with bigger and better projects, I have found that I cannot work to my potential with my current tools.


Today, being able to digitally work on your art is a necessity. Every professional project I have done has required me to ink, tone, color, and even draw, digitally.


A Cintiq HD touch pad tablet would take me to the next level. It would upgrade me to using industry-standard equipment and allow me to work at my full capacity. Employers expect artists to have the necessary tools for their profession. And right now, I don't. With my current, meager setup it's very hard to keep up on my deadlines and I am at risk of not staying competitive with other artists.

These things are not cheap! And with paying the bills on an artist's salary, it could take me another year (or more) to save the extra nickels and dimes.
So I'm going to the magical internet to humbly beg for a lot of help!

 

What I want!

My ideal tablet is the Cintiq 22" HD Touch. It retails at $2,500.
If I get maximum funding the other $500 will go towards cables, tax and whatever other fees that turn up.

If I do not make my full funding, the money will be used to get one of the cheaper models such as the non-touch version, or one with a smaller work space.

What you get!!

Now the fun part for you!

I have a bunch of cool stuff for those of you that can help a girl out!

 

  • Your name and link on a special page on my site.
  • Super rad prints!
  • Squarriors posters signed by me (the artist) and Ash Maczko (the writer).
  • Original commssion sketches!
  • Original artwork pages from Interview with the Vampire and Bloodthirsty! Hot damn!

Other Ways You Can Help

Let's face it, I need money.
If you also don't have money, maybe you can pass this on to someone that DOES have money! <3

story:
The sculpture, Nurturing, in front of Hillsides’ administration building looks pretty much as the finished sculpture will look when cast in bronze.   Jesse at the foundry described how the patinating process would pretty closely match the color of the redwood, even duplicating dark streaks of grain.  Through this website,  igg.me/at/goyo/x/3125557  I am asking for donations for the bronze casting and building the pedestal on which it will stand.

Greg’s Background

For many years, I worked at Ventura Community College  as English/ESL instructor and sculpted wood as a part time  pleasure. On retirement, I discovered that experimenting with sculpture was how I wished to use these extra leisure hours.

I am not a trained sculptor, which probably contributes to how I carve. I see that everything is connected, and that wood has the same spirit as I do - this thing - has, or a rock, or a leaf has.

In carving a piece of wood, I look to see what the wood wants to become, and as I work I see the wood’s spirit emerge. The piece starts to come alive, and at its completion it is ready to interact with us, other spirits.

Greg Marquez, sculptor

“Nurturing” was created through an unusual series of events. Clearing away the dead and unwanted wood and bark, the piece reached a point where I was stuck. The wood wasn’t responding. I couldn’t see what it wanted to become. There was something there, but I couldn’t see it. This went on for a couple of months while I kept busy on another piece. Finally, after a couple of months and while reading a book that described looping, the sculpture suddenly became clear.

But first, looping. In the book, the author described how in nature, a looping feedback process occurs in many situations, and the development of the human brain is a good example. As the reptilian brain - at the level of eat or be eaten - evolved over millions of years to include mammalian - caring and family concern - the new capacities were looped back to the reptilian, thereby supplementing the basics from which the new mammalian would grow.

Then one day, looking at the sculpture again, the intuition came, and it was obvious. There was one piece of root, but two figures rising out of it. And the theme was evident. A mother is nurturing its infant, and on a different scale, the child the mother. Looping was in action, and in addition, the piece represented the classic wisdom of the many as one and one as many, both simultaneously.

This experience of discovery left me with such an indelible insight into the world and its workings that I didn’t feel that the sculpture was mine, but rather it existed through me. I was its transforming instrument, and its transformative experience needed to be shared.

Hillsides seemed to be an ideal site for this purpose, and when I offered it to them, it was immediately accepted. Joe, who heads Hillsides was very gracious in thanking me. I felt I should be thanking him for his giving Nurturing a home.

am not a trained sculptor, which probably contributes to how I carve. I see
that everything is connected, and that wood has the same spirit as I do - this
thing - has, or a rock, or a leaf has.
In
carving a piece of wood, I look to see what the wood wants to become, and as I
work I see the wood’s spirit emerge. The piece starts to come alive, and at its
completion it is ready to interact with us, other spirits.


Greg Marquez, sculptor

“Nurturing” was created
through an unusual series of events. Clearing away the dead and unwanted wood
and bark, the piece reached a point where I was stuck. The wood wasn’t
responding. I couldn’t see what it wanted to become. There was something there,
but I couldn’t see it. This went on for a couple of months while I kept busy on
another piece. Finally, after a couple of months and while reading a book that
described looping, the sculpture suddenly became clear.
But first, looping. In the
book, the author described how in nature, a looping feedback process occurs in
many situations, and the development of the human brain is a good example. As
the reptilian brain - at the level of eat or be eaten - evolved over millions
of years to include mammalian - caring and family concern - the new capacities
were looped back to the reptilian, thereby supplementing the basics from which
the new mammalian would grow.
Then one day, looking at the sculpture
again, the intuition came, and it was obvious. There was one piece of root, but
two figures rising out of it. And the theme was evident. A mother is nurturing
its infant, and on a different scale, the child the mother. Looping was in
action, and in addition, the piece represented the classic wisdom of the many
as one and one as many, both simultaneously.
This experience of discovery
left me with such an indelible insight into the world and its workings that I
didn’t feel that the sculpture was mine, but rather it existed through me. I
was its transforming instrument, and its transformative experience needed to be
shared.
Hillsides seemed to be an
ideal site for this purpose, and when I offered it to them, it was immediately
accepted. Joe, who heads Hillsides was very gracious in thanking me. I
felt I should be thanking him for his giving Nurturing a home.

story:
What Are We Doing

Let's start of by telling you what I'm NOT doing.  I'm not making potato salad.  I'm not making cookies or paper airplanes and I'm not going to draw you an ugly tree.

I did wrestle with the decision for where to post this campaign.  We are a fledgling small business but this is really all about the art - creating unique objects out of glass.

There was a time when the trade of glassblowing was an elite pursuit dominated by craftsmen in the City of Venice, Italy - most notably on the island of Murano.  In modern times, although the glassblowing trade has expanded to major cities around the world, the fascination with glassblowing, of creating works of art out of molten glass, is not limited to the larger centers of population.  We face that challenge here in the Tri-Cities, a mostly agricultural grouping of communities in south-central Washington State.  The only way we can pursue the glassblowing arts is by traveling several hours to Seattle or Portland, just to find a studio with the necessary equipment.  The goal of this campaign is to bring the ancient art of Venetian glassblowing to our community.

Why Are We Doing This

Starting a glassblowing studio from scratch is not an inexpensive undertaking.  Economies can be achieved by limiting the size of the basic equipment - the path we've chosen to take.  Whereas a commercial studio can easily spend $200,000 or more for the melting furnace, glory holes and annealers, our fully functional studio will acquire these pieces of equipment, along with some supporting equipment like pipe warmers, pipe coolers and the glassblower's bench, for under $20,000.  I have already ordered that equipment and expect delivery for most of the equipment is by September, 2014.  This equipment is not a part of this campaign - I have been preparing for the day when I can open a glassblowing studio and the cost of the larger pieces of equipment is already covered.

How Can You Help?

With the larger pieces of equipment in place, there still remains a significant cost to make the studio operational.  This campaign is intended to help fund the purchase of the supporting equipment.  To give you an idea of where the campaign funds will be used, here's a brief list (with approximate prices) for the basic tools that are needed:

  • Optic molds (for shaping molten glass)  $  250 each
  • Wood Paddles  $ 30 each
  • Swedish Blocks  $  100 each
  • Round Blocks  $  75 each
  • Blow Pipes  $  175 each
  • Punty Rods (solid pipes)  $  100 each
  • Hot Glass Shears  $  175 each
  • Trim Shears  $ 85 each
  • Crimping and Flattening Tools  $  80 each
  • Jacks (large, specially-designed "tweezers")  $  250 each
  • Pastorelli Plates and Carriers  $  425
  • Lap Grinder & Grinding Discs  $2,150
  • Safety Clothing (heat-resistant jacket, apron, gloves)  $  500

To provide the basic tooling for the most basic of studios is estimated to cost around $6,000.  Then, even with the tooling and equipment in place, various forms of glass are needed.

  • Glass Cullet (crushed glass for the furnace)  $1,200
  • Glass Frit and Powders (adds color to the finished glass art)  $2,500

This brings us to the goal of this campaign - to raise as much of the roughly $10,000 needed to finish furnishing a basic glassblowing studio with the capabilities to create the pieces of glass art that will be used as rewards for our backers.  I've set the goal for the campaign at the absolute minimum funding needed to get the most basic operations going.  I will attempt to cash-flow as much as possible and any additional funding will allow me to obtain more of the tools and supplies to create more art glass.

What Do You Get For Your Support?

For supporting our efforts to establish a traditional glassblowing studio in the Tri-Cities, you'll receive my sincere thanks and a bumper sticker.



Glass Ornament - One of our hand-made blown glass ornaments, approximately 3" in diameter, with an integral loop, for hanging the ornament.  Are you a Redneck???  The color selections for the ornament rewards includes camouflage, 12th Man (Seahawks blue & green), burgundy & grey (WSU Cougar colors), and a few traditional Christmas color schemes.  You can decorate your Christmas tree or display the ornaments year-round.  Three reward levels are planned, for a single ornament and for two and four ornament sets.  (See images in Gallery)

Small Round Paperweight - One of our hand-made solid glass round paperweights, approximately 3" in diameter.  (See image in Gallery)

Large Pyramid-Shaped Paperweight - One of our hand-made solid glass pyramid-shaped paperweights, approximately 4" in diameter and 4" high.  (See image in Gallery)

Glass Handkerchief (Ruffle-Edge) Bowl - One of our hand-made blown glass handkerchief bowls, approximately 9" across and 4" high.  (See image in Gallery)

Rewards Delivery

Production of the rewards cannot begin until the equipment is set up and all the tools and glass have been purchased and delivered.  Most of the important equipment has arrived and should be installed and operational by the end of September.  Running this campaign before the equipment is being placed in operation will allow me to place the order for the remainder of the tools and a supply of clear and colored glass.  I anticipate that production of the rewards will begin in early October.  At this time, with no real gauge of how popular this campaign will be, I have set the official rewards delivery date as December, 2014.  With the quantity limits I've set, there should be no problem with delivery of the rewards on-time.  If the participation exceeds my expectations, I will add additional rewards opportunities, however delivery for the new rewards categories will likely be after January 1, 2015.  Rewards items will be shipped as soon as they are created and I will do my best to create them in the same order as when my backers commit their funds to this campaign.  What that means for my backers is that early participation will allow for early delivery.

Risks and Challenges

I've done my best to minimize any risks or challenges to the success of this campaign and the delivery of the rewards.  Nearly all of the equipment, tools and glass will be purchased from verified suppliers.  Two pieces of supporting equipment - the glassblower's bench and a marver table - are being fabricated by local businesses.  The location for the glassblowing studio is complete, including the special electrical power circuits and natural gas supply piping. The only real risk (and my challenge) is meeting the production schedule for the rewards items.

story:
OUR PROJECT

One month of street performance/explorations, video art and installations inspired and supported by:

gentleness

To work with gentleness is to work with respect and listening. It is the idea that we do not need to push ourselves beyond our boundaries or look outside ourselves to ﬁnd strength. Our bodies themselves hold space for creativity. With gentleness we want to challenge this societal expectation and ground ourselves in self care, honor our physical limitations and tap into the space inwardly connecting. 

How will this affect our project? We will have daily physical practices (dance, walking, qi gong, BMC exercises), in our explorations we will respect our physical limitations, we will not strive to go beyond them but allow them to guide us more deeply into the layers of our bodies.

radical acceptance

Radical acceptance is the refusal of perfection. We believe that anything can be the support for our creative expression. We want to expose our vulnerability and be supported by the acceptance of our struggles, our sense of inadequacy and our fears. In this way, we want to enter a state of non-striving and allow ourselves to be. We will work with our personal yet deeply universal challenges, hardships, we will use our fears, our shame and sense of ‘not belonging’ to create explorations and performances. We will do movement and experiential explorations in the streets, parks, cemeteries, and historic cites of Paris which will lead to the creation of a  final street performance and a video performance.

ritualizing creativity into our daily lives

We desire to reintegrate art into the center of our lives and experience creative expression as inseparable to our daily living. This will begin by the simple intention of being mindful in each moment of the day. We will bring a similar quality of attention we offer in performance to our cooking, cleaning, waking through the incorporation of movement, breathing, singing and chanting so that each moment can be the platform for creativity, connecting to our ancestors or questioning societal conditionings.

WHO WE ARE

Laura Oriol is a performance artist. Her movement practice is rooted in Butoh and Qigong. She has trained extensively and performed with Vangeline Theater in New York and San Francisco. Diego Pinon of Body Ritual Movement as well as many other teachers such as Natsu Nakajima, Yukio Suzuki, Katsura Kan, Kat McMillan, have a deep influence on her dance. She breaks down capitalistic values of progress, accumulation, achievement and competition in order to melt into a deep space within the body, to wake up to a deeper reality, connect to humanity via vulnerability and shame. She was born and raised in France and after 8 years of living in the United States she has just moved back and intends to deepen her creative practices.

Titine Vos: Born and raised on the island of Oahu, Titine developed a deep connection with nature. Since her childhood she has been creative in dance and visual art. She has been inspired by working as a raptor rehabilitator in Oregon to focus specifically on how we use our bodies to express ourselves. She is a Butoh dancer and spent her adult years in traditional vocal training and embodying her voice using Body Mind Centering technique. She is now in school to integrate this knowledge and develop a stronger connection in her community studying social justice, gender and women studies. She is part of Project Survive as a sexual health educator and works as a mentor with Rising Voices, a San Francisco based transformative justice performance art program. At this very moment to further her creative work she feels a great calling to break away from the structures of society and go to Paris to develop in a new way with care for the beautiful gifts and experiences she has received in her life, to give thanks and to cultivate an offering. 


OUR SCHEDULE

  • 2-3 explorations/week - movement, sound, experiential performances in the streets of Paris or in our apartment.

  • 1 creative project/week that will lead to our final performance

  • 2 break days/week - time for reflection, exploration of the culture, art and history of Paris.

  • 1 class a week to support our creative explorations

GOALS

-Final performance

-Performance video

-Apply to festivals for 2015


Our funds would pay for:

  • Supplies (costumes, video, materials...)
  • Training (various movement classes we will take in Paris)
  • Trip to the Avignon Festival
  • website/blog 
  • French Cultural research (museums, shows, performances, historical sites)
  • Food

THANK YOU FOR ALL YOUR SUPPORT!

Please spread the word!!

story:
Graveyards for unbaptisted children - on Achill Island, Ireland, Irland

Since the mid fifties, when I was a child and passed the summer months on Achill Island, I was very impressed with the cillin on the Dookinella cliff tops. This was the only one we knew of at this time. I remember, the new graves  that appeared there right up until the end of the fifties, probably even the early sixties.

These memories never escaped me and looking back on those days, through older eyes, I found myself more and more interested in those unmarked graves and their meaning at the time and in our current times. These reflections moved me to work on an artistic project about the cilliní on Achill Island and the Currane peninsula.

Through personal experience, I have learned of more than 20 cilliní on Achill and through my research I have received notices of a further 15 on Currane. I have since visited almost all of those on Achill and one on Currane, they are mostly positioned near the coast. This project will take me on a journey back to Achill and Currane and I intend on making an exhibition of my paintings, silverpoint drawings, photos, Chinese ink paintings and drawings in 2014/2015.

I will make 15 large oil paintings 160 x 179 cm in size, creating an installation of 5 triptichons. And this is where you come in. By donating my project I can make further research, paint a predella of 59 x 179 cm for each of the big painting, making it in total 30 paintings and publish an extendet catalogue with poems and literary and scientific texts about the cilliní. 

Sponsor will receive perks and will be mentioned in the catalogue, big sponsors will be also mentioned on the invitation and the press release.

I am also grateful for all further information.

More about the cillini:
http://irishfamilyresearch.blogspot.de/2012/02/who-is-buried-in-little-graveyards.html

http://celticburialrites.blogspot.de/2012_11_01_archive.html

http://www.academia.edu/602558/Deviant_Burial_in_the_Archaeological_Record

story:
Smash Fighter Ultimate has once again revolutionized the way we look at fighting games. The bar has been set extremely high for all future games and gave the fans exactly what they wanted. This project is intended to honor the success of the franchise for many years to come. 

With your help, I'll be able to purchase and design a custom Switch compatible Controller for each and every fighter who has joined the battle in Ultimate. The controllers will be professionally photographed and compiled into an art book and sold at retail, so that fans all around the world can celebrate the franchise in a unique way for many generations to come! 

So Why IndieGogo?

I have been making custom controllers for many years, and while I could make each one of these controllers over time, having the gaming communities support of the project upfront allows me set the appropriate amount of time and money aside to complete the project in a timely manner.

Project Details 

Book Details

8.5" x 8.5", Glossy Hard cover, 60lb paper stock

Controller Details

Pro Game Controller for Switch, Motion Controls, HD Rumble, Charging Cable

***Please note the controllers being used are NOT OEM controllers. They look and function exactly the same, but do not include NFC functionality. Backers will have the ability to upgrade to official OEM controllers at the end of the campaign for an additional $30 if our initial funding goal is reached. 

With the initial goal reached, I'll be able to purchase enough pro controllers for each and every character on the Ultimate Roster, which is just around 75 fighters at the current time.

 This initial goal funding takes into account the fact that some people may purchase more than one of a single character. For example, early bird backers get to choose their character. It is very possible that multiple early bird backers may choose one character, while no one may purchase another. This initial goal funding takes this into account, and guarantees that I'll have enough funding to create that character controller no one has shown love, even if no one has purchased it. 

 

 STRETCH GOALS ARE INCLUDED WITH EVERY CONTROLLER PLEDGED!

If your rewards tier includes 5 controllers, you'll get 5 of each stretch goal item!

$10,000 - Replacement joysticks with every controller 

UNLOCKED

$12,000 - Rubber Grip Cap for joysticks with every controller 

UNLOCKED

$15,000 - Controller Pins included with every controller tier!

UNLOCKED

$20,000 - Controller Carrying case with every controller

UNLOCKED

$25,000 - Honorable Mentions will be added to the book 

UNLOCKED

$35,000 - Pop Phone Grip

$45,000 - Game Card Carrying Case

$55,000 - Portable case for Game Console

$65,000 - Game Convention Starter Kit 

$75,000 - To be determined...

$85,000 - To be determined...

$95,000 - "Displai" Stands from RoseColored Gaming

Design Previews 

While over 75 characters will appear in this campaign, here is just a sneak preview of a few of them!

We've teamed up with the great folks at RoseColoredGaming to bring you some amazing campaign exclusive "displai" stands for your Pro Controller! Designed to mimic trophies, these controller stands are sure to make your one of a kind controller stand out from the rest of your gaming collection!

You'll also have the ability to purchase a protective case for your new work of art at the end of the campaign! 

USA (1-2 Weeks)
                                                                          $8.00
                                                                          First Class Mail USPS
                                                                          Tracking Included
 

International (2-4 Weeks)
                                                                          $15.00
                                                                          First Class Mail USPS
                                                                          Tracking Included

They look and function exactly the same, but do not include NFC functionality. Backers will have the ability to upgrade to official OEM controllers at the end of the campaign for an additional $30 if our initial funding goal is reached. With the initial goal reached, I'll be able to purchase enough pro controllers for each and every character on the Ultimate Roster, which is just around 75 fighters at the current time. This initial goal funding takes into account the fact that some people may purchase more than one of a single character. For example, early bird backers get to choose their character. It is very possible that multiple early bird backers may choose one character, while no one may purchase another. This initial goal funding takes this into account, and guarantees that I'll have enough funding to create that character controller no one has shown love, even if no one has purchased it.   STRETCH GOALS ARE INCLUDED WITH EVERY CONTROLLER PLEDGED!If your rewards tier includes 5 controllers, you'll get 5 of each stretch goal item!$10,000 - Replacement joysticks with every controller UNLOCKED$12,000 - Rubber Grip Cap for joysticks with every controller UNLOCKED$15,000 - Controller Pins included with every controller tier!UNLOCKED$20,000 - Controller Carrying case with every controllerUNLOCKED$25,000 - Honorable Mentions will be added to the book UNLOCKED$35,000 - Pop Phone Grip$45,000 - Game Card Carrying Case$55,000 - Portable case for Game Console$65,000 - Game Convention Starter Kit $75,000 - To be determined...$85,000 - To be determined...$95,000 - "Displai" Stands from RoseColored GamingDesign Previews While over 75 characters will appear in this campaign, here is just a sneak preview of a few of them!We've teamed up with the great folks at RoseColoredGaming to bring you some amazing campaign exclusive "displai" stands for your Pro Controller! Designed to mimic trophies, these controller stands are sure to make your one of a kind controller stand out from the rest of your gaming collection!You'll also have the ability to purchase a protective case for your new work of art at the end of the campaign! USA (1-2 Weeks)                                                                          $8.00                                                                          First Class Mail USPS                                                                          Tracking Included International (2-4 Weeks)                                                                          $15.00                                                                          First Class Mail USPS                                                                          Tracking Included

story:
SHORT PROJECT SUMMARY

Hello from California's Eastern Sierra mountains! My name is Amara Untermeyer, I'm a California-based video artist and documentary filmmaker. My experience ranges from directing investigative documentary projects in Haiti, Indonesia and El Salvador, to working with human trafficking survivors and FBI heads, filming adventure programming for the History Channel, directing commercials for Ford and developing adventure television documentary series backed by Academy award winner, Viola Davis. 

As a visual artist and storyteller, I have been deeply touched by the Eastern Sierra Nevada mountains in California, as well as her local communities. AMATOR MONTUM is a cinematic poem, provocation and deep dive into our own unique spiritual languages and communion with the mountains. With this free, public work I hope to present to the community an opportunity for deeper connection with self and Spirit, while broadening the connections and diverse spiritual dialogue with the mountains. AMATOR MONTUM is my personal, intimate invitation to go deeper - with ourselves, with others and with this sacred mountain region.

I created this project entirely on my own from my own pocket with no outside funding, and the project requires funding for the existence over the next 5 weeks, and your contribution will carry the this project beyond initial creation. I believe in free public art and I hope that, together, we can carry on this tradition of the arts being accessible to everyone!

WHAT WE NEED

I have personally self funded four weeks of development and coordination, six weeks of film production, three weeks of editing and purchased the video projection and screen gear on a humble artist's wages. The minimal goal of $3,300 that we're looking to raise goes entirely to post-production and gallery costs for the existence of this free public art installation. Below is a breakdown of the distribution of funds I must pay between Aug 2nd - Sep 1st, 2019 to the following vendors who have so helped to shape this project!: 

$1,500 - audio design/soundscape/sound effects by Noctvrnal.com
$400 - audio equipment rental - gallery speakers, subwoofer, video playback equipment for 5 weeks
$550 - Full 5 day Gallery build-out, labor + materials. Gallery imagery, building of entire black-box theater in back of gallery, stage curtains, etc.
$75 - Promotional materials - gallery signage, flyers, postcards
$475 - Labor to run gallery every Friday, Saturday and Sunday from August 2nd - September 1st, 5 weeks total
$200 - $300 - Indiegogo percentage fee

= $3,300 

THE IMPACT - Why a Free Video Art Installation?

Art is not an ornament. It’s a language. It can create a space to share and transcend boundaries. Art creates our community and expands our world as we explore perceptions, emotions, fantasy, and feelings.The arts create connections and open up dialogues that we may begin but not finish ourselves. To participate in the arts is to build space for communities to grow.

I believe art created from a pure place of connection and conviction, and not driven by commercial needs, has the power to touch people at a very deep level. I've already witnessed this at the ground level during the installation's first week open to the public, watching people emerge from the AMATOR MONTUM installation with tears streaming down their face. 

If the Spirit moves you to contribute in some way to the continuation of projects of this nature, we'd be most thankful for your contribution and energy!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Forward this project along to your mountain-loving friends, your advocates of the arts and your spiritual communities!

Finally, in whatever you do, continue to create and live your life from a place of conviction, purpose and passion. Onwards. - Amara

story:
My name is Marina Harkness and this summer I'll be the Arts Specialist at YMCA Camp Miller! Having grown up with Camp Miller, I can tell you first hand how important it is to have experience outdoors growing up, camping can teach kids important life skills and give them an idea of who they are. Camp Miller had a long history as a great overnight summer camp with a wide variety of age groups, and this summer I want to pump up the arts and crafts room to give every camper the opportunity to learn a new craft and leave camp with a new hobby!

We are looking for donations so we may be able to fund specific activities at camp. Currently we are looking to build our craft room to support constructive crafts such as fiber arts, ceramics, paper making and wood working with hand tools. Donations would directly fund purchases such as:

Whole wool, carding brushes, dyes, knitting & sewing needles, fabrics and yarn, clay, pottery wheels, paints and glazes, brushes and small tools, deckle & molds, paper fibers, blenders, paper carpets, hand tools for wood working, sand paper, vice grips, wood glue and wood burning kits. 

With the proper funding for these materials, campers can leave camp having experimented with crafts typically outside of the usual art education they receive at school. The arts are an amazing way to build the confidence of a child, and with a better funded craft room, campers can learn from more extensive and challenging projects. 

Every bit of funding helps even if we can't make our goal, and every cent will go to gaining and replenishing supplies for the Camp Miller craft room. If you are unable to donate but have supplies you would wish to see put to use, Camp Miller is always looking for donations and would be happy to accept anything usable. (We get very creative at camp!) 

Be sure to hoot and holler about our campaign on Facebook and share this page with any good camp friends! We'll see you this summer!

story:
Phoenix, also known as "Phoenix Emperor", is the king of birds in ancient legends. Often used to symbolize prosperity and fortune in Chinese culture, phoenixes flying together serve as a symbol of auspicious harmony. It is  an important element of Chinese culture since ancient times.

凤凰，亦作“凤皇”，古代传说中的百鸟之王。常用来象征祥瑞，凤凰齐飞，是吉祥和谐的象征，自古就是中国文化的重要元素。

The Phoenix will be 8M tall in a ready to fly position. Head to the sky waiting for the flames to come out of her tongue at the last night of the Burn! We need some bamboo to build the infrastructure. Reeds can be used as the Phoenix feathers, and a large number of reeds four or five meters high can be collected by the lake.

凤凰高8米呈现展翅高飞的姿态，仰望天空，等待着最后一晚的火焰吐舌！ 我们需要一些竹子用于构建支撑材料， 芦苇可用来构建凤凰的羽毛，湖边都可以收集到大量四五米高的芦苇。

Dragon last year; 去年龙

This year, Phoenix. 今年凤

Prosperity brought by the dragon and the phoenix! 龙凤呈祥

 

The money you donated will be mainly used for below items您所捐献的资金将用于以下内容:

- Canary date leaves, palm leaves, palm bark and reed will be repurchased from the local community 当地采购加纳利海枣叶、棕榈叶、棕榈皮、芦苇

- Bamboo sticks purchased from local 当地采购竹棍

- Ropes for binding the Phoenix body 捆绑所用的麻绳

- Nails, iron wire, fuel and other tools 钉子，铁丝，燃料及其他工具

- Transportation for moving the Phoenix 运输凤凰的费用

- Other miscellaneous expenses

story:
"Think big and don’t listen to people who tell you it can’t be done. Life’s too short to think small." - Timothy Ferris

Map & Palette:

My name is Jared. There is so much we don't yet know in this world and that idea couldn't be more inspiring to me. I want to bring forgotten styles back into the art world, and show that the world isn’t as scary a place as many people think.

J.P. and I have been best friends since middle school, where a mutual passion for drawing comics brought us together. J.P. is inspired by the human form and wants to take it to a whole new level. He hopes to explore spirituality around the world and apply it to his art and his life.

The two of us met Antonio one summer at Rhode Island School of Design, while we were pulling an all-nighter in the work room. Almost immediately we knew that we would all be good friends for a long time. Antonio is inspired simply by freedom. He wants to learn what he can from other artists and then change the world with his art.

Together, we are three young artists and experienced travelers who believe that not everything can be taught in school. From sticker companies to giant murals, we've been creating things our entire lives. We decided to get serious about our art in high school and enrolled in a few college classes. After a few years and many paintbrushes later, we realized how much of art comes from experience and not just textbooks. We've developed a good foundation for our work and now we want to start focusing on the content of our pieces. We each have a vision for what we want our art to represent but don't have any idea how to put it into action. We think it's time to take a break from the classroom and start learning from the world we want to help change.

 In June of 2015, we plan to depart on a 6 month journey to live as wandering artists and collectively meet our three biggest goals: 

-To become better artists and travelers, going off the beaten path to find the unique and unknown 

-To develop our own styles from the inspiration we find in the world around us

-To chronicle our lives as traveling artists into a book filled with our trip’s best artwork and stories

We’ll be traveling through the fastest growing art capitals and most inspiring places on Earth. During our travels we’ll be sketching what we find, meeting as many other artists as we can, and studying the aesthetic and culture behind the interesting places we come across. If you're interested in following us on this journey, don't stop reading, sailor.

We will begin our journey in Oslo, Norway and then spend two months traveling down Europe, passing through some major art capitals, such as Berlin and Paris. After reaching the Strait of Gibraltar, we will head through Morocco and the Sahara to Italy. From there we will head to Istanbul, ending the first part of our journey. 

For the following two months we will be traveling through Asia, flying from Turkey to Aomori, Japan. We will travel down to Shanghai and then Hong Kong. From there we will journey to Ho Chi Minh City, and then Bangkok. We will head up to the Himalayas then travel all the way down to Southern India passing through New Delhi.

During the last two months we will fly from India to Rio De Janeiro where we will travel down to Buenos Aires, over to Santiago, and then up to Bogota. After that we will travel up Central America to Antonio's home in Mexico.

"A good traveler has no fixed plan and is never intent on arriving." - Lao Tzu

Our plan is to follow this route and see where it takes us.

We have little idea about the kind of art we will encounter or who we will meet. While we have certain places we want to visit, our route is always subject to change. We do know however, that our journey will span roughly 60 days each in Europe, Asia, and South America. There, we will seek out local galleries, artists communes, visually interesting cities, and beautiful landscapes.

We want to stay as true to the vagabond lifestyle as we can, so your money will only go to the necessities: brushes, canvas, and publishing. 

More specifically, publishing a high quality art book can be as much as $8,000, and the remaining $4,000 will be split between the three of us to give us each roughly $1,300 to buy supplies to last us six months. We'll spend that money over the entirety of the trip to restock on paints, brushes, canvas, and paper.

Through the rewards you can purchase our artwork, plan where we will go, and buy the book we will make along the way. Unfortunately, if we don't reach our goal we can only create an e-book of our work. But, the higher the reward the bigger the painting! 

In the end, we hope to have seen some of the world’s most unique and unknown art and put it all into a story. We want to share our adventure and how our styles have progressed along the way. The book will be a documentation of our progress as artists. We're going to put our best pieces and stories into a journal entry-type book that shows the influence certain styles had on our art. We each hope to have developed our own styles by the end of the trip and to share them with everyone.

Our passion is what drives us. Follow our journey around the Earth as we create.

story:
The Only Way Up... Is Down

An-Art-Happening on the Eve of the Eve

 

...will take place at the Pittsburgh Dance Center in Bloomfield on December 30, 2012 from 7pm until 10pm. Produced and Choreographed by Kaylin Horgan, featured artists include choreography by Annalee Traylor, Music by; Vie Boheme, Poetry by; Alaina Marie Dopico, and Photography Display by; Nate Powers.

 

 

Hi, my name is Kaylin Horgan, and I am a Pittsburgh native, and a prospective independent artist. I graduated from both Pittsburgh's Creative and Performing Arts High School, and Point Park University with a BA in jazz dance. I currently dance for the August Wilson Center Dance Ensemble, teach at the Pittsburgh Civic Light Opera Academy and am a choreographer for PETRA International Ministries.

 

In the past two years, I had the honor of traveling around the world to the cities of New York, Paris, London, Amsterdam, Dublin and Suriname, South America to dance and teach, all while continuing to call Pittsburgh my home-base.

 

Pittsburgh has given me so much, and I believe it is my time to give back.

 

 My goal is to take all that I have learned throughout my travels, and share it with my home town. I feel that it is my responsibility as a Pittsburgh Arts ambassador (birthed, rose, and educated by the Pittsburgh Arts), to set an example of what Pittsburgh Art has been, and where it is going. I want to create more opportunities for fellow emerging, and professional artists of this city, and to bridge gaps in the arts community, by providing the tools for other artists to meet and work side by side in collaboration, to create more art for the city.

 

On December 30, 2012, I will be holding my first event to premier and document 4 works that I have created in the year 2012, and plan to revive and develop in 2013 throughout Pittsburgh, and other cities.

 

The Only Way Up... Is Down, An Art Happening on the Eve of the Eve, will also be used to give other emerging artists the chance to, not only showcase their works, but also get their work recorded, so that they can use the documentation as a foundation to support their careers as well.

 

(It is a fact that media records are a major key for today's emerging art success.)

 

Having this event is equally as important for the connections that will be made within the Pittsburgh Arts community. Having many of these artist come together and share their work, opens doors for future collaborations.

 

What better time to come together, but for the celebration and anticipation of the New Year? An-Art-Happening on the Eve of the Eve will be used to share what has been created in 2012, and to make new connections for ideas and growth for 2013.

 

Following the show, there will be a Question and Answer talk-back for the featured artists, to receive feedback from the spectating guests, and a reception including an open-floor music and dance jam lead by local vocal artist, Vie Boheme.

 

Displayed in the front room throughout the evening, will be a gallery of talented artist, Nate Power’s photography.

 

 

 

 

This fundraiser is so relevant because I am also a developing artist, and I know the best way to success is from joint support. If other artists support other artists, then art itself will excel.

 

I need funding to support my project.

 

The more you support my project, the more I can support the arts in my city.

 

I also want to use this showcase as a platform to emcee more showcases for the future. The more money I raise, the more opportunities I can create for future artists.

 

I am trying to raise $1000.

 

The money I receive will be used to pay for;

 

Rental fee for the space ($200),

 Rental of lighting equipment ($200)

A professional videographer ($100)

 Marketing materials ($100)

 A fanatical foundation to begin another showcase ($500).

 

I do not need a lot, just enough to get started.

 

I will use any money that I raise towards this project, and the next.

 

If you are unable to make a monetary contribution towards my project, I ask that you plan to attend The Only Way Up... Is Down, An Art Happening on the Eve of the Eve, in support of the artists themselves.

 

Thank You!!!!

 

An-Art-Happening on the Eve of the Eve

December 30th, 2012

 

Pittsburgh Dance Center

4765 Liberty Avenue, Pittsburgh, PA 15224

Doors open at 7:00pm, Showcase will begin at 7:30pm

Donations asked at the door.

 

-K
story_txt:
The Only Way Up... Is Down
An-Art-Happening on the Eve of the Eve
 
...will take place at the Pittsburgh Dance Center in Bloomfield on December 30, 2012 from 7pm until 10pm. Produced and Choreographed by Kaylin Horgan, featured artists include choreography by Annalee Traylor, Music by; Vie Boheme, Poetry by; Alaina Marie Dopico, and Photography Display by; Nate Powers. 
 
 
Hi, my name is Kaylin Horgan, and I am a Pittsburgh native, and a prospective independent artist. I graduated from both Pittsburgh's Creative and Performing Arts High School, and Point Park University with a BA in jazz dance. I currently dance for the August Wilson Center Dance Ensemble, teach at the Pittsburgh Civic Light Opera Academy and am a choreographer for PETRA International Ministries.
 
In the past two years, I had the honor of traveling around the world to the cities of New York, Paris, London, Amsterdam, Dublin and Suriname, South America to dance and teach, all while continuing to call Pittsburgh my home-base.
 
Pittsburgh has given me so much, and I believe it is my time to give back.
 
 My goal is to take all that I have learned throughout my travels, and share it with my home town. I feel that it is my responsibility as a Pittsburgh Arts ambassador (birthed, rose, and educated by the Pittsburgh Arts), to set an example of what Pittsburgh Art has been, and where it is going. I want to create more opportunities for fellow emerging, and professional artists of this city, and to bridge gaps in the arts community, by providing the tools for other artists to meet and work side by side in collaboration, to create more art for the city.
 
On December 30, 2012, I will be holding my first event to premier and document 4 works that I have created in the year 2012, and plan to revive and develop in 2013 throughout Pittsburgh, and other cities.
 
The Only Way Up... Is Down, An Art Happening on the Eve of the Eve, will also be used to give other emerging artists the chance to, not only showcase their works, but also get their work recorded, so that they can use the documentation as a foundation to support their careers as well.
 
(It is a fact that media records are a major key for today's emerging art success.)
 
Having this event is equally as important for the connections that will be made within the Pittsburgh Arts community. Having many of these artist come together and share their work, opens doors for future collaborations. 
 
What better time to come together, but for the celebration and anticipation of the New Year? An-Art-Happening on the Eve of the Eve will be used to share what has been created in 2012, and to make new connections for ideas and growth for 2013.
 
Following the show, there will be a Question and Answer talk-back for the featured artists, to receive feedback from the spectating guests, and a reception including an open-floor music and dance jam lead by local vocal artist, Vie Boheme. 
 
Displayed in the front room throughout the evening, will be a gallery of talented artist, Nate Power’s photography.
 
 
 
 
This fundraiser is so relevant because I am also a developing artist, and I know the best way to success is from joint support. If other artists support other artists, then art itself will excel.
 
I need funding to support my project.
 
The more you support my project, the more I can support the arts in my city.
 
I also want to use this showcase as a platform to emcee more showcases for the future. The more money I raise, the more opportunities I can create for future artists.
 
I am trying to raise $1000.
 
The money I receive will be used to pay for;
 
Rental fee for the space ($200),
 Rental of lighting equipment ($200)
A professional videographer ($100)
 Marketing materials ($100)
 A fanatical foundation to begin another showcase ($500).
 
I do not need a lot, just enough to get started.
 
I will use any money that I raise towards this project, and the next.
 
If you are unable to make a monetary contribution towards my project, I ask that you plan to attend The Only Way Up... Is Down, An Art Happening on the Eve of the Eve, in support of the artists themselves.
 
Thank You!!!!
 
An-Art-Happening on the Eve of the Eve
December 30th, 2012
 
Pittsburgh Dance Center
4765 Liberty Avenue, Pittsburgh, PA 15224
Doors open at 7:00pm, Showcase will begin at 7:30pm
Donations asked at the door.
 
-K

story:
effulgent_Phosphorescence will be a completely new experience centered around the principles of illumination, touch, architecture and form. It is a study in contemporary construction combined with classic textural elements designed to bring out the inner child in all of us.

Imagine meandering through an installation oriented to both the sense of touch and of sight; it is soft to the touch, bright as the sun and visually striking to look at both during the day and at night.

effulgent_Phosphorescence is intended to inspire; there will be no visible means of support and approximately 90% of the structure will appear to be “off kilter”. Our goal is to recycle past projects to be as green and cost efficient as possible in the creation of new and innovative designs and ideas. To this end we are re-using all the structural support elements from the Photon Pathway like the PVC pipes, extension cords and rebar. By utilizing the materials we have on hand this new sculpture can be created for 40% less money than if we had to start from scratch.

The installation will consist of 9 stand-alone "quad arches" with each arch covered in translucent fabric and lit from above with more intelligent LED's than you have ever seen on a sculpture this size. The overall intensity of the lighting will be astonishing.

The avenues for experiencing the installation are fluid and nearly unlimited: You can walk or run through it, or even lay down under it. You definitely can't miss it! effulgent_Phosphorescence is 12 ft tall, 20 ft wide, and 20 ft long. The total power consumption will be 1,000 watts, and will not include any sound output.

The overall assembly time is much less than what the Photon Pathway took but the appearance will be dramatically refined in comparison. The design will allow the installation to hold up against high winds, all the lighting will be waterproof and structural redundancy will be built into the piece to ensure it will stand and shine no matter what the elements may bring.

We just received a "seed" grant from the Texas Art Garden and now we need you to help us bring effulgent_Phosphorescence to Flipside, Art Outside, your backyard, and more!!

story:
How did I get here?

I create my art "en Plein Air" and in an old travel trailer in my backyard. I lived in the trailer with my husband when traveling with our Live Shark Show. Years before I toured the U.S. and Japan traveling with Ringling Brothers Barnum & Bailey circus. 


After settling in one place the last few years I have a desire to travel and paint once again. By visiting other areas of the country I can continue to express my lifelong fascination with and dedication to the natural environment. I create my art to express my commitment to the preservation of our native flora and fauna, to celebrate its diversity and to document its fragility.


My goal is to capture the fleeting illuminations and restless color of that moment when the light makes magic in the landscape. Through color, light and unique composition I create an image reflecting the vitality of our extraordinary surroundings. I hope that my distinctive portrayal of a subject gives the viewer a deeper understanding of the environment.


So how can I paint and travel and still make a difference for others?

Here’s my plan. I am on the board of the Myakka River State Park in Sarasota, Florida. The park has a strong focus on representing and encouraging artists. I would like to start an artist residency at this wonderful location. So while satisfying my desire to travel and paint I can also learn the ins and outs of creating and implementing an artist residency.


I’ve been fortunate so far. I’ve been awarded a residency at the Weir Farm National Historic Site in Connecticut for January 2012. I will also be heading to Dorland Mountain Arts Colony in Temecula California in March. Right now I am an alternate at Playa in Oregon for their residency program.

What do this mean for you and others?

Why should you care and help?

Art is one of the most important ways to help spread the word on issues that need our attention. Throughout history art has helped us to understand ourselves and the world around us. The Federal Art Program during the Great Depression is a wonderful example of how art reaches out and changes our world.

By attending these residencies I will be able to share my experience of unique landscapes through my art. I am constantly striving to show others how important our natural resources are.

I will also learn the details of executing and running an artist residency. Through this experience I hope to create a valuable program in a unique area of the “real Florida”, Myakka River State Park. Other artists will have the opportunity to create and spread the word of the vitality of our environment.

Preserving our natural resources is critical for future generations. This is the perfect opportunity to make a difference!

How do I get there and what do you get?

I've gotten through the first phase, actually receiving the residencies! Now I have to get there. The residency at Weir Farm provides lodging and a studio for free! Dorland Mountain Arts Colony asks for a small donation to benefit their program. I am applying for several grants to defer these expenses from the following organizations:

  • Barbara Deming Memorial Fund
  • E.D. Foundation

I need your help covering my travel expenses from Florida. Here's the breakdown:

  • Round trip airfare to Hartford Connecticut: $411
  • Car rental in Connecticut: $815 I will be in a remote area of the park and will need a car to collect supplies, etc.
  • Round trip airfare to Temecula California: $532
  • Car rental in Temecula: $893
           TOTAL: $2651

This project will happen! Your help would make the experience even more effective! Why? I will be able to share my work with each donor furthering my goal of spreading the importance of our natural resources.

You will receive a variety of different perks for contributing. Everything form signed postcards, prints, really good homemade peanut butter cookies, t-shirts, gift certificates to purchase at my shop and original art. Check out the terrific perks on the side bar! I will also keep you updated on my travels through my blog Evelyn McCPeters Art.

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE

SHARE

SHARE

Did I mention SHARE? Please help me to spread the word. Use the Share buttons here on Indie GoGo. Use your own social media network, your friends and family. We can all make a difference, not just for me but for the future artists to enjoy a residency in a state park, and for those who will be inspired to speak out for our natural resources.

Thanks to everyone who contributes, and shares my project!


"Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed people can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has."

- Margaret Mead
