story:
Grief, loss and reparation – help me make this exquisite work for exhibition.

Rosy Martin

 

I have been working on grief, loss and reparation after the deaths of my Father, then Mother – for many years now. It is a profound and touching body of work, which speaks eloquently to so many, about an experience that is universal.

 I have a huge body of photographs and videos.

Now I need to produce it.

 

In this selection I re-enact a lost past as I embody both of my parents in their family home, as well as using projections to evoke a sense of haunting.

Although my work is well known and has been widely exhibited, it is very hard to get funding these days. I have the opportunity to show an extract of the work in Peltz Gallery in London,  July 3-25. ‘Family Ties: Reframing Memory’,    

as part of a group – Family Ties Network,

Family Ties Network applied for Arts Council funding, but did not succeed, despite a strong application

I need £2,000 to make it beautifully, £1,000 to make it OK. The more I can raise, the better the production. All money raised will go to making this work manifest.

 

I really find this hard to do – to ask – but I know that my work, especially the evolution and development of ‘re-enactment phototherapy’ has inspired many people over the last 30 years. It is hard to carry on exhibiting without any ‘means of production’ or income.

I am asking for a contribution to enable me to show the work as it should be seen. Yes, I showed Bonus Prints at 6”x4” at the Photographers Gallery in 1987, but this needs much better production values. Times have changed.

Even if you cannot help - please circulate this amongst your contacts - and remember - even a little helps a lot.

 

For more about the exhibition see

http://www.bbk.ac.uk/arts/about-us/events/about-us/events/bbk-local?uid=c964b31599eee0916c4f9079fb91ea8f

 

How might we read memory in relation to the family, and how might we enact these memories in visual form? This group exhibition addresses the representation of family memory through the lens-based works of six artists. Family Ties: Reframing Memory explores the bittersweet aspects of reflective nostalgia, yet also questions the conflicts and contradictions inherent in acts of remembering.

For more about Family Ties Network see

http://familytiesnetwork.wordpress.com/


More about my track record...

Rosy Martin is an artist/photographer, lecturer, workshop leader and psychological therapist.

She uses self-portraiture, still life photography, digital imaging and video to deal with issues of gender, sexuality, ageing, family dynamics, bereavement and reparation. In her practice she aims to extend the range of potential meanings that lie within notions of domestic photography and explore the relationships between photography, memory, identities and unconscious processes. Working with the late Jo Spence, from 1983, she evolved and developed a new photographic practice - phototherapy - based upon re-enactment. Through embodiment, she explores the psychic and social construction of identities within the drama of the everyday

 

Her work has been exhibited nationally and internationally, since 1985, including The Photographers Gallery, London (1987), Barbican Art Gallery, London (1989), Tokyo Metropolitan Museum of Photography (1991), Randolph Street Gallery, Chicago (1994), City Art Centre, Dublin (1996), Floating Gallery. Winnipeg. (1996)  Lighthouse Gallery. Wolverhampton. (2000) Focal Point Gallery, Southend-on-sea (2001) Peri Photographic Gallery Turku (2003),  Documenta 12, Kassel, Germany (2007) and Durham Art Gallery (2010).

Martin has written extensively, and had essays included in the following publications: ‘Phototherapy and therapeutic photography in a digital age’ (2012) Stilled (2005); Gender Issues in Art Therapy, (2003); Feminist Approaches to Art Therapy, (1997/2012), What Can a Woman Do with a Camera? (1995) 'Stolen glances - lesbians take photographs' (1991). and Family Snaps: the Meanings of Domestic Photography (1991). She has written numerous journal articles for Afterimage, Camera Austria, Artpaper, Ten8, Women's Art Magazine and Feminist Art News amongst others.


Update 7 June.

Thank you so much for donations - I am now half-way to the goal I set.

I have defined the £100 perk - yes it is an archival signed print.

Thank you so much to those of you have been really generous, wow, and to those whom I know are themselves 'struggling artists' who have helped it to grow.

The goal does not cover the costs - but it goes a good way to doing so - and if I do not reach it, I loose over 10% of the money raised.

story:
VIP Millionaire Box Club at the Kentucky Derby

To all our friends who have cheered on the creators of Apo-Tucky Derby, we would like to give you an opportunity to gain VIP Box Tickets to The Big Kentucky Derby Race at Apogaea on June 8th (Saturday) 1:00pm.

 

Benefits of being apart of the VIP Millionaire Box Club Member include:

1)   June 8th (Saturday of Apogaea) at Noon.  You will be first to enjoy our iced Mint Juleps

2)    Then at 12:30 we’ll march through Apogaea as we sing the traditional “My Old Kentucky Home” Johnny Cash style.  – Lyrics will be given to you in advance.

3)   Gain reserved entry to “The Greens” during The Big Kentucky Derby Race

  1. “The Greens” is the center of our U-shaped track where you can…
  2. Walk bare foot in our freshly mowed artificial grass
  3. Enjoy the races in the shade
  4. Be served Ice Water and Mint Juleps
  5. Gain exclusive access to our betting table, in “The Greens”, between races.

 

How do you gain Membership to the VIP Millionaire Box Club?

1)   We have a limited number of Silver Mint Julep cups on our IndiGoGo Web-Site.  Each cup gains 1 membership to our VIP Club.

2)   We have a limited number of Derby hats, also on our IndiGoGo Fund Raising Web-Site.  Each hat gains 2 memberships to our VIP Club.  Your hat will be safely transported to Apo for you.

What is Apo-Tucky Derby & The Big Kentucky Derby Race at Apogaea?

In January during the Stock Show Cyn, Pat and Lavender purchased 3 stuffed horses that are spring-loaded and propelled forward when a rider posts.  The horses can carry up to 195lbs and are loads of fun!!!   So what does one do with these mighty steeds…BUT RACE THEM OF COURSE?!? … And born was Apo-Tucky Derby the art project.  Each day of Apogaea, our “U” shape racetrack will be opened for Apogaea participants to race as apart of an all ages interactive art project.  On June 8th (Saturday) 1:00pm we will be hosting The Big Kentucky Derby Race at Apo in which 9 jockeys will race for the Rose Blanket and First, Place and Show Trophies.  Enjoy our Mint Juleps and don your Big Ass Derby Hats. 

How does one become a jockey?

ALL Apogaea participants are eligible to be a Kentucky Derby Jockey.   Each day of Apogaea, the racetrack will be open for timed trials.  The 9 top fasted riders are eligible to be a jockey during The Big Kentucky Derby Race; June 8th (Saturday) 1:00pm Burner Time.  On Saturday, prior to the Big Race, all Jockeys will draw for their positions and name of their horse.

On-Site Gambling at Apo-Tucky Derby

Winner Takes All!!!  Each day of Apogaea our gambling table will be open for betting.  This is a dice game played with 4 to 5 players.  Everyone places a bet (a gift, schwag, stickers, you name it) on the table. The players role the dice for their Post (1 through 5) Highest role gets first choice of placement on the board. Then players role the dice to advance their horse forward or side-to-side (not diagonally). The first player across the finish wins.

Be sure to bring your big Derby hats and Burner schwag for side table betting.

Follow-up on our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/groups/314135472048094/




PLEASE SEE THE GALLERY FOR LARGER PICTURES OF OUR HATS.

The players role the dice for their Post (1 through 5) Highest role gets first choice of placement on the board. Then players role the dice to advance their horse forward or side-to-side (not diagonally). The first player across the finish wins.

Be sure to bring your big Derby hats and Burner schwag for side table betting.
Follow-up on our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/groups/314135472048094/


PLEASE SEE THE GALLERY FOR LARGER PICTURES OF OUR HATS.

story:
OUR CAMPAIGN

ArtGuideEast is a not-for-profit initiative started in 2011 as a gallery guide of the Central and Eastern European region. Our aim is to help the contemporary art scene of the region to get more visibility internationally. To reach our goals we have changed our structure this year and added more content (articles, interviews, exhibition reviews, artist showcases) and started to work with big art fairs (Kinetica Art Fair - UK, Art13 London, ArtParis, Viennafair) and other events (Mediations Biennale -PL, ARTplacc - HUN, European Photomonths) to enhance promotion possibilities and show ourselves.

We work with volunteers, some of them are students, some are already established journalists or art professionals - they all do their work in-kind. 

To get to a more professional level we would need more funding to pay our contributors, printing company - and reach more audiences.

ArtGuideEast is FREE to take for visitors and we would like to keep it that way.

We need your help to make sure quality contemporary art from the Central and Eastern European region can be seen everywhere else in the world.

For 2013 we would need 2800 EUR to pay our journalists and to get to the events we write about. It is that simple.

If we do not reach our entire goal we still pay our writers from the money we raise, so please do contribute to our campaign and help us keep going to a more professional level!

What can we offer for YOU? Well, if you are a company, related to contemporary art we can give you advertising space... If you are an art lover who likes our case we can make sure your name/picture/short description is going to our HERO's WALL 2013 on our website - and after the whole campaign we will have a full page with all the names on it who have helped!

Please do not forget: by contributing you are helping contemporary artists, galleries, museums, events, art schools, workshops and projects that has a connection to Central and Eastern Europe!

If you cannot afford to contribute now, please help us to promote our campaign: share it with your friends and family on Facebook, Twitter or use Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU!!!!

Check our work out: www.artguideeast.org and http://issuu.com/agemagazin

story:
Summary

Eorah is a fantasy-set webcomic from the anthro (furry) gende, free and available for the public to read here>> http://eorah.smackjeeves.com/ It updated once a week, usually on mondays.

  • Eorah is now a 2 years old webcomic, with almost 100 pages done and still on the run.
  • Help me fund my new pc to continue working on my webcomic in regular updates.

What is needed and what you got

  • The goal are 1.200 USD to help me get new equipment, including a new pc, a tablet and the new version of photoshop.
  • In exchage of the funding there will be a 12-15 spin-off chapter of one of the favorite comic character and what happend to him, a group of wallpaper (5-6) and pic for the donors where they can choose the themes they like the most and their favorite characters, character references, access to the Work In progress.
  • New pc, tablet and photosho(sugestion of equipment here is welcome).

Impact

You will help me continue a proyect that I really love and hope you found a funny story to read on the process too.

  • It will help me continue one of my most beloved jobs on the web, free for everybody to see it.
  • Help me have an equipment that will improve the quality of the comic.
  • Eorah has been active for 2 years now, and this is a project that I would love to do.

Risks

The bigges problem here is that in the process of the spin-off chapter plus the pics and wallpaper will make the main Eorah`s webcomic be in a hiatus.

  • I updated in regular schedules so It will be just a thing of time to go back to normal.
  • For the time this funding finish, I will be on vacations, so I have my whole time to dedicate to it and maybe work faster on the process.

Others forms of help

Help Eorah been a better know wecomic:

  • It`s totally free so everybody can read it at anytime.

story:
Hello Slamfans and new friends!

We are Cali and Emily, co-creators of Slam Up, a creative music project that is "not exactly a comedy music set, not exactly a poetry slam, not exactly a lesbian folk duo- Slam Up is something all to itself." We are creating a new genre, one that's does not fit into musical labels, but rather takes our listeners on an emotional journey through the many the many stages of life and shades of love-- requited, unrequited, gay, straight, queer, or, well, just "creative." 

Emily and I have been slamming up for a a little over a year now.  By the end of 2014  we will been on the road for five months, sharing our music, stories, and laughter with new and old friends. There have been shows with audiences of one person, house shows, coffee shop shows, black box theater shows, bar shows, creative co-op shows, and street shows. All have contributed to making us better performers. We have participated in 2014 The New York City Fringe Festival, and even took a little break from working at our non-creative jobs to attend our first music festival ever, Love Fest in the Midwest. We even found time to record our self-funded debut album, Same Brain!

Now that we have spent a year doing our musical DIY "post-bac" we are ready to GO TO COLLEGE! But actually. We want to take Slam Up to the next level and start performing for college students across the country. After all, college students are our target demographic, and in order to sustain Slam Up for years to come, it needs to  go back to school. 

In order to bring our emotional roller coaster of a show to colleges nationwide we need to register with the National Association for Campus Engagement (NACA), and then attend the their national convention in Minneapolis this winter. All told costs of registration/renting a booth/getting to the convention will be about $3,000.

An email from Taylor Harrison, NACA's Membership & Event's Coordinator:

We know. It's steep. But it's also REALLY important. Why?

  1. By attending this national conference we will have the opportunity to show our work to schools all over the country.
  2. It will enable us to book shows that will actually pay us, which will enable us to avoid future crowd fundraising (aka help us now and we will never ask for money via Indiegogo again).
  3. Will get to share our message of safe sex (i.e. herpes) with the people who need need to here it most: college kids.
  4. Minneapolites: We will get to hang out you!

In short, attending the national NACA conference will give us the audience we need to make Slam Up sustainable. 

Your donations will be rewarded with Slam Up gear. How?

  • $1-$10 will get you a free Same Brain download
  • $20 will get you a CD + Reality Check (from Reality Chek himself) in the mail
  • $40 will get you a TSHIRT + a Same Brain CD + a Reality Check
  • $50 will get you a "Potlucks B4 Hotf*cks" tank (they're like snowflakes! everyone is a little different) + Same Brain CD + a Reality Check
  • $500+... we'll write you a song/poem and perform it for you in person at the first possible opportunity. And you get all previously mentioned perks. 

ANYTHING helps. If you can't financially help us, you can support Slam Up by checking out the rest of our Same Brain tour dates and telling your friends to come see us play. 

peace/love/slamup

Cali & Emily aka Slam Up

story:
Bonjour!

Merci de vous intéresser à notre projet!
Le Cercle des Conteurs des Cantons de l'Est organise depuis un an, des matinées de conte au Centre Communautaire du village de Waterville.
Un dimanche par mois, des conteurs talentueux et passionnés du Cercle perpétuent cette tradition orale, loin des technologies hyper-stimulantes, loin de la consommation rapide de divertissements. Un art de la parole, qui ouvre pour l'enfant, en toute simplicité, un monde merveilleux ou il peut plonger en déployant son imaginaire.
Le but de cette campagne de financement est la promotion de l'événement. En effet, très peu de gens connaissent l'événement à Waterville même, mais surtout dans les villages autour...
Nous avons besoin de 500$ pour faire une belle campagne de promotion. Affiches, graphiste, journaux locaux et régionaux, et autre.
Plus l'événement sera connu, plus les enfants bénéficieront en grand nombre de cet accès à la littérature orale, et plus les conteurs pourront se faire connaître et être mieux rémunérés pour leur travail.

Merci pour votre appui!

story:
Hi!

My name is Kellie Pereira, I am a figurative sculptor and carver based in Connecticut. For the past four years, I have attended the Lyme Academy College of Fine Arts in Old Lyme, CT and will be graduating (in just a few weeks) with a BFA in sculpture.  

                            


The National Sculpture Society Figure Modeling Competition

I am very excited to be 1 of the 12 sculptors given the chance to compete in the 2014 national competition. In 2013 I attended this competition and it was a  fantastic experience! I found it to be a great opportunity to meet and converse with sculptors from allover the country.

Last year I was granted the opportunity to compete when it was held at the New York Academy of Art. This year it is located in Brookgreen Gardens, South Carolina. Considering that I am a resident of Connecticut, South Carolina is much further from me than New York City, and the financial burden will be much greater.  I am hoping to obtain funding to cover my travel expenses so that I will be able to (once more) compete in this competition!

This  annual figure sculpture competition is open to any U.S. resident between the ages of 18 to 39. It takes place at a different location every year. Each competitor must complete a full length figure within 28 hours. The competition spans from June 16th to June 21st. On the June 21st, the finished sculptures will be judged and then prizes ranging from $350 to $5000 will be given to the winners.


( Above is the sculpture I made during last years competition.)

Budget

Hotel-  $140  (4- day reduced rate for competitors)

Gas-     $250 ( Round trip from Connecticut to South Carolina.)

Tolls-   $60    (Round trip tolls) 

Food & additional expenses -   $200 


          Visit my website to see more artwork.

                                                    www.KelliePereira.com

                       Also, feel free to contact me via email.

                                                  KellieMPereira@gmail.com


         Thank you for taking the time to look at my campaign!

story:
Who We Are

The Sioux Empire Rock-A-Bettys are a group of women from the Sioux Falls area who promote women and women's interests in the area through donations, volunteering, and fundraising - all while preserving the classic feel of the 1940s and 1950s. We strive to make life for women in the community better, and most importantly show the women and girls in our communities that every woman is beautiful. 

Why A Calendar?

Our pinup calendar was created for several reasons. We wanted to show the community that all women are beautiful and chose to feature real local women - our members - to showcase how great every woman should feel. We decided to create the calendar, and directly deposit all proceeds into a great cause - a scholarship, available to under served women in the area. 

How To Help

In order to make a profit from our calendars, we are looking to you for sponsorships and pre-sales to help us fund the production of the calendar. There are several options, from a simple donation or a calendar preorder, to a month sponsorship or a cover photo featuring your vintage car! Your name or logo could be featured on 250 calendars, and each purchaser will recognize YOU as a supporter of the Bettys.

Don't need a calendar? Not a problem. You can make a donation here or reach out to us to make a separate donation. We're also always looking for new members and great opportunities to help in the community. You can always reach us at siouxempirerockabettys@gmail.com. You can also find us on Facebook or at www.siouxempirerockabettys.org.

story:
So what's this all about?

My name is Sara Uhlig and I am currently a Master of Arts in Arts Administration graduate thesis candidate at the Savannah College of Art and Design. For my final thesis project I am single-handedly fundraising, marketing, curating, and installing an exhibition entitled The Light Inside the Bell Jar.

Using "troubled women" artists as my guide, such as Sylvia Plath and Zelda Fitzgerald, I have been combining my arts administration skills gathered at SCAD to host a group of female-identified artists and their pieces, all artwork that identifies various themes of mental illness in women. The show will take place May 7th through 10th at Sulfur Studios in Savannah, Georgia.

Through this campaign I hope to gain enough funding to cover the various monetary necessities curating an exhibition requires, in order to best showcase the amazing talent I have gathered from throughout the United States and to open up a free dialogue about mental illness in women, and the various women in your life that may be struggling from a mental illness. My personal experience with anxiety and depression will guide me throughout this journey and create a connection with these women artists.

What the exhibition needs & Your fun perks!

To successfully fund my entire project, I need various amounts of funding. A needed total of $1,200, my budget can be broken down in the following ways:

  • $500 will cover the entire gallery space rental fee
  • $400 will pay for the entirety of my marketing budget, including designing and printing exhibition cards, posters, limited edition screen prints, and exhibition tri-fold brochures
  • $100 will assist with show costs, such as printing a vinyl exhibition wall decal and purchasing donation boxes for the show
  • $100 covers catering for the May 8th reception
  • $50 will pay for a photographer to document the May 8th reception, documenting the journey
  • $50 will cover paying for all hanging and installation materials

For donating to my project you will receive the following perks:

  • $1 donation - My undying love & a thank you email!
  • $5 donation - All $1 perks, plus a handwritten thank you note
  • $10 donation - All $5 perks, plus a signed mailed exhibition poster
  • $50 donation - All $10 perks, plus a limited edition, handmade screen print poster for the exhibition
  • $100 donation - All $50 perks, plus a private tour of the exhibition with the curator (Only 4 available)
  • $500 donation - All $100 perks, plus a private dinner with the curator and local Savannah artists, at the local Savannah restaurant of your chosing (Only 1 available) 

If I do not reach my goal I intend to use most of the funding to cover the studio rental fee as well as assisting out-of-state artists in covering the shipping costs of mailing their artwork to Savannah.

The Impact on Women & Families touched by mental illness

The exhibition is also a philanthropic endeavor, with a hopeful minimum of a $200 to The Kim Foundation, a group focused on increasing awareness and promoting continued education related to mental illness. The foundation strives to break down the stigma often associated with seeking mental health care and works to assure individuals and families touched by mental illness that they are not alone on their journey to recovery. Learn more about them at http://www.thekimfoundation.org/

Together with the 15 selected artists, I hope to open up the floor for an honest discussion about mental illness in women, and challenge the notion of the "hysterical woman." 

Through Indiegogo and other crowd funding websites I have successfully overseen the funding of projects such as sending the Student Arts Managers of SCAD to D.C for the American University's Emerging Arts Leaders Conference and Arts Advocacy Day, as well as funding two SCAD senior thesis films, Little Boy Wonder and Rain, Sleet, or Snow.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk associated with this project is reaching the full goal and collecting at least $200 in donations for The Kim Foundation. Together I intend to use my collective fundraising, marketing, and financial knowledge gained from SCAD to overcome these hurdles. With a focus in development, I hope to go on to fundraise many more projects to support the arts. Properly setting up various ways for donors to give will assure that my goal is met and seen by as many eyes as possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand if you cannot donate, but there are lots of other ways you can get involved!
  • Visit and share the exhibitions Blog
  • Join the discussion by sharing thoughts, images, and reactions on social media under the tag #belljarexhibition
  • Follow updates on the Facebook event

The exhibition is also a philanthropic endeavor, with a hopeful minimum of a $200 to The Kim Foundation, a group focused on increasing awareness and promoting continued education related to 
	mental illness. The foundation strives to break down the stigma often 
	associated with seeking mental health care and works to 
	assure individuals and families touched by mental illness that they are not 
	alone on their journey to recovery. Learn more about them at http://www.thekimfoundation.org/
Together with the 15 selected artists, I hope to open up the floor for an honest discussion about mental illness in women, and challenge the notion of the "hysterical woman." 
Through Indiegogo and other crowd funding websites I have successfully overseen the funding of projects such as sending the Student Arts Managers of SCAD to D.C for the American University's Emerging Arts Leaders Conference and Arts Advocacy Day, as well as funding two SCAD senior thesis films, Little Boy Wonder and Rain, Sleet, or Snow.
    Risks & ChallengesThe biggest risk associated with this project is reaching the full goal and collecting at least $200 in donations for The Kim Foundation. Together I intend to use my collective fundraising, marketing, and financial knowledge gained from SCAD to overcome these hurdles. With a focus in development, I hope to go on to fundraise many more projects to support the arts. Properly setting up various ways for donors to give will assure that my goal is met and seen by as many eyes as possible.
  Other Ways You Can HelpI understand if you cannot donate, but there are lots of other ways you can get involved!
Visit and share the exhibitions Blog

Join the discussion by sharing thoughts, images, and reactions on social media under the tag #belljarexhibition
Follow updates on the Facebook event

story:
A Short Summary of my project:

Thanks so much for thinking about funding my language exchange. I'll tell you a little more about myself, and why I think you should contribute:

  • I'm 15 years old, a sophomore in high school.
  • I have been studying Korean for over a year by myself, and am taking French classes at school. I am interested in becoming fluent in multiple languages, and I want to travel and meet people all around the world.
  • I have been drawing since I was a little girl, and I have entered contests with my drawings as well. I have taken art lessons in the past, and I love making art. I think art is very important: it can be inspiration to act, encouragement, pure feeling. Art is necessary.
  • This language exchange could be a turning point in my life: something that helps me form new relationships with people, become a better global citizen, and have a broader world view, not to mention learning to speak Korean much more fluently.
  • This language exchange doesn't only affect me: by influencing the way I interact with people, it could have a broader effect on the people I meet in the future. I will meet people from a very different place, and could influence their outlook on life and the world as well.
  • By funding my campaign, you would be supporting a budding language learner and artist and influencing the future.

What I Need & What You Get

My parents have generously agreed to pay for half of the funds of my trip, but I still need to earn $1,500 on my own. This would go to expenses like airplane tickets, food, and travel within the country. If I don't earn the money through this campaign, I will need to find another way to earn it somehow, or I won't be able to go.

The good thing is, there's something in it for you, too, contributors! From a simple thank-you shout out to a commission or print of a drawing or short comic, I have plenty of rewards in mind for a range of donation amounts. I have specific ideas for the rewards already, but I'm very willing to work with you if you have a certain idea for a project in mind that's not listed! I may not be able to do everything you suggest, but I'd love to communicate with you.

If I don't reach my entire goal, the funds will still go to my trip, and I'll earn the rest in another way.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you really support my project but you just can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Tell your friends! Tell your family! Tell your classmates and coworkers!
  • Share my campaign on social media, or email it out to people who might be interested!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • If you're really dedicated, you could probably hand out flyers or something. I'd be into it.

Thank you so much for your support. I'm looking forward to your commissions and ideas!

P.S.: If you want to see more art...

You can find me on Instagram here: https://www.instagram.com/hgenie14/

And on Tumblr here: https://www.tumblr.com/blog/genie-art

story:
The Story! 

Hello! My name is Christopher Baldwin, and I've created this Indiegogo campaign to help with the costs of the next big journey in my life which will involve traveling and painting! (and comics! This plan will NOT interfere in any way with me doing webcomics!)

I've always dreamed of travel, where I could spend more than a day or two in each area. I've always wanted to settle in a bit, for at least a month, soak in the culture, the town, the views, and be inspired and create.

Which why I've worked so long to create a portable career. But even with that, I never found a way to logistically make it happen.

But, in November, I was looking at an AirBnB listing, when I noticed something in particular.

monthly rates. 

I instantly knew it was what I wanted to do. Just find the most gorgeous places, stay in each place for a month or longer, and then move on. Every couple of months stopping to visit friends and family who have conveniently placed themselves strategically around the country, in order to not feel totally alienated from the loved ones and communities in my life. AND PAINT!

Rent in many places is comparable to what I pay now, and I managed to buy an affordable yet hopefully reliable set of wheels (a 98 camry, body in decent shape, only 150 thousand miles). And so I'm going to do it.

But, travel always comes with costs. It's a little more difficult to stock a fridge on a budget when you keep moving. And there's gas, and oil paints, and AAA, and park fees and all the little things. This indiegogo campaign will go towards things like that, as well as creating a SLIGHT buffer to do things like fix the car or laptop failure. 

And also it's a way for me to give something back. I've remained focused on having comics and writing be my profession, and (for now) painting being my hobby. An intense, exploring, joyous, unstoppable hobby (for which I already have a show scheduled in September at the Crandall Public Library in Glens Falls). And this is my way of dipping my toe in the water for commissions. By doing paintings!

I would be so grateful for your support, and so happy to be able to give something back. 

The Perks!

$10 "Thank You" Card

A personalized thank you card, printed with a piece of my artwork (from my travels) on it.

$25 Character Sketch

I will sketch any character from any comic I've created, on a postcard, and mail it to you (Vachel is the default if you have no preference), with a monochrome wash. For each additional character (drawn on the same postcard), add $5 (maximum of 4 characters).

$60 Hand Drawn Postcard

A hand drawn (in watercolor) postcard mailed to you from me.

$120 Pen & Ink Drawing

A 6"x8" pen and ink drawing of landscape/architecture from my trip.

$400 Oil Painting

An 11" x 14" landscape oil painting.

$600 Landscape Painting w/ Person

A 16x20 landscape painting with a person in it, painted from a photo you send to me (or of my choice if you'd prefer. I can give you options). ($200 per additional person, maximum 5, write me if you wish more).


How I Plan To Make This Happen!

As most of you know, I have two successful Kickstarter campaigns under my belt and have been creating and self-publishing comics since 1996. I also just finished a graphic novel for Penguin/Dial books and write and draw for MAD Magazine.

I have a history of accomplishing the goals I set out for, and being a reliable creator and freelancer.

So, a lot of this trip is specifically to paint, paint paint paint paint paint, and I look forward to painting for all of you.

Paint!

story:
What is CAMP?

CAMP is a pop-up art and music event curated by the community. CAMP is a celebration of culture. It displays a unique way to bring people together, while aiming to provide a unique experience. Over the course of two days CAMP will offer showcases of artwork, meet and greets, and live music performances. The social and creative aspect of CAMP will deliver an unparalleled and incomparable experience. CAMP 2016 will take place in the nation’s capital, Washington, DC. Being home to one of the most accepting and progressive artistic communities, DC will serve as a great host. The purpose of holding such an event is to give the community something to look forward to and something to believe in. Numerous creators of all mediums will be invited from all over the world.  

What We Need & What You Get

To make CAMP possible we are asking for your help to raise $6000. The money raised will be used for the following:

  • Venue cost for 2 days
  • Shipping of art
  • Setup (audio, lighting, stage)
  • Structures that we will build that will showcase the art
  • Merchandise for CAMP
  • To cater to the needs of those who contribute and attend 
For those who donate, the people of CAMP want to give back. 

The Impact

CAMP is a conversation and only goes as far as what is contributed. CAMP is not the location, but rather those who are a part of it. The definition of CAMP itself is leaving your daily routine to go elsewhere. Whoever attends the event will walk away and bring back with them a life changing experience and it can only go up from there. CAMP will be what the people make it and what people bring to the table. CAMP is a collaborative effort!

Risks & Challenges

The main issue Camp faces is the obstacle of raising capital. Without the necessary amount of capital we cannot present an extraordinary experience. We want Camp to go down in history!

If any setbacks do arrive we plan to enter every situations with intelligence, diligence, ethics, and integrity. We will do whatever is necessary to see Camp thrive and create a name for not only itself, but for the artistic communities across the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can make a donation, regardless there are still ways you can help!

  • Help spread the word! Share this page with your friends and family, tell them about  this project, and ask for their support.
  • Join and be apart of our local events!
  • Get involved and become a volunteer!
  • If you have any ideas or suggestions, feel free to contact us and let us know!

story:
Our Story

We are an independent horror culture magazine.  We've recently finished our 3rd issue and have been distributing through word of mouth and online sales (we come out of pocket, and have our issues printed) and we are ever growing.  Our mag is an ever evolving mix of horror art, photography, musicians, models, tattoos and tattoo artists, crafters, special effects artists, horror celebs, and whatever else fits into the horror culture theme.  Imagine a punk rock magazine and Fangoria having a baby and then the baby went on a booze fueled killing spree, now that's our magazine.  We are very much about staying independent and that's why we need your help to keep it that way.  It's not cheap printing magazines!



The Impact

We hope to be the magazine that everyone turns to when they need some inspiration.  The artists we feature are second to none.  Our mission is to provide a voice for all the amazing artists that would never get covered because they are too "dark", too tattooed, too out of the ordinary, or not "big" enough.  We'd also like to bloody up a few celebs for your enjoyment..




What We Need & What You Get

The money you donate will go towards printing enough magazines to get distribution.  We have a distributor standing by waiting for us to print enough copies to plaster Gore Noir all over the states.  If we make enough money will are also looking at producing an Iphone, Ipad, and Android App.  The app will allow us to be viewed instantly all over the globe.  Horror knows no bias, it's loved by all cultures.  We have options for people who want to be in our magazine, people who want to own some of our magazines, and people who would like to sell our magazines.  Shirts, mags, stickers, your face in an issue, a party wherever you want.. Lots of options for everyone!



Other Ways You Can Help

We realize people are low on funds but every donation counts.  Instead of buying that Tall Latte you could be helping us realize our dreams of producing a magazine that is read worldwide.  If you'd still rather buy that latte that's fine, but maybe you could share our page instead?  Someone in your online networks could LOVE our cause and be the difference between us failing or not.  Sharing is Caring!  Even if we don't hit our goal we still get the funding so that we can at least print a larger amount then we are currently able to afford.. or maybe even pay someone to produce that App so we can at least reach our digital market!


Sample pages from issue 2 of Gore Noir:

http://issuu.com/mitchapalooza/docs/gorenoirmag2

story:
The senior Graphic Design students at the University of Illinois are graduating! In order to save us from being starving artists, we need your help!

For the past four (or five) years, our class has been learning the ins and outs of the design world, and now we are finally ready to actually jump into that mythical real world. This winter we will be hosting a career fair in Chicago, IL called Flux (sounds pretty fancy, right?). Flux will be our chance to network with professionals and hopefully land that job we've always been dreaming about. 

How does this affect you? Maybe you know one of the thirty-five seniors personally, maybe you are a genuine lover of the arts who wants to support us as we embark on our journeys in the arts, or maybe you've got some spare change and have no where else to spend it. While all of those are great reasons to donate to our fair, we have one more: design impacts everyone all the time! Whether it's an ad in a magazine, an app or web design, packaging, logo design, or SO much more, almost everything you see has been designed by someone, somewhere.

We are the future of design, and we want to make a positive impact with our skills. Design is ever-evolving, and we hope to contribute to that change in the best way we can – through our own personal style and passions. Our group of thirty-five is unique in terms of where we plan to go after graduation, and we are hoping to end up at amazing places. That's where your assistance comes in. 

Please help out our class by donating to our Graphic Design Career Fair, which will be taking place in Chicago on February 10, 2017. We will be inviting design professionals from across the nation to interview and give advice that will be critical to starting our own careers. We need to raise money that will go towards printing costs and catering for both the career fair and post-fair alumni reception. Help us make this event the best it can possibly be, and help us begin the rest of our lives. 

Thank you! 

The Graphic Design Senior Class of 2017

story:
Dear friends,

My name is Joanne Hastie and I am a Canadian artist living in Vancouver BC. I am excited to announce that I have been accepted into my first International Art Residency in Sicily in December 2014! This will be my first trip focusing on my career as a painter.

What I'll be doing:

I am using this opportunity to develop my unique painting style and visit new places to inspire more cityscape paintings. I will also be painting a large outdoor mural in the city!

My rent and studio space are covered for 2 weeks by the City of Graniti in the province of Messina. But there are costs associated with travel and supplies. This is where I need your help... I am offering a pre-sale for the artwork created during and shortly after the trip to support the flights, transit and supplies.

What I want to offer you:

I want to give you the opportunity to pre-purchase original art that I create from this adventure.

Here are the unique perks:

For $40: Receive a hand drawn ink-sketch done on location in Sicily. Sketch will include a photograph of your sketch  on location. (This will be the first time my ink sketches are available to public.)

For $180: Receive a ~8x10" original acrylic painting on heavy-weight paper inspired from my trip (Normally priced at $250+). Painted during or immediately after trip. Painting will be matted & ready for framing.

For $500: Receive a canvas painting inspired by the trip. This will be painted prior to September 2015. Painting will be a maximum 600sq.in

For $1000: Receive all three perks but the canvas painting will be over 600sq.in.

*The above values are heavily discounted due to pre-sale to support my residency position. I could not imagine anyone owning a piece of art they do not love. So if the final art pieces are not to your satisfaction - the total amount can also go towards a full-priced Joanne Hastie original painting done prior or after trip that are not of Sicily. The amount can also go towards the cost of a commission your own unique painting in the future.
*If you are in the Vancouver area (or potentially in BC), I can deliver the pieces so we both can save on shipping costs.

      Sample work:

      Sample Ink Sketches I have done on Archival white paper & me sketching on location

      Left: Venice 8"x9" Acrylic on Paper (painted 2014)  &  Right: Joanne Hastie painting  outdoors at the Harmony Arts Festival August 2014.

      Left: 'Around the Corner' Bologna 12"x24" acrylic on canvas (painted 2014)  &  Middle: Maggiore Square (Bologna), 10"x17" acrylic on paper (painted 2013)  &  Right: Florence Alley, 10"x11" acrylic on paper (painted 2013)

      You can find more information about me and my artwork at www.joannehastie.com or email me your questions or comments: joanne@joannehastie.com

      More information about the residency: http://www.granitimurales.org/

      Thank you for your support!

      If you are unable to contribute (I completely understand), I'd truly appreciate if you can share my campaign with someone who might like some new original art? Any attention you can help me get would be much appreciated!

      Thanks,

      Joanne

      www.joannehastie.com

I will also be painting a large outdoor mural in the city!My rent and studio space are covered for 2 weeks by the City of Graniti in the province of Messina. But there are costs associated with travel and supplies. This is where I need your help... I am offering a pre-sale for the artwork created during and shortly after the trip to support the flights, transit and supplies.What I want to offer you:I want to give you the opportunity to pre-purchase original art that I create from this adventure.Here are the unique perks:For $40: Receive a hand drawn ink-sketch done on location in Sicily. Sketch will include a photograph of your sketch  on location. (This will be the first time my ink sketches are available to public.)
For $180: Receive a ~8x10" original acrylic painting on heavy-weight paper inspired from my trip (Normally priced at $250+). Painted during or immediately after trip. Painting will be matted & ready for framing.

For $500: Receive a canvas painting inspired by the trip. This will be painted prior to September 2015. Painting will be a maximum 600sq.in

For $1000: Receive all three perks but the canvas painting will be over 600sq.in.

*The above values are heavily discounted due to pre-sale to support my residency position. I could not imagine anyone owning a piece of art they do not love. So if the final art pieces are not to your satisfaction - the total amount can also go towards a full-priced Joanne Hastie original painting done prior or after trip that are not of Sicily. The amount can also go towards the cost of a commission your own unique painting in the future.
*If you are in the Vancouver area (or potentially in BC), I can deliver the pieces so we both can save on shipping costs.


Sample work:

Sample Ink Sketches I have done on Archival white paper & me sketching on location


Left: Venice 8"x9" Acrylic on Paper (painted 2014)  &  Right: Joanne Hastie painting  outdoors at the Harmony Arts Festival August 2014.

Left: 'Around the Corner' Bologna 12"x24" acrylic on canvas (painted 2014)  &  Middle: Maggiore Square (Bologna), 10"x17" acrylic on paper (painted 2013)  &  Right: Florence Alley, 10"x11" acrylic on paper (painted 2013)
You can find more information about me and my artwork at www.joannehastie.com or email me your questions or comments: joanne@joannehastie.com
More information about the residency: http://www.granitimurales.org/
Thank you for your support!
If you are unable to contribute (I completely understand), I'd truly appreciate if you can share my campaign with someone who might like some new original art? Any attention you can help me get would be much appreciated!
Thanks,
Joanne
www.joannehastie.com

story:
My greatest passion is to paint, to create and to inspire others with my art, which is why I have turned my painting into my business (S.E.E.).

Whenever I step into the art store I feel like a child looking at all the colors deciding which ones to get. There are so many and even though I have been there many times I still get that rush walking in the art store! I love color! (Although I have painted a few pieces in black and white which was interesting and popular!). All very exciting, although inevitably expensive!

My mission is to expand my art business, which I have been making great progress over the last two years with. Many exciting things have happened that include multiple art shows, in Los Angeles and previously in England (I am originally from England, but now live in LA). My work is currently up at 3 locations: A wonderful gallery in Venice, a rare/coffee tea house and a restaurant in Santa Monica.

My greatest accomplishment for me is really when people who have purchased my art, say how happy it makes them feel, how that particular piece lifts their spirits and vibrates good energy! Also that they love all the color :o)

I have begun to make prints of my work, and to date I have been paying someone else to take high quality photos of my work for me. This is expensive and therefore I have not been able to take these kinds of photos of every painting. This is why I need a good camera. I have researched for something that will do the trick and is not too expensive. The Nikon D3000 which is 10.2 megapixels will work perfectly and is around $550.

The rest of the funds will be allocated to continuing to grow my business and be able to create more prints, giclees, a wider selection of greeting cards, to purchase additional paints, canvases and art supplies.

It is very important to me that my art connect with people – and I put my heart and soul into every painting (hence the name Soul Energy Expressions). I’ve been inspired by so many beautiful things in my life and my art/paintings are my way of contributing, not just figuratively, but literally.

I have already set up an online monthly charity event on Facebook where 3 paintings of mine are featured, 20% of each sale going to that month’s particular charity with the focus being on people, animals, and environment.

This months (June/July) focus is on people. The more I build my business, the more I can contribute. See this event on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/event.php?eid=117415448...

Perks involve receiving a selection of my greeting cards, a signed high quality print, an original 18 × 18 painting and of course many a “Thank you” from my heart!

Another very important event for me coming up very soon (August!) is becoming a mother! A single mother, so lots of work to do! So, it is even more important that I have as many essentials for my business set up by then.

Please spread the word using the share tools! Thank you so much!
Love, Annabel

story:
http://topspb.tv/news/news71858/

English below! Italiano qui sotto! Français ci-dessous! Deutsch hienieden!

Здравствуйте, Мартин и Николь здесь! Впервые…Это действительно чудо, как будто несколько ангелов очень  хотят нам помочь..? Мы отплыли в Россию во вторник: с нашим театральным шатром, костюмами, персонажами и экипажем. Мы узнали, что швейцарское финансирование нашей поездки в Россию (с 25 апреля до 12 мая 2015) не может осуществиться, но мы рискнули отправиться в турне. Итак, Альберт и Роберт ломают голову, а петух звонит в колокол очень громко. Только девушка спокойна и знает, что все будет хорошо.....

Нам необходимо собрать 5200 евро на паром.

Мы являемся независимой некоммерческой странствующей театральной компанией, которая создает, продюсирует, исполняет и путешествует со своими собственными работами. Мы были созданы, движимые желанием создать поистине семейный  театр, который не ограничивается местоположением, возрастом, языком, деньгами или ценой вопроса. Мы путешествуем с нашим собственным: театром- шапито, который мы возводим везде, куда приходим. 

Год назад театр цирк Монгольфьери, некоммерческая организация из Санкт-Петербурга, влюбился в нашу работу и пригласил нас, чтобы мы выступили со спектаклями на их фестивале «Траектории Монгольфьеров» в России. Идея разделить поэзию нашего семейного театра с людьми из большого города была очень сильной и это дало им силы поверить в большое путешествие через море. Они трудились целый год по привлечению средств, чтобы покрыть все расходы, кроме проезда. Мы были готовы помочь им столько, сколько могли, и согласились покрыть автомобильные перевозки из Швейцарии в Travenmünden паромного порта и обратно и от паромного порта Хельсинки в Санкт-Петербург . Средства на паром мы нашли у швейцарского фонда и подтвердили заказ. 

Огромные затраты за переправу должны были заплатить Швейцарский фонд и государственное финансирование, но в самую последнюю минуту, на прошлой неделе, оба дали нам отрицательный ответ. Поэтому нам сейчас необходимо  найти деньги на паром из Travenmünde до Хельсинки. Которых у нас нет… 

Удивительная паромная компания Финнлайнс пошла нам навстречу и проспонсировала половину стоимости билета. Наше глубокое и сердечное им спасибо. Вторую половину мы не знаем как  найти, но мы уверены, что сможем это сделать с вашей помощью! 

Осталось собрать 5200€ 

Мы увлечены силой повествования, театром и поиском ребенка в каждом из нас. Мы посвятили себя достижению высшего уровня мастерства, какое только возможно достичь. А также посещением городов и деревень. Мы стремимся охватить аудиторию в сельских местах, где нет регулярного доступа в театр. В результате мы живем в наших деревянных вагончиках круглый год, и наше турне длиться восемь месяцев каждый год и мы стараемся ехать туда, куда нас приглашают. Мы работаем с людьми и организациями, которые разделяют наши ценности и нашу страстную веру в театр, в истории, и в нашего зрителя.

Спасибо, если вы сможете помочь нам, в любом случае, пусть это будет совсем немного.

х Н&м


DEUTSCH: Liebe Freunde

Wir durch ein Wunder sind wir nun doch alle zusammen auf der grossen Fähre nach Helsinki… Oben auf dem Deck scheint die Sonne unten im Bach der Schiffes sind unsere Wohnwagen, LKWs, Theaterzelt, Buffet, Bühne, Kostüme… Wir, Nicole und Martin und die ganze Crew mit Hund Kind und Kegel geniessen einen Moment der Ruhe.

Wir werden von Helsinki weiter reisen nach Russland  dort um dort in St. Petersburg an einem Festival 3 Wochen lang zu spielen (25. April-15. Mai 2015).

Die Gesuche um finanzielle Unterstützung wurden leider abgelehnt. So sind  nun Robert und Albert noch unterwegs um auf Ihre Weise zu helfen… Das Mädchen ohne Hände ist zuversichtlich und schaut in die Ferne übers Meer…

Realität ist dass die Hänfahrt nun bezahlt wurde dank einem 50% Rabatt der Finnline Fähren.

Die Kosten der Rückreise 5’200€ müssen wir aber nun in kurzer Zeit auftreiben.

Wir sind ein unabhängiges Theater-Ensemble, gegründet von den beiden Schauspielern Nicole Gubler Schranz und Martin Gubler  und produzieren, kreieren und spielen unsere eigenen Stücke. Wir folgten dem Wunsch eine neue Art Volkstheater ins Leben zu rufen: Theater als Erlebnis- und Begegnungsort für  alle Menschen unabhängig von Alter, sozialer Herkunft, und Lebenssituation.

Wir spielen auf Einladung von Veranstaltern und Festivals, aber auch für Schulen und soziale Einrichtungen. Nicht immer handelt es sich dabei um professionelle Organisationen, sondern auch um Menschen welche getragen sind von gleichen Ideen und  Werten und die Arbeit auf freiwilliger Basis leisten.

Die Menschen von Teater Circus Mongolfieri aus St. Petersburg haben uns vor zwei Jahren in der Schweiz gesehn. Begeistert von unserer Arbeit und unserem Projekt planen sie nun seit Monaten dieses Festival und freuen uns auf den kulturellen und freundschftlichen Austausch und auf die Aufführungen von uns in der grossen Stadt. Viele Hebel wurden von den guten Menschen in Bewegung gesetzt um dies zu realisieren. Die Kosten vor Ort und die Aufführungen sind gedeckt. Dir grossen Kosten der Überschiffung des ganzen Fahrzeuge und dem Zelt übersteigen aber bei Weitem die Möglichkeiten der kleinen sozialen Theater Gemeinschaft.

Begeistert vom Theaterspielen, von der Kraft des Geschichten Erzählens und von der Umsetzung symbolischer Uhrthemen in gesprochener, musikalischer, artistischer und getanzter Weise sind wir getragen von der Faszination und dem Glauben an ein Theater bei welchem sich alle Bühnenkünste als Ausdrucksmittel vereinen. So glauben auch wir an dieses Projekt in Russland.

Daher der Aufruf an Euch alle, liebe Freunde. Wir freuen uns auf jede Spende, ob gross oder klein! Ihr helft uns damit nach Russland und wieder zurück zu fahren! Ahoi!


ENGLISH: Hello, Martin and Nicole here, wondering, for the first time like this, if any angels out there are able to help us…? We to sailed to Russia on Tuesday, with our theatre tent, costumes, characters and crew. We had just heard that the Swiss funding for our trip to Russia (25th April until 12th May 2015) had not come through, but we took the risk to come. So Albert and Robert are scratching their heads and the rooster is ringing the bell very loudly. Only The Girl is calm and knows all will be well…..

We need to raise 5200€ for the boat.

We are an independent not-for-profit traveling theatre company that creates, produces, performs and tours our own work. We were founded out of a desire to create truly communal theatre without borders of location, age, language, money or background. We travel with our own theatre tent which we put up everywhere that we go.

A year ago Teater Circus Mongolfieri, a not-for-profit organisation from St. Petersburg fell in love with our work and invited us to bring our performances to their brand new festival, in Russia. The idea to share our poetic community theatre with the people from this big city was strong and gives them the power to believe in this big journey across the sea. They worked hard all year and raised funds to cover all the costs, apart from the travel. We were ready to help them as much as we could, and agreed to cover the road transports costs ourselves, for the drive from Switzerland to Travenmünden ferry port and back and from Helsinki ferry port to St. Petersburg by road. Both ways. For the ferry itself we applied for Swiss funding, and confirmed the booking.

The huge cost of shipment should have been paid by a Swiss foundation and government funding, but at the very last minute, last week, both gave us a negative reply. So it is up to us now to find also money for the ferry from Travenmünde to Helsinki. We do not have it. 

The amazing ferry company Finnlines stepped  and sponsored half the ticket price. Our deep and heartfelt thanks to them. For the other half, we don’t know how to do it, but we are sure that we can make it happen with your help!

We still need to raise 5200€ 

We are passionate about the power of storytelling, about theatre, and about reaching the child in all of us. We have dedicated ourselves to reaching the highest level of skill we possibly can. As well as visiting towns, cities and villages, we are committed to reaching audiences in rural locations where there is not regular access to theatre. As a result we live in our wooden wagons all the year round, and tour for eight months each year, and try to go anywhere we are invited. We work with people and organisations who share our values and our passionate belief in theatre, in stories, and in our audiences.

Thank you if you are able to help us, in anyway however seemingly small.

x n&m


FRANCAIS:  Hello, c’est nous, Nicole et Martin, pour la première fois demander ainsi,  et pourquoi pas,  n’y aurait’il pas quelques anges sur terre prêts à nous aider….? Grâce à la Compagnie de bateau Finnlines et son soutient (elle offre la moité des frais du bateau) on a pu prendre le bateau mardi, avec notre théâtre, nos costumes, nos personnages et notre équipe. Par contre on a malheureusement appris que notre demande de soutient financier Suisse pour la deuxième moité des frais de voyages en Russie (25 avril au 12 mai) n’est pas passée. Ainsi Albert et Robert s’arrachent les cheveux quand au coq, lui il crie à toute voix sur tous les toits de la ville. Seule la jeune fille sans mains est calme et sait que tout ira bien…

Bon…nous devons atteindre encore  la somme de 5200 euros.

Nous sommes une compagnie indépendante à but non lucratif qui crée, joue et tourne avec son propre théâtre. Un profond désir de créer un propre théâtre populaire sans barrières d’âge, de langue, d’argent, de lieu nous a animé dès le début du projet. Nous voyageons avec notre propre théâtre-chapiteau que nous implantons là où nous allons.

Il y a une année le Teater Circus Mongolfieri, une organisation à but non lucratif également, de St. Petersburg à eu un coup de foudre pour notre travail et nous invite à venir jouer à leur nouveau festival en Russie. L’idée de partager nos spectacles, notre univers poétique chez eux fut si forte qu’elle leur donna toute la force de croire en la réalisation de ce projet et de cette traversée en bateau. Ils ont travaillé sans relâche durant une année pour nous donner la possiblité de réaliser leur rêve. Ils ont fait  recours à des demandes de subventions pour couvrir les frais, sauf ceux du voyage. Nous sommes prêts à les aider et à prendre en charge les frais de voyage de la Suisse au port de Travenmünden (aller et retour) et pour la partie sur les routes du port de Helsinki à St. Petersburg. Pour le bateau nous avons fait des demandes au fondations Suisse et confirmer la réservation du bateau.

Au dernier moment, elles ont répondu négativement. C’est pourquoi c’est à nous maintenant de trouver l’argent pour les frais du bateau de Helsinki a Travenmünden. Cet argent, nous ne l’avons pas!

Avec votre aide, nous pouvons, nous espérons par ce biais rassembler l’argent pour le coût d’une traversée.

Nous devons encore atteindre la somme de 5200 Euros.

Nous sommes passionnés par les contes, le théâtre et la beauté de pouvoir apporter ces spectacles à l’enfant qui est en nous tous. Nous donnons tout pour réaliser nos visions profondes, pour aller jouer dans les grandes villes comme dans les petits villages où il n’y a que très peu de culture. C’est pourquoi nous vivons dans des roulottes en bois durant toute l’année et tournons huit mois dans l’année. Nous essayons de nous rendre partout où les gens nous invitent. Nous collaborons avec des personnes et des associations qui partagent nos valeurs et notre passion, qui croient au théâtre, aux contes et au public.

Merci si vous pouvez nous aider, aussi par un petit soutient, à aller jouer en Russie!


ITALIANO: Ciao, siamo Martin e Nicole, ed è la prima volta che chiediamo un aiuto in questo modo, chissà se ci sono degli angeli in grado di aiutarci? Abbiamo navigato per raggiungere la Russia martedì, con la nostra tenda teatro, costumi, personaggi e l'equipaggio. Avevamo appena saputo che il finanziamento svizzero per il nostro viaggio in Russia (dal 25 aprile al 12 maggio 2015), non era arrivato, ma abbiamo voluto lo stesso rischiare e siamo partiti. Così Albert e Robert si grattano la testa e il gallo lancia l'allarme a voce molto alta. Solo la fanciulla è calma e sa che tutto andrà bene… 

Noi abbiamo bisogno di raccogliere 5200 € per il battello. 

Siamo una Compagnia indipendente che viaggia, non-profit, che crea, produce, recita e porta in tour il proprio teatro. Siamo nati con il desiderio di creare un teatro veramente comune, senza frontiere, età, lingua, denaro di sfondo. Viaggiamo con la nostra tenda teatro che abbiamo portato un po 'ovunque. Un anno fa il Circo Teater Mongolfieri, un teatro no profit di San Pietroburgo, si è innamorato del nostro lavoro e ci ha invitato a portare le nostre creazioni al loro nuovo festival, in Russia. L'idea di condividere il nostro poetico teatro con la gente di questa grande città era forte e ha dato loro la forza di credere in questo grande viaggio attraverso il mare. Hanno lavorato duramente tutto l'anno e raccolto fondi per coprire tutti i costi, a parte il viaggio. Eravamo pronti ad aiutarli, e abbiamo accettato di coprire i costi del trasporto dalla Svizzera al porto di Travenmünden e, tornando indietro, dal porto di Helsinki a San Pietroburgo su strada. Andata e ritorno. Per il traghetto abbiamo fatto domanda per il finanziamento svizzero, e confermato la prenotazione. 

L'enorme costo del viaggio sarebbe dovuto essere pagato dal finanziamento di una fondazione e dal governo svizzero, ma all'ultimo minuto, la scorsa settimana, entrambi ci hanno dato una risposta negativa. Quindi sta a noi ora trovare anche i soldi per il traghetto da Travenmünde a Helsinki. Noi non li abbiamo! 

La compagnia di traghetti Finnlines, ha fatto un passo straordinario, è intervenuta e ha sponsorizzato la metà del prezzo del biglietto. A loro va il nostro profondo grazie di cuore. Per l'altra metà, non sappiamo come fare, ma siamo sicuri che possiamo far accadere questo miracolo con il vostro aiuto! 

Abbiamo ancora bisogno di raccogliere 5200 €. 

Amiamo enormemente il potere della narrazione, il teatro, e raggiungere il bambino che vive in ognuno di noi. Ci siamo dedicati con passione a raggiungere il più alto livello di abilità possibile. Oltre a visitare le città, e i villaggi, ci siamo impegnati a raggiungere il pubblico in zone rurali dove è molto difficile accedere regolarmente al teatro. Viviamo nei nostri carri di legno tutto l'anno, e in tour per otto mesi l'anno, e cerchiamo di andare ovunque siamo invitati. Noi lavoriamo con le persone e le organizzazioni che condividono i nostri valori e la nostra fede appassionata nel teatro, nelle storie, e nel nostro pubblico. 

Grazie se riuscirete ad aiutarci, anche con poco.

x n&m
