story:
Ahhh! Plush Monsters!

First off, thank you for checking out my Indiegogo! This campaign is all about monsters... don't worry, they are plush and don't bite. I have been designing and creating plush for over 3 years now and love every inch of what I create. My plush are all handmade using crochet with a tiny hook and yarn. All of my plush are unique, not one is like the other. My inspiration comes from street art and the amazing colorful portraits you see on the side of buildings. I simply love color and I love unusual color combinations!

The goal of this campaign is to keep my shop going and spread more monster plush love! I am also pursuing to get my patterns into a crochet book, so funding will help to build the supplies to make all the samples needed for this project as well.

Pia the Hipster

About my plush

Now, each plush is made solely by hand. I crochet each limb, head and add on's you see on all my monsters. The time it takes to complete one monster from start to finish is around 8 hours, but I tend to split up my time into days. I am very careful on how I sew my plush, I want them to be perfect from all angles. Most of the time I start out with a sketch, some color inspiration and go at it. Sometimes I choose not to use a pattern I've written, so most are very "one of a kind". I have been designing and selling my plush patterns online for over 3 years. In that time, I have also made and sold one of a kind plush to buy and love! Some have traveled across the ocean and some have been sold right here in my town.

My plush are not your average size, they are actually pocket sized! Most monsters stand around 4"-7" tall. Say what?! I love to work in small scale and I find it a challenge to create something tiny with such great detail and precision. If I have a plush in mind, I will make it my goal to follow through with the design, no matter how tedious the work ahead may be. One of my favorite pieces was a camera I made for a photographer monster. This turned out to be one of my favorite plush to date. 

Hector the Photographer
In progress...

How are the funds used?

The funds made from this here campaign will go to supplies including:

➜ Yarn to expand my color palette

➜ Back up hooks since I tend to go through them quite fast with my tight stitching and grip, as well as more embroidery needles

➜ custom logo design for my website

➜ New business cards, packaging supplies and promotional goods such as stickers, custom tags and shipping supplies

And funds beyond my goal will be used towards advertising my plush shop and improving my plush to the max, as well as a new tablet to be able to work on the go when at craft shows!

The Rewards!

Lets talk about the good stuff for YOU! I wanted to make the rewards awesome and doable on my part, since my plush are handmade and not by machine. Some of these rewards include my "Severed Monster Head" keychains, monster plush, prints, zines and more! I like to spoil, so don't be surprised if I add extra goodies to your rewards as a surprise!

Thank you so very much for taking the time to view my campaign, looking through my pictures and most of all... backing up my project! I would not be launching this if I didn't have my full heart in it and couldn't do it without you! ♥

** I will be trying my hardest to meet my shipping deadlines for rewards, if not get them out earlier! If there is any delay at all, I will contact each one of you! **

Severed Monster Head keychains
Mermaid Monster
story_txt:
Ahhh! Plush Monsters!
First off, thank you for checking out my Indiegogo! This campaign is all about monsters... don't worry, they are plush and don't bite. I have been designing and creating plush for over 3 years now and love every inch of what I create. My plush are all handmade using crochet with a tiny hook and yarn. All of my plush are unique, not one is like the other. My inspiration comes from street art and the amazing colorful portraits you see on the side of buildings. I simply love color and I love unusual color combinations!
The goal of this campaign is to keep my shop going and spread more monster plush love! I am also pursuing to get my patterns into a crochet book, so funding will help to build the supplies to make all the samples needed for this project as well.

Pia the Hipster
About my plush
Now, each plush is made solely by hand. I crochet each limb, head and add on's you see on all my monsters. The time it takes to complete one monster from start to finish is around 8 hours, but I tend to split up my time into days. I am very careful on how I sew my plush, I want them to be perfect from all angles. Most of the time I start out with a sketch, some color inspiration and go at it. Sometimes I choose not to use a pattern I've written, so most are very "one of a kind". I have been designing and selling my plush patterns online for over 3 years. In that time, I have also made and sold one of a kind plush to buy and love! Some have traveled across the ocean and some have been sold right here in my town.
My plush are not your average size, they are actually pocket sized! Most monsters stand around 4"-7" tall. Say what?! I love to work in small scale and I find it a challenge to create something tiny with such great detail and precision. If I have a plush in mind, I will make it my goal to follow through with the design, no matter how tedious the work ahead may be. One of my favorite pieces was a camera I made for a photographer monster. This turned out to be one of my favorite plush to date. 

Hector the Photographer

In progress...

➜ Yarn to expand my color palette
➜ Back up hooks since I tend to go through them quite fast with my tight stitching and grip, as well as more embroidery needles
➜ custom logo design for my website
➜ New business cards, packaging supplies and promotional goods such as stickers, custom tags and shipping supplies
And funds beyond my goal will be used towards advertising my plush shop and improving my plush to the max, as well as a new tablet to be able to work on the go when at craft shows!
The Rewards!
Lets talk about the good stuff for YOU! I wanted to make the rewards awesome and doable on my part, since my plush are handmade and not by machine. Some of these rewards include my "Severed Monster Head" keychains, monster plush, prints, zines and more! I like to spoil, so don't be surprised if I add extra goodies to your rewards as a surprise!
Thank you so very much for taking the time to view my campaign, looking through my pictures and most of all... backing up my project! I would not be launching this if I didn't have my full heart in it and couldn't do it without you! ♥
** I will be trying my hardest to meet my shipping deadlines for rewards, if not get them out earlier! If there is any delay at all, I will contact each one of you! **

Severed Monster Head keychains

Mermaid Monster

story:
The poet Keats once said that "Isaac Newton has destroyed all the poetry of the rainbow, by reducing it to the prismatic colours." To this day, many people believe wrongly that science takes out the mystery, beauty and majesty of the world by explaining how it works.

This is not so.

Inspired by Richard Dawkins' book Unweaving the Rainbow, and his new book The Magic of Reality, this book takes the age-old beauty of nude art and combines it with the beauty, mystery and sheer awesomeness found in the great branches of science.

Photographs are carefully planned to visually represent the science fact in visual form, while a brief description of the science involved explains each picture. We're trying to include as many branches of science as possible including: Biology, Chemistry, Geology, Physics and Astronomy.

Funding for this project will cover the costs of equipment rental (such as a Van De Graff Generator and a replica Hominid skull), gas for travel, incidental expenses for emergencies as well as go towards covering first-run print costs. It also will include partial table rental for its' Calgary Comic Expo 2014 release, copywrite and ISBN registery as an official book and any other conventions locally (or not) that we can afford.

The book release is intended to be mid-april of 2014, with most of the shooting and planning happening over the summer and winter of 2013. Updated pictures, videos and such will occur throughout the year as progress is made.

story:
Short Summary

Jitterbug Jive here, the artist of Discord Whooves and many other tumblr blogs. I am also PierceSmoulder, the director/writer of Doctor Whooves and Assistant. These projects are large, and involve many people thus making us a team. And I'm asking for help on funding a few things, including upgrades in our tools, Bronycon funding for prints and merchandise at the vendor's booth, and finally helping a voice actor (TehCityBeast) to be able to visit with his special somepony. This means a lot to all of us, but of course we're not going to leave everyone empty handed, so here is what this will all amount to:

  • A parody/cover of the song 'Be Prepared' from the Lion King, sung by The Valeyard and Octavia (Villains that have not yet quite made themselves known to the Discord Whooves universe)
  • The Voice actors will be City and PierceSmoulder/BaldDumboRat
  • But we're not stopping at just a cover. We will make this a full animatic storyboard, possibly all in color and in near movie quality, as seen in this sample here:
 
 

What We Need & What You Get

 

We've been trying to get together funds for Bronycon for quite some time now, and thanks to your generosity we've been able to afford the tickets and flights for five team members and a booth in the vendor's hall. But that all cost quite a lot of money, and now we're asking for just a bit more in order to provide quality products at the table. Even if we do or don't reach our goal though, all of the money will be going to City, Bronycon Funding, and to upgrade our tools such as better microphones for voice actors in DWnA and if possible better programs for better production. And the song will still be released of course, along with an animatic (Though quality might not be as high on the art-side if the goal isn't made) People will still recieve their prizes as well.

Even donations of small to larger amounts can get you prizes, so you're not just donating to nothing! Here's what you can expect:

5$ will get your name mentioned as a thank you in the credits of the video

10$ will get you a personal thank you from Octavia where she will read out your name. (BaldDumboRat)

15$ will get a thank you from both Octavia and Valeyard together

(The donations below are first come, first serve)

25$ up to 20 people will recieve a signed quality poster print of the animatic frame sample seen above. (Signed by the artist, Jitterbug Jive)

100$ will give five people their character a cameo in the animatic (Note they will likely become a 'victim', they also can only be a pony and no alicorns)

200$ will give 3 people a bundle pack. That's a personal thank you read out by the characters, the above poster, 5 prints from the finished animatic, a and character cameo in the animatic

The Impact

With proper funding not only will we give you a quality animatic and song, but we will also be able to provide better prints, posters, buttons, and other merchandise at the Vendor's table. If we make enough, we can even sell products on-line for fans who might not be able to attend.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't send any donations, this is fine! You can help by spreading the word and letting other people know about this project!
Thank you very much for reading!

story:
Thanks for taking a moment to consider supporting our new venture!

This year we're planning to create an interactive, mobile manifestation of all our favorite things in the shape of D.O.R.I.S., aka Doris the Love Bug, aka the Disco Love Bug. But what does D.O.R.I.S. stand for, I hear you ask?

DISCO - We're rather fond of Disco balls so we decided to make an art car out of them...

OPERATIVE - We're not just cooperative, we're disco-operative; Doris will transport disco operatives where they need to go.

RADICAL – Expect a wide range of radical self-expression and entertainment onboard.

INCLUSION – Doris is an equal opportunity love bug. Come one, come all!

SHUTTLE – Between the hours of 4 and 8am every day Doris will shuttle back and forth between the 2 and 10 o'clock sides of the playa (exact route tba).


Inspired by this year's theme - Da Vinci's workshop - we've used the golden ratio throughout the design and are creating a sculpture of Da Vinci's Vitruvian man to mount on the roof. 

At night the lights, or rather the four poles to which they are fixed, on the roof of each of the domes will rotate while shining down on the disco ball surface to give the impression that the giant disco balls are spinning. Not quite Da Vinci's helicopter but a close approximation, as we hope you'll agree :)

Step inside and you'll find a sumptuous interior with DJ booth, pumping sound system, space to lounge, and a misting system for daytime. There is a deck at the back so you can watch the world go by, and a place to store your bike.

The domes will be built around a custom-made steel skeleton, with over 10,000 mirror tiles painstakingly glued on to a robust fibreglass outer shell. If we reach our target we'll also incorporate a propane cannon breathing fire from the top of the Vitruvian Man's head.

Thank you enormously for reading this far. We'd love to realise our dream and share Doris with you. If you want to support but have no extra cash, please share this page with friends and family :)

Peace and Love

Crew D.O.R.I.S.

xxx

story:
About Us and Our Campaign

    •    Hello, world!  I am Beth-Ann Wilson and my husband is Sean Van Cleve.  We are a husband and wife team from Baltimore, MD.  He is a musician/writer/avid backpacker. semaphoretrailreview.net  I am an oil-painter/gallerist/bartender.  bethannwilson.com  On a whim, we applied for the permit lottery to hike in The Enchantments in Washington State back in February 2017 and, to our surprise, we actually won permits!  Some people apply year after year and don’t get in so we are extremely lucky!  We are taking this very rare opportunity and turning it in to a unique artistic, cultural and learning experience.  Sean is going to journal/blog about it and I am going to write and paint about it.

    •    This trip across our great nation is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity and we believe that we have the creativity and skill to turn this in to an experience that can bring joy to many.  We are artists and we love to make art.  Our campaign is seeking funding to help lessen the blow of taking time off from our “day jobs” to be able to afford to travel cross country at the pace that would allow us the ability to make the most of our journey in terms of creatively logging and responding to our experiences.  Our aim is to ultimately share those experiences with our family and friends (old and new- yes, you!).

    •    Your generous contributions will enable us to savor the experience of traveling to this unique destination in Washington State and to respond to our environment and experiences through our artistic pursuits.  Sean is an avid hiker and extremely talented writer and musician.  He has a gift for blogging and gear product-reviews as well as trip reports and guiding others.  Beth-Ann is an oil painter who has decades of experience plein-air painting and creating studio pieces informed by sketchbook journals and photos.  She has explored locales as close to home as her local inner-city park (Patterson Park in Baltimore) and Harpers Ferry to Spain and Scotland in Europe.

 

What We Need & What You Get

    •    We are seeking $2000 in funding to help pay for gas & tolls, art supplies- specifically canvas and paper, offset time taken off work, permits, parking passes, extra SD cards for our cameras, and other incidentals along the way.

    •    Unique perks— 

       $10 - we’ll carry your name with us across the country and give no less than 2 social-media (Facebook, twitter, instagram) shout-outs

        $25 - we’ll send you 3 hand-written “ready-made” postcards over the course of our trip

        $50 - we’ll send you 2 hand-painted or hand-drawn postcards with a hand-written message over the course of our trip

        $75 - we'll give no less than 3 shout-outs on social-media (Facebook, twitter, instagram), we'll add partner links to the page of your choice on bethannwilson.com and semaphoretrailreview.com

        $100 - 9”x12” you will receive an oil painting sketch on paper - either a landscape or a portrait inspired by our trip

        $200 - 9” x 12” you will receive an oil painting sketch on paper - either a landscape or a portrait of our trip, PLUS an invitation to the opening reception of exhibition of art created/inspired by our trip to The Enchantments at Night Owl Gallery

        $700 - 18” x 24” custom oil painting on canvas shipped anywhere in the contiguous United States

        $1000 4-hour private party at Night Owl Gallery in Baltimore, MD

        $2000 ALL OF THESE PERKS

    •    While we are very optimistic that we will meet it, even if we don’t meet our entire goal, contributed funds will still be used to help offset our time taken off from work, pay for gas and tolls, and to help pay for art materials.

The Impact

    •    Our cause is unique and supporting this cause is a good value because of the unique perks.  Beth-Ann has a proven track-record of art and print sales.  She has a studio/gallery space in Baltimore City that she is committed to. Sean's guide services through his company Semaphore Trail Review are increasingly in demand as more and more city-dwellers seek to unplug and unwind. Sean’s writing and website have become increasingly popular especially with the “Hiker Happy Hour” initiative which bridges the wilderness and the inner city.  It is a wellness activity that reduces stress/anxiety and forges friendships.  Sean helps to facilitate bringing urban outdoor enthusiasts together and encourages them to get out of the city to destress and “recharge” by planning and organizing hiking, camping, and backpacking trips.

    •    Sean and Beth-Ann have gone on smaller-scale trips together to Harpers Ferry, Upstate NY, and Vermont to hike and camp and also write and paint.  Beth-Ann has always been inspired to travel and then use that experience to inform her art because of a unique study-abroad experience that she was able to participate in while she was still in high school.  She took art lessons at a place called Huntington School of Fine Arts in Long Island that was run by an artist, Joseph Mack, that had a small “chateau” in France.  Each year he would take a group abroad to spend an immersive month in the French countryside to learn about the culture, the language, the landscape.  She was so affected by the experience that every time she travel she collected reference materials, kept a sketchbook journal, and then would create a body of work based on her experiences.  In terms of similar projects that have been completed, Beth-Ann has successfully traveled to and created bodies of work from trips to France, Spain, Scotland, Vermont, Upstate New York, Long Island, Harpers Ferry, not to mention plenty of work inspired by the great city of Baltimore and the unique architecture and green spaces contained within.

Risks & Challenges

    •    Obstacles faced are Beth’s inexperience with backpacking, however she has been working on body-conditioning.  She has been working on fine-tuning a concise portable painting system that minimizes paint drying time and maximizes versatility.

    •    Sean and Beth-Ann are their own support system.  They rely on each other for help and guidance. They embark on their journey the day after their 6th wedding anniversary!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

    •    If you can’t make a monetary donation please share this campaign to get the word out!  

    •    Indiegogo has many share tools!  The more platforms you share this on, the more potential contributors are reached and the more likely we are to meet our goal!

story:
ABOUT THE PROJECT

‘A Force of Nature’ – The Stage

Selina Thompson is an artist and performer based in Leeds, United Kingdom. She makes work that is urgent, playful and intimate – whether that’s by building a giant dress out of cake with over 2000 people in a shopping centre for 2 days, sharing stories with people inside a 7ft ball of hair, or touring her highly acclaimed solo shows across the country. 

Selina makes work that opens up spaces for us to talk as honestly, openly and clumsily, as experts of our own experience, about the things that we need to. She’s worked in hairdressers and barbers in Chapeltown to become an ‘expert’ in afro hair. Spent 6 months with the employees and service users of a Leeds City Centre Job Centre. And for the last 12 months, she has worked in 6 cities in the UK to meet and speak with people  - academics, the women she went to school with, teenagers, writers, other artists, hairdressers, chefs, and her Nan, Grandad and God-Daughter about what it means to be Black, and living in Britain in 2015. How we came to be where we are now, and what the future might be.

Now, in 2016, Selina has set herself a new challenge in order to meet, speak and work with more people. But we need your help to get her there.

SALT.

At the end of an entire year of speaking with over 850 people in the UK, Selina’s ready to create a new theatre show. ‘Salt.’ will be premiered at this year’s Mayfest in Bristol, transferred to Leeds for Yorkshire Festival and then toured internationally throughout 2018.

Salt. is about grief, ancestry, home, forgetting and colonialism – how those big words and concepts can all converge onto one body, and one story. It will feel like a descent into the depths of the ocean - beautiful, mythical and powerful, doing justice to the size and scale of its subject matter.

THE VOYAGE

As the final stage of researching this project, Selina will be sailing – on a cargo ship - along one route of the Transatlantic Trade Triangle. The voyage will take her from the UK, to Ghana, and Jamaica before returning home with the stories, reflections and experiences that she needs to finish making a show that holds the pyshic weight of that journey.

It will take 2 months – 42 days at sea in total.

Selina will be travelling with filmmaker Hayley Reid to document the journey. Together, they will meet and begin collaborations with artists and academics whose work explores a similar territory: conducting interviews, sharing meals together and reflecting on the questions ‘Salt.’ is asking.

It’s the trip of a lifetime. The furthest Selina has ever been from home, for the longest she has ever been from home, and the journey her dad always wanted to make and never got to.

We want you to be a part of this journey with us.

WHERE IT WILL BE SPENT

After one year of hustling and brutal budgeting, we have raised 75% of the total cost of this trip. With only £2750 to go, here’s what we have left to pay for:

- Some bits of kit and equipment to make sure the footage can turn into the most beautiful film it can be.
- Money towards expenses and making sure they can travel comfortably (not 5 star comfort, obviously! Just ensuring we've got enough fuel to work and make the best work we can).
- Some mental and physical health support for them both as they embark on a mentally and physically challenging journey.

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Physical and mental risks and challenges are scattered throughout this journey – but your money is in completely safe hands.

We have the support of 2 major international festivals in the UK – Mayfest and Yorkshire Festival – and have undertaken a detailed period of research before committing to the trip.

We’re working with some incredible local groups in Accra and Kingston to introduce us and show us around, provide enough context for us to create genuine relationships with those we meet and the beginnings of a long term collaborations that could see artists from all three continents hosting one another.

We’ve had advice and support from Rose George – who has written an incredible book on the shipping industry (Deep Sea and Foreign Going, you should buy it), and has undertaken a series of journeys on cargo ships (thank you!) And are working with The Cruise People who have taken great care to help us to plan and map out all elements of the voyage.

Finally, we continue to have the support of the force of nature that is Emma Beverley, our Producer – she's worked with us to build a project and budget that is robust and substantial enough to ward off any unexpected incidents.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you’d like to support us but don’t have the money at the moment, there are plenty of other ways you can help:

- If you have friends, relatives or contacts in Ghana and Jamaica who might be interested in the project we would love an introduction!

- Share this page with anybody who you think may like to help and support us.

- Come to the final show in either Mayfest or Yorkshire Festival later on this Spring (booking details to be announced soon)

If you have any questions, get in touch on info@selinathompson.co.uk

All of our love

Selina Thompson Ltd and Team

story:
Who Am I and What Is This?

My name is Mari Ma and I am currently a senior at Drexel University's Entertainment and Arts Management. The Sing and Tell Cabaret is an event where undergraduate students and professional artist collaborate together to perform contemporary musical theatre works that not many outside the industry have even heard of.

I hope this event will be able to cultivate a professional relationship between the current and up and coming talents. Helping these undergraduate students to gain valuable experiences and networking opportunity, while performing contemporary works that have not yet been exposed to the general Philadelphia market. 

Here are two examples:

Your funding will help bring this event to the amazing space of World Cafe Live, and will give undergraduate artists who are looking to pursue a career in the arts a jump start with a legitimate paying gig!

The song list are to be revealed the day before Christmas! GET PUMPED

The Impact

This idea of cultivating professional relationship between the two demographic stems from the Drexel Co-Op Theatre’s residency shows. I was part of the program for two years and have done two different professional shows with Philadelphia Artist's Collective and Simpatico Theatre Company. The experience of working with theatre professionals opened up my eyes and in my opinion, it was extremely valuable as an undergraduate. Recently I attended the Barrymore Award (an award show dedicated to the Philadelphia theatre community) and it blew my mind just how many directors, designers, creators, and actors I have already gotten the pleasure to work with. I hope to recreate and expand on that idea to create an event that can showcase the up and coming talents, while providing them with the opportunity to work in a professional setting to garner experiences and relationships with the tight knit Philadelphia theatre community. 

What We Need & What You Get

I am in need of $2,750 to bring this event into World Cafe Live, which have the ability to provide the event refreshment and the cabaret atmosphere, and compensate the artists, both students and professional. If you have not experienced a cabaret before, it is extremely vital for the audience to be able to enjoy a drink or two and some food while listening to the performer's lovely performance. The atmosphere that it creates help draw people in, demonstrated by the success and popularity of 54 Below and other similar venues. 
On the right we have our perks. Beside tickets to an amazing show and free booze (yay!), we also have signed posters as well as an amazing chance to be mentioned in the show as a special shoutout during the performance! I am extremely grateful for anyone who donates regardless of amounts. The different perks is to make sure everyone who donate get what they deserve PLUS my undying gratitude!
*All funds raised in this campaign will still go towards the event if I do not reach my entire goal, then there might be change in event location and I would notify all of those who donated.

Risks & Challenges

One of the biggest risks of this event would be the weather. Since this event is set to be held in Jan 19th, 2016, there is a chance that there would be weather realted incident such as snow storm or ice-y road which prohibit some of you from coming. But I am diligent having this event unless they close down the venue for these reasons.

You Can Always Help

I am a college student, I absolutely understand that sometimes, even $5 is over the weekly allotted budget. If you cannot contribute for any reasons at all but still want to help out, please share and let all your friends and family know about this. Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Reddit ... etc. Spread it, post them all. I really appreciates all that because.... money isn't everything!

story:
Welcome to our campaign page!!!!!!

My name is Ari, a.k.a, aricoco. I am an interdisciplinary artist based in Brooklyn, New York. I started a project, PIPORNOT (=Primus Inter Pares or NOT) during the fellowship with Target Margin Theater, Institute for Collaborative Theater Making in 2014. And the project has received support from Culture Push since Spring 2015. 

I am interested in how social insects such as ants and bees construct and maintain their colony. Through my art practice, I have transformed myself into a queen ant. I thought I could “rule” a colony but I was so wrong. A Queen needs a lot of help! Nursing ants, foragers, cleaners, and even lazy ants, all help her to produce, and keep the colony surviving. She doesn't have power over other ants. The book, “Emergence” by Steven Johnson, introduced me to the idea of the process of non-hierarchical self-organization. It invigorated my investigations in temporary community building and gives me hope – if those little creatures can think/act locally and eventually effect globally, perhaps humans can do that too without a central power!? I became more interested in the evolution of insects' behavior and how it can teach us more about human behavior. Together with my collaborators, I am examining the concept of 'community' by paralleling human systems with social insects. 

In research for this project, our methods have been twofold: 1) communicating with scientists who studies insect’s social evolution and behavior to glean concrete knowledge of these social insects. 2) conducting interactive workshops over the past year, exploring how communities form with non-hierarchical systems, by focusing on insect eusociality and emergence. In the workshops, we engaged in visual ways of communicating (mark-making collage, mask-making) movement research (experiments on how to sculpt our surrounding space) and Tango practice (research on how the social dance scene operates), to find ways to function together as a group in hopes of forming a temporary community. 

In this Summer, my collaborators and I will be hosting a public event to share scientific research processes on insect's behavior and to introduce ideas of emergence.

The event will be in several parts. Part one will be a lecture and a series of immersive games by Yuko Ulrich and Aniek Ivens, two scientists in the Kronauer lab at Rockefeller University, who study insect’s social evolution and behavior. Here everyone will learn the ins-and-outs of life in an ant colony and how that connects to us and our lives. For the second part, there will be a short performance by Kai Kleinbard, followed by a reception (light snacks and refreshment will be served.) 

To make this event free of charge, we need your help to raise some money!!!

Collaborators

(from left: aricoco, Julia Benedict, Aniek Ivens, Kai Kleinbard, Yuko Ulrich)
Julia Benedict

Julia is a theater-maker and a writer, she helped me with my other project in the past. She is interested in human behavior and our social systems. She examines patterns of how we, as humans, relate to one another and the possibilities of connection and communication, through narrative and installation. Her interest in finding community in humans has brought her to looking towards insects as other social creatures and comparing the concept of community with super organism.

Kai Kleinbard

Kai is an Alexander Technique teacher, has over a decade of experience working with young learners with executive function difficulties, pioneering a method combining embodiment and learning for people with special needs. Kai co-founded the bodyLITERATE Research Initiative, an organization that researches the connections between embodied and emergent learning. As a choreographer, Kai makes dances that mimic the simple emergent structures of nature, including flocking birds, insect behavior and schools of fish. As an improviser, Kai builds movement scores where there is enough order to create recognizable patterns, while being open-ended to allow spontaneous interactions.

credit: Ian Douglas

credit: Cori Olinghouse

Yuko Ulrich

Yuko received her M.S. from the University of Lausanne, Switzerland, where she worked on the sociogenetics of halictine bees. She then did a Ph.D. at ETH Zurich, also in Switzerland, where she studied how pathogens spread within colonies of bumblebees. Yuko is now a Postdoctoral Fellow at Rockefeller University and she works on division of labor in the clonal raider ant Cerapachys biroi.

Yuko’s study subject: Cerapachys biroi / ©Daniel Kronauer 


Aniek Ivens

(Photograph by Jeroen Kuijpers)

Aniek is a scientist and improvisation actress and coach. The overarching theme of her work is ‘cooperation’, be it between the members of an improv team on stage or between the ants that she studies. Her scientific research focusses on the evolution and ecology of mutualisms, cooperation between different species. During her undergraduate studies at Universities  of Wageningen and Groningen (The Netherlands) she studied these interactions in fungus-growing ants and termites. During her PhD (shared between Groningen and the University of Copenhagen) she combined theoretical modeling with empirical work on another example of farming practices by social insects: underground ants farming root-aphids, which she also studies here in the US at The Rockefeller University. As an improviser, she trained, performed with and coached various improv groups in the Netherlands. Here in the United States she trained at the Alan Alda Center for Communicating Science (Stony Brook University), as well as at The People’s Improv Theater and The Magnet. She can be found on stages throughout NYC performing with her improv team ‘The-Hand-me-Downs’ or in her solo-improv show ‘Dr. Aniek Discovers’.

Our goal is to raise $2000!!!!! 

The funds raised from this campaign will be used to pay for my collaborator's time and service (performance), scientist's consultation, food and drinks for the reception, production of PR materials, transportation of performance props, and rehearsal space. Portions of the funds raised will be allocated to hire a photographer to document the event and staff to help out serving drinks for the reception.

Please check out all exciting our perks for your contributions!!!

The Impact

The event venue will be held at University Settlement in LES, NYC. The area has a long history of being a community in flux, growing and shaping to the needs of the ethnic diversity. As a new immigrant myself, I want to continue that tradition in this neighborhood by exploring new methods of forming a temporary community. I hope this event will help us connect with the local community and glean the rules establishing our new community. 

I hope you will come and join us for this event on Saturday, July 30th from 7 to 9:30pm.

Thank you very much!!!!!!

story:
English follows …

Texto em português abaixo …

Allo!

Le projet que je vous propose de financer est ma première exposition solo qui sera une rétrospective de mes dix années de carrière. L’exposition se tiendra au mois de mai 2015 à la galerie Espace Projet à Montréal.

Ceux qui connaissent mon travail savent qu’au début, j’effaçais l’image de certaines personnes sur mes photographies familiales, en faisant usage d’outils informatiques. J’ai ensuite commencé à interagir avec de vraies photographies, d’une façon plus matérielle, avec de la broderie, technique influencée par ma mère et mes grands-mères. Jusque là, le concept de l’œuvre tournait autour de la notion de perte, de disparition. La question du souvenir commençait à devenir plus apparente aussi : l’envie de m’approprier la mémoire d’autrui devenait de plus en plus évidente.

Maintenant, j’ai l’intention de vous présenter une exposition qui regroupe mes travaux passés et ma nouvelle série. De toutes nouvelles œuvres; une évolution et une révolution ! Je vous promets quelque chose d’extravagant, d’extrêmement coloré et de ludique. Un défilé de tout ce qui a influencé mon cheminement artistique et de vie.

Ceux qui me connaissent savent ma passion pour mon travail et son sujet. Cette exposition à Montréal sera l’un des points forts de ma carrière. Et je ne pourrais pas la faire dans une galerie autre qu’Espace Projet. La galerie qui m’a littéralement accueilli entre ses murs. Partagez ce rêve avec moi !

L’argent amassé servira à produire mes œuvres, à acheter le matériel nécessaire à la mise en exposition et à produire une petite publication.

Vous pouvez choisir une des contreparties ou donner autant que vous voulez. Et n'oubliez pas de partager cette page avec vos connaissances.

Merci!

Ludji

Em português agora!

Oi!

O projeto que venho propor a vocês é minha exposição solo, uma retrospectiva do meu trabalho, nesses quase dez anos de carreira. A exposição ocorrera no mês de maio de 2015, na galeria Espace Projet, em Montreal.

Aqueles que conhecem minha obra sabem, que a princípio, eu apagava a imagem de certas pessoas de fotografias antigas da minha família, utilizando ferramentas digitais. Na série seguinte comecei a intervir diretamente sobre as fotos, bordando sobre elas - influência de minha mãe e de minhas avós. Naquele momento o conceito da minha criação girava em torno da perda, do desaparecimento. Porém, inquietações relacionadas a idéia de lembrança já começavam a florescer; a percepção dessa necessidade de me apropriar da memória dos outros ficava mais e mais evidente.

Gostaria de apresentar a vocês, junto a uma seleção de obras anteriores, minha nova série. Algo novo e diferente do que vinha produzindo; uma evolução e uma revolução no meu trajeto artístico. Prometo à vocês algo extravagante, colorido e lúdico. Uma procissão de tudo que artisticamente influenciou minha obra e minha vida.

Acredito que essa exposição em Montreal será um dos pontos altos da minha carreira até então. E eu não poderia realizá-la em outro lugar se não na galeria Espace Projet, que me acolheu literalmente entre seus muros. Compartilhem esse sonho comigo!

Vocês podem escolher una das contrapartidas (perks à direita), ou doar quanto quiserem! Nao esqueçam de compartilhar a campanha com os amigos! 

Obrigada!

Ludji


And in english!

Hi!

The project that I’m proposing is a solo retrospective exhibition of my work, of my nearly ten years carrier. The exhibition will take place in May 2015 at Espace Projet in Montreal.

Those who know my work, know that in the beginning, I erased the images of certain people from my family albums, with the use of digital tools. In my following series, I started to interact with real photographs in a more material way, with embroidery, influenced by my mother and my grandmothers. In that moment, the concept of my work was related to loss, to disappearance. The question of memory started to appear: the impression of my need of appropriation of the memories of people was more and more evident.

Now, I want to present you, with a selection of my older pieces, my new series. It is something totally different for me, an evolution and an revolution! I promise you something extravagant, colorful et ludic. A parade of everything that influenced my artistic path and my life. An exhibition of me!

All the people that knows me, knows the passion I have about my work and my subject matter. This exhibition in Montreal will be an important step in my carrier. And I couldn’t do it in any other place than Espace Projet. The gallery that literally tooks me inside its walls. Come share this dream with me!

The money will serve for the production of my new work, the materials for the exhibition production and a publication.

You can choose one of the perks, or give as much as you can. And don't forget to share the campaign with all your friends! 

Thank you!

Ludji

_____________________________________________________________________________

N'oubliez pas de jeter un coup d'oeil sur mon nouveau site-web

Não se esqueçam de dar uma olhada no meu site novo!

Don't forget to take a look at my new website

http://ludmilaberg1.wix.com/ludmilasteckelberg

mai 2015 à la galerie Espace Projet à Montréal.

connaissent mon travail savent qu’au début, j’effaçais l’image de certaines
personnes sur mes photographies familiales, en faisant usage d’outils
informatiques. J’ai ensuite commencé à interagir avec de vraies photographies,
d’une façon plus matérielle, avec de la broderie, technique influencée par ma
mère et mes grands-mères. Jusque là, le concept de l’œuvre tournait autour de
la notion de perte, de disparition. La
question du souvenir commençait à devenir plus apparente aussi : l’envie de
m’approprier la mémoire d’autrui devenait de plus en plus évidente.
Maintenant, j’ai
l’intention de vous présenter une exposition qui regroupe mes travaux passés et
ma nouvelle série. De toutes nouvelles œuvres; une évolution et une
révolution ! Je vous promets quelque chose d’extravagant, d’extrêmement
coloré et de ludique. Un défilé de tout ce qui a influencé mon cheminement
artistique et de vie. 
Ceux qui me
connaissent savent ma passion pour mon travail et son sujet. Cette exposition à
Montréal sera l’un des points forts de ma carrière. Et je ne pourrais pas la
faire dans une galerie autre qu’Espace Projet. La galerie qui m’a littéralement
accueilli entre ses murs. Partagez ce rêve avec moi !

L’argent amassé servira
à produire mes œuvres, à acheter le matériel nécessaire à la mise en exposition
et à produire une petite publication.Vous pouvez choisir une des contreparties ou donner autant que vous voulez. Et n'oubliez pas de partager cette page avec vos connaissances.Merci!Ludji

story:
We Found 23 Rolls of Canvas & Printing Paper!

They were thrown to the curb for reasons that we cannot even dream of.

In the past 5 days, we've been working nonstop, and we've already made a ton of paintings and collages. We plan to give them to all of our contributors. Have a look at the perks that we're offering.

ALL PROCEEDS will go towards repairs and expenses for our art gallery, as well as FREE SCHOOL for our community. We need more funding to continue spreading skills to our friends and neighbors. Each month, we will teach a course on a given subject......stretching canvas, painting technique, microbrewing, woodworking, welding...etc....


We will also begin hosting a local open-mic night, starting this fall. Extra funds would definitely help facilitate that.

The goal of the Barbershop Art Space is to create an underground artistic hub for the city, where anyone will feel welcome to come and create.

http://www.thebarbershopartspace.com/

*

If You Believe in Pure Creativity, and Not Being Wasteful, This is the Campaign for You

We feel blessed to have come across so many amazing art supplies for free, and we also feel frustrated and inspired to make something beautiful.
By helping us, you'll receive an original work of art, and you'll get the satisfaction of knowing that you've helped us fix up our gallery and our community.


Bobby Howard, Devin Andersen, and Joe Williams run a small art gallery, and in their spare time, they prefer to make all kinds of art at all times.


www.thebarbershopartspace.com/devin-andersen
www.elbowgreece.com

story:
Please also see our website at http://deuxmos.com/ !

 

Create-A-Kits (CAK for short) are mix and match do-it-yourself sculptures for making your own customized character figurine. There are currently already a few different pieces to choose from and more pieces are being made. CAK are currently made by hand using a sculpted master copy of the figurine piece, hand poured mold, and hand poured resin casted duplicates - though I have plans to get them factory reproduced if I they become popular enough.

With the CAK you can make your own original character figurine with only minor crafting/sculpting abilities. Just pick the body pieces you want and put them together and sculpt the details such as hair and clothes and then paint! Pre-made clothing and hair styles are planned and eventually all that a buyer will need to do to have a completely custom figurine is to pick your choice of pieces, put it all together and paint however you wish! (I'd like to point out that while the only examples currently shown are cartoon animals, there are already human heads available for those who want a human figurine.)

Deuxmos.com is the dedicated website for Create-A-Kits but it is more than just a web store to buy the kits.The site also has a forum to be used by interested people for anything from asking for help and tips on customizing their own CAK, sculpting and other artistic advice or just plain fun and chatting with one another. There will also be an artist's corner for people offering their customization skills of kits for one on one commissions with interested people, as well as tutorials, photo galleries and more!

 

The Story

My name is Leslie Merz and I am a freelance sculptor. I graduated the Art Institute of California - San Diego in 2008 with a bachelor's degree in Media Art and Animation. Because of the five year minimum experience requirement to work for most studios, I have been working as a One of a Kind (OOAK) sculptor for commissions over at DeviantArt for the last three years (aachi-chan.deviantart.com). I have had customers all over the world, from here in the United States, to the United Kingdom, Canada, Holland, Australia and other countries. 

 

I have wanted to make molds of my sculptures and cast them in resin to sell for quite some time. Most of the people who commission me for a custom figurine ask me for their furry fan character, this is what led me to believe that making a mix and match garage kit (do-it-yourself character figurine kits) in that same art style would be the best project to start with. This way, I can bring custom character sculptures to people at a much cheaper price than my OOAKs and therefore sell more of them.

 

The Impact

As I have previously gotten a good start on this project a few months ago thanks to Indiegogo and my own funding efforts, I am now in the middle phases of the project. Currently, I am in need of funding for the website's own hosting (it is currently being hosted on a friend's extra space and maintained by her because she's so awesome and nice), legal fees involved with developing my own product, advertising costs for the website, equipment costs (as my one and only laptop is on its last stretch of life and it would be really hard to run an internet business if it died and left me without a computer), home business insurance (as it was recommended to me to have this), I also need money for filing as LLC (I am currently running as Sole Proprietor but not yet legally filed as such and don't want to continue this way anymore than I absolutely must) as well as money for the never ending material requirements. In addition to these, there are also tons of other things I need money for to make this small business of mine work such as business cards, shipping supplies, bulk purchases of art supplies so I can resell them on the site at wholesale price, just to name a few.

My projected startup costs for what I want to do with Deuxmos and the Create-A-Kits is actually around $10,000, but I think that a goal of $3000 will be a really good start to get things going.

(You can see the original Indiegogo campaign for this project here http://www.indiegogo.com/Create-a-hedgehog?a=241271 you might notice that that campaign belongs to a different account than this one. That is because with this account, I am a part of Fractured Atlas' Fiscal Sponsorship program and the email address I used with them and that they used to automatically sign me up for this Indiegogo project is different than the one I used on the original project. I didn't see the point in contacting them to combine the two campaigns onto the same account since the previous account has long since gone past it's deadline anyway. Giving you a link to the original and telling you why it isn't on this same account seems just fine.

 

What We Need

Silicone molding and resin is expensive, so are legal fees, website hosting fees, maintenance fees, and every other thing on the long list of things I need to pay for.

Here's the breakdown of costs (This is what it costs for me. Prices for what it costs for a buyer can be found on the online store of Deuxmos.com for items that are already available for sale.)

~~~~~

These here are ongoing material costs, this is just the price of a single order of each described. But I go through these materials quickly and I have no idea how much I might use in the end since I still have a lot of errors that happen and I need to make new molds all over again sometimes and resin casts that need to be thrown away because of way too many bubbles in it and things like that. However, even with those learning curves using the mold and cast materials, I would still have to make new molds when old ones wear out and buy more resin for the more orders I get.

So basically, buying these materials is more or less neverending.

Moldmaking material pint (2 lbs.) - $30.11

Moldmaking material 1 gallon (18 lbs.) - $172.94

Resin pint (1.9 lbs) - $25.96

Resin 1 gallons (15.4 lbs.) - $85.85

Release agent - $11 a can

Apoxie for making master copies 4 lb. - $35

~~~~

These are also costs that will continue the more that people buy from me, but I have to find the money somewhere to even just get started to be able to offer these items for sale

Tools - $130 for 12 sets (Still need to contact them to find out 'bulk order with intent to resell' costs)

Apoxie clay 1/4 lb. each unit (for resell) - 37 units minimum order for $204

Aves Safety Solvent 1 oz. (for resell - Safety Solvent is for smoothing wet Apoxie clay and cleanup - it's incredibly useful) - $200 minimum bulk purchase

Plus there are more art supplies that I would like to eventually offer for sale on my website, such as quality paints and brushes. And of course I need to pay extra for shipping for all of these supplies and materials.

~~~~

Computer (as I said, I need this before the only one I have dies) - approximately $800 (though I would get the cheapest one I can find of course, but I'd rather set aside too much money than not enough)

Legal and accounting fees - Estimate $2000 (though probably more, Not even kidding... it's a LOT to file LLC and trademarks)

Insurance - $275 a year

Business cards - Approx. $30

Adverting - Approx. $50 a month (I'm guessing blindly at this number as I have no experience to base this on yet)

Annual website expenses, ssl cert, data, merchant account, etc - Approx. $2000

and I know there are lots of other things that I can't think at the moment or just can't think of how much it might cost if I do them (such as costs for going to comic conventions and having a booth to sell my kits - business expenses that will definitely help my sales)

 

 

What You Get

For certain donation amount, you can get your very own kit to customize or blank animal earrings/keychains to paint yourself. Small donation will get a thank you picture of Deuxmos' mascot Lexi. Unlike the first Indiegogo project, I will not offer painted items as I need to spend my time on the project itself.

 

Please make a note or contact me about what it is you would like for your item (i.e. what pieces you want for your kit, what kind of keychain/earrings you want)

 

 

Shipping

Shipping is included in the item price for the U.S. and Canada ONLY. For shipping out of the country, please contact me and I will figure out how much extra shipping will cost to send to you and then you give the appropriate purchase/donation price for the item you want to get.

 

 

Incentive/purchase list


For kit pieces, please check the gallery on this campaign to see what pieces are currently available. For pieces that are not made yet that you would want, please send me a message and I will tell you if that piece type is planned or not. If I think what you are wanting is a good piece type, then I'll probably add it to my list of pieces to make.

$1 - You will get a colored image of Deuxmos' mascot, Lexi, saying thank you.

$6 - unpainted keychain (your choice of cat, dog, sugar glider, rabbit, fox, rat/mouse or Halloween king)

$8 - unpainted earrings, fishhook posts only (your choice of cat, dog, sugar glider, rabbit, fox, rat/mouse or Halloween king)

$15 - 1/4 lb.  Apoxie clay

$45 - Create-A-Kit with your choice of pieces of head, body, left and right arms, shoes, with an unpainted metal disc base. No tools or clay.

$50 - Create-A-Kit with your choice of pieces of animal ears, animal tail, head, body, left and right arms, shoes, with an unpainted metal disc base. No tools or clay.

$60 - Create-A-Kit with your choice of pieces of head, body, left and right arms, shoes, with an unpainted metal disc base Also with 1/4 lb. Apoxie clay

$65 - Create-A-Kit with your choice of pieces of animal ears, animal tail, head, body, left and right arms, shoes, with an unpainted metal disc base Also with 1/4 lb. Apoxie clay

I'm not going to be offering sculpting tools as a part of any perks this time, but if you need them for your kits and you don't have an art store anywhere neaby where you can get some, please message me. I might still have a spare set available to sell to you.

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please be sure to spread the word about this project! Tell your furry friends, anime pals, family members and random people in the forums you hang out at! Tell them about http://deuxmos.com/ and sign yourself up for our forums and get the place lively with conversation and get your friends to join too! The more people spread the word about Deuxmos and Create-A-Kits the better it will be for everyone because the more people that help the project and buy kits, the more features we can add to the website, including putting up the Artist's Corner where skilled customizors can offer their services to other people and make money for themselves doing commissions for those who want a custom figurine but don't want to make it themselves! So if you're good at customizing those garage kits or sculpting, it's in your best interest to get Deuxmos.com running well so you can offer your skills for hire to other people!

If I think what you are wanting is a good piece type, then I'll probably add it to my list of pieces to make.
$1 - You will get a colored image of Deuxmos' mascot, Lexi, saying thank you.
$6 - unpainted keychain (your choice of cat, dog, sugar glider, rabbit, fox, rat/mouse or Halloween king)
$8 - unpainted earrings, fishhook posts only (your choice of cat, dog, sugar glider, rabbit, fox, rat/mouse or Halloween king)
$15 - 1/4 lb.  Apoxie clay
$45 - Create-A-Kit with your choice of pieces of head, body, left and right arms, shoes, with an unpainted metal disc base. No tools or clay.
$50 - Create-A-Kit with your choice of pieces of animal ears, animal tail, head, body, left and right arms, shoes, with an unpainted metal disc base. No tools or clay.
$60 - Create-A-Kit with your choice of pieces of head, body, left and right arms, shoes, with an unpainted metal disc base Also with 1/4 lb. Apoxie clay
$65 - Create-A-Kit with your choice of pieces of animal ears, animal tail, head, body, left and right arms, shoes, with an unpainted metal disc base Also with 1/4 lb. Apoxie clay
I'm not going to be offering sculpting tools as a part of any perks this time, but if you need them for your kits and you don't have an art store anywhere neaby where you can get some, please message me. I might still have a spare set available to sell to you.
 
 
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Please be sure to spread the word about this project! Tell your furry friends, anime pals, family members and random people in the forums you hang out at! Tell them about http://deuxmos.com/ and sign yourself up for our forums and get the place lively with conversation and get your friends to join too! The more people spread the word about Deuxmos and Create-A-Kits the better it will be for everyone because the more people that help the project and buy kits, the more features we can add to the website, including putting up the Artist's Corner where skilled customizors can offer their services to other people and make money for themselves doing commissions for those who want a custom figurine but don't want to make it themselves! So if you're good at customizing those garage kits or sculpting, it's in your best interest to get Deuxmos.com running well so you can offer your skills for hire to other people!

story:
Short Summary

  • This campaign is for Andrea to get her and her model to San Diego Comic Con to show her work in the Her Universe Fashion show. The winner of the fashion show gets to work with Her Universe on a line for their brand. Its a great platform to show her work and to get exposure for future endeavors for both the designer and the model. 
  • Our GOAL is $1500. That covers two plane tickets, a hotel/airbnb, and uber for getting to the venue its self for both the dress rehearsal on friday night and the show on saturday. Any money is good money to be put towards the pot of getting where we need to be. 
  • This opportunity means the world to me. I have been sewing for 15 years and it has been a dream of mine to show my work on a runway. Since I diverged and started in Theater, that dream seemed further away; but this chance is amazing. Thank you for all the help to make my dream come true. 
  • Spread the word! If you don't have the money to help, share it with your friends. I understand not everyone is going to be able to help with money. I also offer my sewing services (alterations, custom orders/costumes, ect.) if you prefer having something in exchange for the help. Email me AT AMOHNESORGE@GMAIL.COM with any inquires.

Short Summary

This campaign is for Andrea to get her and her model to San Diego Comic Con to show her work in the Her Universe Fashion show. The winner of the fashion show gets to work with Her Universe on a line for their brand. Its a great platform to show her work and to get exposure for future endeavors for both the designer and the model. 
Our GOAL is $1500. That covers two plane tickets, a hotel/airbnb, and uber for getting to the venue its self for both the dress rehearsal on friday night and the show on saturday. Any money is good money to be put towards the pot of getting where we need to be. 
This opportunity means the world to me. I have been sewing for 15 years and it has been a dream of mine to show my work on a runway. Since I diverged and started in Theater, that dream seemed further away; but this chance is amazing. Thank you for all the help to make my dream come true. 
Spread the word! If you don't have the money to help, share it with your friends. I understand not everyone is going to be able to help with money. I also offer my sewing services (alterations, custom orders/costumes, ect.) if you prefer having something in exchange for the help. Email me AT AMOHNESORGE@GMAIL.COM with any inquires.
